3.description: I order a Italian beef sandwich and boy was it nasty yuck....i usually order pizza but wanted to try something different and lets just say staying within your comfort zone at this pizza place is a must!!!!! Other than my food being disgusting the service was good or at least what you would expect from them

1.description: Ugh. This place is absolutely the WORST. First I ordered my food and was charged for it at 5:50pm. My food wasn't delivered until 7:40. Upon arrival the driver obnoxiously said,"I better get a tip for this!" Fast forward to when we opened the food. The pizza was literally stone cold. No melted cheese, no steam or moisture on the box. Nada! Cold cracker like pizza. We also ordered rib tips and loaded cheese fries. Cold cold cold. We call the restaurant and got transferred around about 4 times. They did not want to do a refund after I insisted that I wanted my money back. They agreed to send us our food in 15-20 minutes. 45 minutes later, my food shows up. Waste of $45. NEVER again! Save your time and money!

2.description: I have bought so much pizza from Barney's over the years that it greaves me to write this review. I so want Barneys to be a place I can recommend and patronize, but alas, no more. After yet another 90+ minute wait for pizza, I opened the box to behold perhaps the ugliest looking pizza I have ever seen. The sauce had been spread over the edge and was now dried paste. The cheese, unfortunately did not make it that far as though it was afraid of the edges?!  I called Barneys to talk to the manager but never got to as the person who answered said the order only took an hour and that I got what I ordered, so what's the problem. She finally agreed to pass me on to the manager at which point she put me on hold and then dropped my call. Bad form. Our neighborhood deserves better, ya'll. Tired of Austin always getting the booty bread. We can expect more and demand better. Sadly, I will be taking my dollars out of the neighborhood yet again. No more Barneys for me until they can get their act together and start delivering great pizza again. Btw, I posted a picture of my 90-minute wait pizza on the page. See for yourself.

5.description: Great Pizza !! Great staff, Great company and all around Great service !! I would definitely come back to eat in or take out ! It's good to see we still have some stand out Chicago pizza joints left in the city, I'm tired of seeing little ceasers and Pizza Hut garbage. Extra cheese, well done ! I'm in !

6.description: The worst customer service. Very unprofessional. Cannot get a order or address correct. Smh

7.description: Food is ok, nothing to brag about, just something quick and convenient when you're starving and not mobile. I ordered a pepperoni pizza and some wings. The girl on the phone was professional, but the delivery boy was rude. It took him 1.5 hrs to get to me. He calls me to let me know that he was on his way and that I needed to be outside because he was very busy and had other deliveries to make. Not something you tell a customer, especially after taking 2 hrs to deliver a pizza. He calls again minutes later to tell me he's outside, which he wasn't. I was standing outside in the cold and told him no car has came down the block yet, then he says he'll be there in a few minutes. When he comes down the block, he passes right by my house while I'm flagging him down. He parks all the way down the street and beckons me to walk all the down to were he was. I just had leg surgery, mind you. People don't deliver to your doorstep anymore, huh? The pizza isn't worth all of that for me to go back, so that is the last time I order from them again.

8.description: Food was okay.  They have now moved their prices downward to compete with Little Cesars Pizza.

9.description: I'm bumping Barney's up to 5 stars after my past interactions with them last week.  Talking to them on a cell phone that kept losing service, and running all around the building trying to confirm orders and get money, the guy on the phone wasn't just patient with me, he was understanding and just plain nice. Good service & friendliness goes a long way in my book. Pizza was delivered hot and on time.  WIthin a time span of barely 10 minutes, 4 jumbo  pizzas (at buy one get one free price) were completely devoured.  Well done Barneys.

0.description: Great food for the price. It is always busy though. I love the cheese pizza. Service could be better but that's the location. What ever you do don't get the gyros. The meat is dry as hell.

4.description: I have a review, this place is very unprofessional with zero accountability for the piss poor service given within the black community. we as a people of consumers need not continue to accept and patronize such business's within our community. make those that receive our patronage accountable for the services unacceptable and beneath what we deserve as consumers.

0.description: The Good: holy mother of alcohol!!! This place is as cheap as it gets, it's also pretty much always open. Cash only but if you know the neighborhood, you'll understand. Massive private lot and the staff are actually really nice. There's cops and armed guards here round the clock so if you're brave enough to venture here, you're reasonably safe. HahaThe Bad: It's ghetto. Obviously. The Ugly: This is a rough, to say it lightly, neighborhood. You may hear gunshots and sirens a few times while in line but coming from a rough part of South Central as a kid, it doesn't phase me. Just jump off the highway, mind your own business, and enjoy. Cheers!!

Granted...  this carry out joint looks a little scary and it's in Austin but don't let that keep you away.  The gyros are really good I suggest ordering everything,  hold the lettuce. The owner charges a high fee if you pay with credit so just use ca$h.

This Family Dollar location represented the beginning of a business boom on Division and Central Avenues.Although the location has had it's share of issues concerned with being one of the first and the few, the employees are friendly, polite and resourceful.The Family Dollar location has also done considerable outreach to employee community members.

1.description: I visited this place on Friday evening I ordered a 10 piece dinner(Chicken/Perch) I got it home and the Perch was RAW!!! I immediately called and talked with a man who told me to bring it back. Welp! I went in and immediately was treated deplorably! I told him that he should replace the entire meal. He shouted "No just the Fish!!! I told him I traveled a distance to return the food and his reply was "Oh nice neighborhood". I immediately pressed record and recorded the entire exchange as well as photos. The customer service was awful!! Save your money folks!! A big fat NEGATIVE!

2.description: The place is not clean and they have replaced the catfish with cheaper swai fish and the difference in taste is evident.  It sucks that so many places don't even have catfish anymore and aren't letting customers know what fish they are REALLY getting....

0.description: Going into this Whales was definitely an experience I would have given this place 5 stars because my catfish tails were so Jam good it was cooked to perfection.  It was fresh and flaky like fish should be and the lemon pepper sprinkled on top made it even better. My sister had the perch and she said it was absolutely delicious. The reason I had to knock it down to 3 stars is because they were slow, it was dirty, the menu on the wall were opened so you couldn't really see what they had and the hand written ones they had all over were a bit confusing at times.People coming in and smoking cigarettes, drinking etc. but I have to say they did ask them to leave when they did so I don't ding the business for other people being rude. I would suggest you call your order in instead of ordering at the window because they stay crowded from what I understand and especially on a Saturday.  I mean that is a testament to how good the food is from this Whales.  I mean people were ordering pans of wings, and fish like they were giving away a fresh 100 dollar bill with each order.So overall I will order from them again when I am in the area but I will make sure its a call in order because they do have quality in their food they just need to work on the inside of the restaurant.  Enjoy!!!

1.description: Wonderful service and friendly staff. Inexpensive and clean place. Walk-Ins welcome. Love it here!

2.description: if I could give 0 stars i would. the first time i went last week i was a little wary because the didn't even have me wash my hands first!  but i have a job interview the next day (I'm a hair stylist) so my presentation had to be on point right down to freshly manicured nails. i was just going to get a basic manicure but my nails weren't at a attractive length at the moment so i decide to get some enhancements (acrylics) to extend them a little. i requested them to be kept thin and balanced so that they look naturalI was then told i should get "gel" cuz its "more better" and natural. i inquired about the type of gel they use. is it acrylic and a gel top coat or actual gel? even tho i knew the answer. they informed me it was gel powder. WRONG! as a cosmetologist i know there is no sure thing as gel powder. they could even tell me what brand acrylic or gel they use. so i proceeded with the acrylic. short and painted white. They looked nice besides the fact they looked like chicklets gum..lolbut it was fine, i could shape them to my liking at home. i just needed the acrylic on (something i could have done myself) but i dont own a file and hand filing is so time consuming coupled with the fact my dad hates the acrylic smell.1 WEEK LATERthe nails are seriously lifting, i dont have time to travel all over the world for a fill because i start my new job tomorrow. and i can't have the lifting because hair get caught under. I'm thinking i'll have to file them of course. no biggie, a fill is only 13 bucks.the technician was RUDE, he commented about how they were done badly. when i rebutted and said YES, they were done HERE last week JULY 30th he had nothing to say. he removed 3 nails. added tips on crooked, chopped off the length, slapped on acrylic and said $20. the girl next to me had to explain he charged me for replacing the fucked up nails..lolhe then painted them sloppy but on a super shiny topcoat that disguised the dips and dents that he left. just discovered by me because i left in a hurry. why did i leave before my nails were even dry you ask? the atmosphere was horrid... a man came into the shop selling bootlegged DVDS and then huge spill happened at the pedicure chairs. the man then mopped up the spill for 5mins with half his BUTTCRACK hanging out the top of his pants. i could not make this stuff up if i wanted to...lolso now I'm home taking off my nail polish about to use a polar block to smooth and shape my nails CORRECTLY. the job was SO bad that i could not fix them  with a nails file alone. nails do not match in length or shape at all. he also got acrylic on my cuticle which will cause more lifting.they do not have to worry about me going back, which I'm sure is no sweat off their back cuz there are plenty of others who will go and get subpar service.

0.description: This shop has just been taken over 2 months by the new owner, and they do awesomeeee job. You should check out their designs on their website. Watching them doing the design is like watching an art show. Go for Koi if you like funky n crazy stuff. Go for Kyle if you're in decent n elegant thing. Take advantage on their promotion with $16 for pedicure or arcrylic fullset.

12.description: Large portions, they take credit, and you take it to go.Pros:Large portionsMost orders come with friesFriendly serviceStreet parking is freeCons:Carry-out ONLYIt's not closer to my homeThis place is pretty great.  After the amazing review in the Chicago Reader and watching Kevin Spacey chow down on "House of Cards" I couldn't wait to try Ben's.  The place conjures up endless thoughts of divey food at a great price that hopefully only you know about.  Be prepared to feast.  We ordered a slab and a half, an extra order of fries, and were easily filled.  I shouldn't have eaten so much but I love to clean my plate.Eating ribs is a very debatable topic so I can't tell you it's the best ribs I've ever had because everyone likes them a bit differently.  I *can* tell you the ribs are very thick, soft to bite, moist, juicy, and have a medium-like hold on the bone.  Personally I felt that the ribs and the sauce work in concert to give you a great experience.  I've had ribs where the meat alone was award-winning and the sauce was an added bonus but that was at Naperville RibFest and those vendors are TOO far away.  Don't shy away, order from Ben's, and plan where you're going to eat so your meat stays hot and your fries stay crispy.BBQ sauce is mild or spicy.  Both are great, spicy sauce won't stop you from enjoying the flavorful cooking.Pork Ribs (full slab): $21soft meat: not falling off the bone but holding on ever so ready for your hungerFries:crinkly, not skinny, usually includedWings: $3 (three pieces w/ fries)Didn't try these but they are limited 2 orders per customer and available almost every day except Saturdays.

7.description: I thought the ribs were too tough. My mother had them last year and they were more tender than this batch. They really jacked up my back teeth. We ordered on Sunday, the day before memorial day. It was so slow, it took about half an hour. They put sauce on the two orders of ribs, even though it was clearly specified that for one order, sauce was to go on the side. I had the hot link meal, and darn it, they were hooooooooooooot!!!! I could barely eat one, and I like really spicy food, like when your nose runs, this was way worse than that, they were headache-spicy.Poor mother suffered while eating hers. The barbecue sauce they put on there tasted really good with the fries and bread, but it seemed spicy as well. I would consider ordering them again, but I would have some ibuprofen on hand.

20.description: I'm saying. So I'm coming back from Maywood yo. And I'm hungry, like a wolf, and I smell smoke, good smoke. BBQ smoke. so like a bloodhound I engage and follow it to it's source, a little cue house on the corner, son.I'm talking bout first of all, I ordered an extra large tip cause I'm thinking. They probably on some Honey 1 BBQ sh*t  where they be steady ripping off hipsters and yuppies who don't know no better  and me too who do know better but didn't  have no choice because Honey 1 BBQ is the only real BBQ joint in Logan Square. But I don't F*ck with them no more, son. Yea, I can understand Honey 1 BBQ  "coming-up on a come-up", by getting some clandestine  "reparations" for 400 years of slavery by  over charging white folks for miserly proportions. But I'm a Brotha!  So how you gonna juke me?  But then I remember that this is da hood, son.  And in da hood you can't get away with steady ripping folks off unless you're a JP Morgan Chase, CitiBank or Bank of America investment banker or an elected official.  But any way,  the price was only 13: 89 son instead of the 20 dollars they charge at Honey's!  And my man behind the triple reinforced bullet proof( for all you predatory jackers out there, go else ware!) counter top window, comes back with a Leaning Tower of Pisa made of firm yet tender rip tips dripping with hot and mild sauce, and, not just one, not just two, but THREE slices of Wonder Bread perched atop of it like a White LL Cool J Kangol Cap, you-know-what-I'm-saying? I'm saying though!  So I get it home right, cause it can barely fit in the boot of my scooter and I got a huge cactus also for the ride home, but that's another story. So any way, I get home and unveil this rip tip tower. I'm talking taller than the steeple of the Mormon Temple that's about five miles north of Washington D.C,son!  D.C. ain't go no BBQ, but that's another story.  Any way, so I sample on of these savories.  First I get a powerful burst of hickory infused with cherry wood with a deep hint of allspice. I thought it was cinnamon at first. Then I tasted the spicy zest and saw saw an allspice pepper in the sauce, boyyyyy! I ain't lying. How clever is that?I ate four of them mutha F*ckers cooked to perfection. I'm talking moist grayish pink on the inside and gently charred on the outside holding it together like a sandwich. And after the third, my belly was swelling, so I put the rest away for tomorrow's dinner, keyed.  I'm saying. Now lets add up the stars. The taste and quality of the tips, get the highest rating, three stars, son. On value, especially during what is the second American Depression, three stars. Sauce,three stars, and during these pandemic violent times in Chicago, what has become a very important rating, Thug Love, zero stars! Seriously, I saw the white socks and white T-shirt man and the Boot leg C.D man, and the scrape metal man, but no thugs hanging and or slinging, and this is a corner spot, yo. So you might as well get there son, I'm saying. On a historical note,the late great Andre Williams  must have had these tips when he wrote and sang his legendary songs........ "Rib Tips Part 1 & 2"Guh Guh Gimme some of dem RIB TIPS!Ooh wee, ooh weeOoh wee, ooh wee." These rib tips show is good!Ooh wee, ooh weeOoh wee, ooh wee.Gimme some of yours andI'll give you some of mineOoh wee, ooh weeOoh wee, oooooooh.........RIB  TIPS!May I have a toothpick, pleaseuhmmm uhmm uhmmRIB TIPS!"

19.description: I stopped in for the large tip and hot link combo. This is some of the best bbq in the city! Do not miss this! Strictly take out. I think i ate for 3 days with the portion size. Price is great. Wings are also good. People are friendly. Good people working hard making good food. Dont let the neigborhood keep you from stopping in. This area overall is safe but This place deserves better than the low life criminals that occasionally wander the area. I have been there a half a dozen times now. Worth the trip.

1.description: Terrible lg catfish for $14 and it was cooked in old grease made me sick the entire next day

2.description: I didn't even make it to ordering the food.  Reading the reviews about the service made me decide to call in my order.  You would think that would be a good idea.  Wrong!! A guy answered the phone and then started stalking to a friend.  Didn't say hold plz.  I was repeating hello.  By the fourth hello he returned to the phone and said "what's up".  That was the end of my relationship with this business. Shame.

9.description: This place has some of the best barbecued anything in town! The link & tip combo is one of my favorites. The chicken wings with mild sauce is a close second and lastly I love the pizza puff dipped in mild sauce. It's just something about the bread when it's smashed into the food with sauce! :) Two reasons why I gave it 4 out of 5 stars. *The price of the food (especially the links) keep going up drastically. *If you do not call your order in you can easily wait 30-45 minutes for your order. In waiting at least you know it is fresh. Do not let the neighborhood run you away. The most that will happen to you is the bootleg man will try to sell you DVDs, CDs, socks or towels.

6.description: Barbecue so good, you'll break promises.Monday's commute home from work. I'm eight hours deep as a newly-minted vegetarian, and I'm yearning for flesh. Tasty flesh. Enter Ben's BBQ.In this corner, from the West side of Chicago, wearing a corner brick facade, weighing in at 500 pounds of barbecuing artist(s) soaking wet, standing in a kitchen narely 30 square feet, sporting a bullet proof glass grill... it's Ben's BBQ.In the other corner, from the South side of Chicago, wearing business casual clothes, with a bone-dry earth mass of over 100 kilos, sitting in his car in northwest side traffic, and sporting a grimace for breaking his promise to fight the urge to go carnal - and losing that fight, again, before the bell has even rung... it's me.No contest.But I had my dignity. Yes, I lost. And I'm ordering a large rib tips with hot links to go with another beef ribs for good measure. I'm detoured an extra hour driving through parts of the city as unknown to me as Andrew Zimmern's favorite pig parts.So I promised myself. I will fight the urge to eat Ben's BBQ while driving home.No contest. I was hungry. I missed meat. It was barbecue. I sweat. And then I teared, into, the bag, because I threw in towel, before the bell even rung. Two promises broken. So much for word is bond. Ben's BBQ reduced my bond rating to junk status.

18.description: Awesome rib tips, hot links and chicken wings, oh my!!!!

10.description: I have had a lot of barbecue. This is some of the best damn barbecue you will ever have. It is without a doubt the best barbecue I have had in the last year.Some friends and I biked here from Logan Square, ordered a huge amount of meat and ate in a nearby park. You can't miss the place - it's the only storefront with a smokestack coming out of the roof. We got pork ribs, rib tips, hot links, okra, two sides of coleslaw, and two peach cobblers - all for $51 and change. Split that 6 ways, and it was an amazing meal for almost nothing. You just cannot go wrong here. I think I found nirvana from the hot links alone.The staff was great! The woman behind the counter gave us approximately one bazillion wet naps, all of which were needed.Ben's is carry-out only. I don't think they sell any drinks from behind the counter, but there are some vending machines with soda. (Didn't matter to me, I had a water bottle.)As others have said, don't worry about the neighborhood. I'm sure the bulletproof glass is there for a reason, but we didn't run into any trouble at all.My wife is vegetarian but I'm going to find an excuse to come back here anyway.

13.description: Good rib tips! Sadly, the service sucks. Each time I go there, there is an issue. The staff has more fun talking and playing around with each other than they do waiting on the customers. The owner tried hard to convince me to come back after I stormed out after waiting for over an hour for an order that I called in well in advance. He even met me at my car and promised me that he my "next order" would be on him. I told him his staff is pathetic and it isn't worth the aggravation (not even for free). After talking to my friends and family, I was convinced to give Ben's another try. It's been weeks so I called to remind the owner of his promise and he remembered the ordeal in detail. However, instead of him giving me what I had before, he tried to convince me that 1 small order of rib tips would be sufficient enough to make up for the 2 large tip orders I had the night of the worst and last case (there have been others). It's one thing to have good food and another to have integrity and good service. The service at Ben's is horrible. They are located less than 5 minutes from my house and now I will have to go 15 minutes out the way to get good ribs and good service. Coleman's here I come!!!

17.description: This place has some of the best rib tips I've ever tasted. They are a little pricey but its worth the money! I've only ordered rib tips, but they have been delicious every time! Good service, great food and they take plastic which is rare in the 'hood!

15.description: My new favorite rib joint. Smoked low & slow, the smoky flavor of the rib tips is unbeatable, well at least on the west side of Chicago. The sauce is tangy & flavorful with just a tiny hint of sweetness, not syrupy sweet like you often find. I haven't had the pleasure of tasting other menu items yet, I just can't not get those darn tasty tips. Lol. The staff people are very pleasant & welcoming. I recommend you check 'em out, soon!

0.description: Very good food, clean environment,  kind Peoples working, Great Rib tips very juicy. Good service, get you in and out quickly. They have good cat fish, with mild sauce on it. Good!!!

5.description: This is the closest rib place close to my house, the ribs are mouth watery good. The only thing is that the wait is a longer than most rib places I go to but I guess good things come to those who wait. You wont regret coming here

11.description: Right now Ben's is the quiet contender for King of Ribs in Chicago.  The food is just that good.Many Bar-B-Que places in Chicago are about what they use to be (Kennys, Colemans, Leons, Carson's & Robinson's) while serving mediocre food hoping you remember the old memories of when they serve good ribs but Ben's  is about right now the present. I ordered the sampler (tips, wing & 3 fries) and took my first bite...wow. A nice taste that is reserved for cookouts with tasty sauces. I hope Ben's only keep the good flavors with time and not become "use to be" Place. Pros: Good Ribs, Great Rib Tips, Good Prices, Daily SpecialCons: Take out only, Not enough fries with specials (3 fries)Bottomline: I discovered a new BBQ joint near Oak Park that is simply good. Give Ben's a try!

8.description: Finally catching up on my reviews.Stopped here after a Hawks game. Ordered Ribs, Chicken, Rib tip / Hot link combo. Took a long time to get the food even though there was only one other customer.The three of us sampling the food all thought the same: The BBQ was just blah. None of it was very good. Meat was dry, sauce was not very tasty. Sad but true. Many better BBQ joints better than this one.Cheers to all

3.description: Slightly disappointed. Mostly from a value standpoint. Smoking woodys had good food at a good price point. This place $18 for a large tip link combo? Ok. But it barely fed a big brotha like myself. Food flavoring is decent not slap the cook finger licking good. If only they weren't so stingy with the sauce. For $18 you better be making it rain with the sauce. I recommend the mild sauce the hot sauce is a bit watery. And take into the account to call ahead of time. They do take awhile so if you walk in come patient because the place is pretty popular. The people are the counter are very nice. I know it's a down economy but throw in a couple extra tips or links from time to time ya heard?

14.description: The tips were average at best. Now $14.99 for an X-Large order. Fries on the bottom completely swimming in sauce. For an XL, not really a boatload of tips. Sauce was nothing special- big on the vinegar. Should have got it on the side. Staff was very friendly. May go again if driving by, and only if I can get a quick parking spot.

4.description: This place is so slow it took about forty minutes to get my order. I order a larger turkey tip and link combo. The food was okay but these people were slow and unprofessional by airing out there business like they didn't have costumers present. Will never come here again. Laymon's on Washington and Kilpatrick will get my business from now on.

1.description: The food was ok. I ordered the chicken and waffles. I Had to fry up my waffles because it was soggy ( so were the hash Browns) and soaked with butter. Chicken was good. Everything else was pretty standard (eggs, bacon, sausage, French toast) I prob could've made myself a better breakfast.

2.description: I haven't been here but I wanted to add to yelp I have it 5 star bc the Chicago tribune wrote it up as a Chicago top 50 must try. The chicken and grits and Mac n cheese were highlighted.

0.description: I was new to Grub hub and placed an order with Emma's. I had a great experience from the confirmation of my order by email and a follow up call  from someone at the restaurant to my food being delivered on time and finally enjoying everything I ordered. I will order again and look forward to visiting  the restaurant.

3.description: staff is nice however you can't choose who you want to cut your hair its first come first serve and who ever has an open chair is the chair you will be sitting in. the owner is a real asshole very rude and  flirts with every woman who comes in their even though it seems like they are uncomfortable and rejects his advances nicely he keeps going. I've also seen him treat his workers like crap thats why its always new faces every few months one of the very few reasons i don't go here anymore

1.description: Great place to get a haircut!!! I just got a bald fade and beard trim for $22.  I didn't wait for more than ten minutes. The cut didn't last too long and the waiting area was full when I came in! This place is great for families and specializes in a variety of styles!!!

2.description: A nice barber shop with several chairs and no wait It is very clean and well run.

0.description: Have not been disappointed in the least! I have been there once before, came in a few months later and they remembered who I was! Treated me like a king.

4.description: Good barber shop young staff very emotional. So be kind to your assigned barber.  If u arrive 10 mins. before close they will take u with a smile.  barber is very quick and they get the job done ASAP!  check they work they are willing to fix mistakes.  Most barbers are recent graduates or returning to the field. The owner is rude but fare...like a grumpy old man... Has the personality of "he is the boss!" cheap price & professional service!

3.description: Ok, let's start with how picky I am about my pedicures. I've gone to the same lady forever and will not hesitate to tell them if the service is sub par or I think they need to up their level of sanitation.On to Bottom nails. First off, the salon was nominated for a Hoodie Award this year. Pretty impressive considering it's a nationwide contest. I couldn't find it at first bc YELP had their OLD address listed (they've moved to Parkland & Chicago ave.) but I called and found them. Walking in I wasn't sure how things would go but I put my name on the list and searched for a color.  I wasn't feeling inspired so I let the tech pick my color. She was a cute college grad with lots of personality. She picked out a pretty goldish green which I would have never had the cahonies to try on my own. She did a great job and really tried to make my visit enjoyable. Very personable :)Next the owner did my pedicure. Sadly  the infamous Bryan was out for the day. So I'll have to go back and check him out. The pedi room was seperate and intimate with 2 service chairs and a tv. I was the only one getting one so I had the room and tv remote to myself. I won't bore u with the details but I soaked for 15 min and she spent at least 10 minutes a piece buffing each heel. At least! My feet were a little tender when she was done, but it beats the nasty dreaded razor (which she told me is illegal in IL). Overall, I would definitely go back, especially if they weren't too busy. I was there for a couple hours but I felt like it was worth it because they had top of the line nail art, good prices, and they are black owned and operated which is really rare. Give them a shot!

1.description: So, the tech that I complimented decided to write saying she didn't do my nails lol and that the picture that I posted with the caption 'what I wanted' was her work, it is not ma'am. A simple GOOGLE search of Hello Kitty Nail design would prove you didn't do this, don't lie. And she also decided to say money was issue? Ma'am, no one likes their coins played with, and you better believe for the job you did, I could've and should've paid $2.00 for it and would've still been upset. Get it together! Bye Felicia.

0.description: I have to say the female and even male that work in this establishment has exceptional skills when it comes to doing nails. The attitude might not match but let's face it we do live in the NORTH.... Just Saying. Unfortunately, I do not go there anymore for my nails as I have found somewhere that is closer to where I stay that does nails and is just as skilled but that would never take away from me going back had I ever had a problem with where I am currently going.

2.description: Unprofessional. 2 hour wait for eyebrows didn't even get wat I came for . U get wat u pay for. SMH never again.

5.description: Ok, I finally went to Bottom Nail on Christmas Eve LOL. After all the holiday shopping, crazy work schedule, poor economy, growing violence and debt in IL, parking meter and red light camera fees, and so on, I decided to treat myself. Jackie did my nails and I am so pleased with the professional job. My cuticles were HORRIBLE and she took the extra time and steps to make them presentable again. The nail art is truly art. I saw a young lady at Jewel or Walgreens in River Forest about a year ago and her nail art was exquisite, well she told me about Bottom Nail. The art is one of a kind. I will return for a pedicure when I get my fill in. They will be at their new location (right down the street).So ladies, treat yourself and forget about your troubles. Oh, as everyone knows I keep it real. Don't be afraid to go to that area to get your nails done. We need to support businesses that do a good job and I highly recommend Bottom Nail.

6.description: My mom and I just went back for pedicures for the first time at their new location. I'm happy to report, as I told Bryan "The legend continues".Maybe it's because he's a strong guy, I don't know, but he is the master of the foot file. The best pedicures I've ever had were at Asha, Sebastian's (in Mexico), and Bryan at The Bottom.The pros: Bryan charges far less, but does nearly as well as Asha's most expensive pedicure. The best bang for your buck.The cons: The ambiance leaves much to be desired. It's not a "relax and be pampered" type setting. It's a nail shop, and not the same as being at the spa.He's not always in shop, so you still have to call to make appointments. But you can't beat his quality of work for that price.

7.description: Okay so to all my ladies at The Bottom Nail Salon .... this ones for you ! If you are unique and do not follow "the crowd" when it comes to your nails, this is most definitely where you want to be ! I have been going to this same nail salon for 15 years now and I love it . All the girls are talented and they are very skilled at what they do. This is nail art that includes having outrageous , classy, sophisticated, pretty or just plain nails designed. The nail art consists of painting with paint brushes. If the colors you pick are ugly the nail tech will tell you so ! And if it 's flyy then you'll hear that as well .Personally I get a lot of inlay work done , that's glitter inside the acrylic with a UV coating which makes the colors pop like crazy & 3-D nail art as well . They can put anything in your nails or on them , the highest caliber of talent you'll see for nails in a professional salon. So big ups to Stephanie ( My tech ) Wanda ( My tech ) Angie , Jackie ( The Owner ) Gina , Brian and all the other nail techs at The Bottom Photos of my nails are on my profile....It's a good time & if you want peace and tranquility stay at home ...a good laugh is what you're sure to get for those of us that like having fun!

8.description: Best pedicure and nail art you'll find in the entire city of Chicago & probably the entire state!I've been coming to the Bottom for over 7 years and I've been through 3 nail techs within that time. If you ever want a relief from the corporate world and want to know what's going on in this city, the Bottom is the place to be. They do great work and they will give you the honest truth about things.Their pedicures are THE BEST IN TOWN!!!Brian does the best job! No razors & he is not ashamed to tell you your feet are JACKED. I need that type of honesty these days. He is VERY clean and makes no short cuts in doing the best job.The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because sometimes, you may want to be in piece when getting your pedi & nails done and the Bottom is NOT the place to go for tranquility. Sorry, its the truth.

9.description: This place was such a blast & I loved the work Toya did for me. Came in for mani-pedis with my girl for her birthday; she got Jackie and loved her work as well. We didn't end up going for the pedicures since it seemed to be a bit too slowly for our schedule, but we are definitely making this a "Day Out with The Girls" spot!THANKS

10.description: I am a repeat customer here with the nail tech Alicia. She is always polite, took her time and does nails exceptionally well. The people here are friendly and always chatting about with each other. I also like the fact that they have the Tv on something of interest.  I would recommend the bottom to anyone looking to have a quality nail set done.

4.description: So badly wanted to love this place since it's close to my house and from the reviews I've read and from what I've heard from others I know. However, if an establishment is not carrying themselves professionally, I just cannot have the patience for it. I was turned off from the beginning just by giving the place a call. I called just to ask if walk-ins were welcomed just in case before I make the trip and the woman who answered the phone was so monotone and sounded just unfriendly. However, I proceeded anyway (btw, walk-ins are welcome, no appointments). So I walk in for the first time, didn't get greeted, I just stood there awkwardly and said hello to the first tech I saw. She gave a dry "Hello," looking at me like I'm crazy. I was told there was a sign up sheet, so I went on signed in. Now perhaps I should've visited on a week day instead of a Saturday; it was quite crowded and I had about 5 people ahead of me. I think every customer that was being served was getting acrylic nails done, so that also could have contributed to the long wait, but I was sitting in there for over an hour without service. I didn't follow through with my simple mani/pedi that I wanted because I just was turned all the way off and felt like I would never be served. I didn't see how they were gonna follow the sign up sheet because I didn't see any of the nail techs get up and check it after they were done with a client. So yeah, I'm sure the techs are very talented and creative, I believe what I hear, however, when you don't have that professionalism and that good quality customer service, some people are not even going to give your establishment a chance. Will not be giving this place a second chance.

0.description: The best tacos and super-tacos from a local hole in the wall fast food spot on the westside.  Their tacos are the best. It's the only thing that I ever get from here. Place is nice and clean as well. Beware of local riff-raff standing out in front and panhandlers. I just wish they accepted credit cards, but I can understand why.

1.description: Great salon w/ comfortable and welcoming atmosphere. Stylist is very knowledgable about natural hair and can do lots of different styles.

0.description: Awesome establishment...

About a week after my negative experience I received a friendly and apologetic email from the owner of this establishment about my bad experience there. In the email he assured me that he'd make sure to fix the issues I had expressed in my previous review. He also listed for me all of the prices of the hats there, most of which were under the price or just the same as hats at lids. The hats that were pricier were hats with custom brims. I was glad for the clarification and reassurance. I went in a day later and to my surprised the issues I'd mentioned in my previous review were gone, no more crappy display shoes and odor thank you! And the first thing that I saw when I walked in was the owner Robert hard at work and fixing up the displays on the floor himself. This let me know how dedicated he is to his business and how sincere and serious he is about custom satisfaction. After speaking with him in person he convinced me to come by the store again. I came back and bought a very nice hat. Thank goodness for good owners like Robert. I'm definitely a fan and will be back.

3.description: Absolutely horrendous. I read the other reviews and being in the area after leaving a bar, I thought to check them out. Ordered steak and eggs. I suspect they're serving up horse meat. Took a couple of bites and gave up. Greasy and odd tasting. Threw the mess in the garbage.

1.description: Food is cooked very fast. The menu has about 10 items that are $10 and below. Great price for the hefty servings.  Only con is that they try to sneak more money out of you asking, are you thirsty or would you like cheese? They never said it was extra. I thought it was complimentary.

2.description: Great, quick dine-in & take out for breakfast. Huge portions & inexpensive. Cooks are friendly.

9.description: I've been going to G&N for years. Their food prices are very competitive and the taste of the food is outstanding. I often order the exact same thing when I go there, and if the standard cook is there he already knows my order, which helps me get out quicker.  The Denver Omelet is one of the best I've had.  The steak sandwich actually starts with a steak on the grill.If you remember a time when you could order at the counter and eat there too, then this place will hold a nostalgic place in your day.  And the coffee is very good and always has just the right amount of cream and sugar.Keep up the good work!!  Oh and congrats to the owner GUS for having the street named after him.  He threw a nice bash to celebrate the event by providing free food for the locals in attendance.

10.description: Well they did raise their price a bit but its still the best breakfast grill in the Chicagoland area.

4.description: So much food! It's enough for multiple meals for me. Plus, it's fresh and gets cooked in front of you, so no secrets or anything, which I really like.I've had everything on the menu and haven't come across a food I didn't like. It's all delicious. I especially love the gyros! Yum! :)Cash only, but so worth it. I wish there were more places like G and N.

6.description: This place is great if you keep odd hours, like working nights, or were out partying to the wee hours of the morning. Its also a good spot if you happen to be in the area, or live near hear. This is a cash only establishment so have some money on hand. The items on the menu are moderately priced, but you do get a lot of food for your money, it can actually be split into two meals. They don't have an extensive menu but what they do have on the menu they do well. I had the Denver omelette and boy was it delicious,  it came with a big mound of hash browns and some toast. It was just what I needed after a long night at work. I couldn't finish it all but I saved the rest for lunch and it tasted just as good then. And the staff of two that was in there at that time (4:30ish) were very polite and friendly. I hate to say that you wouldn't expect that given the time of morning and the area, but I didn't and was pleasantly surprised. I would go back here during the wee hours of morning or later in the day during normal people hours.

12.description: Great place, I've been eating there for many years

5.description: Ordered the Denver omelet and was surprised at how huge it was.  2 meals worth of food for $7 even. It also came with fresh cut potatoes (hash browns), and 2 slices of buttered toast.  Definitely going here again

13.description: This Breakfast restaurant is truly 'a diamond in a rough neighborhood'- but if you are ever driving west on North Ave. stop by this place and mingle with the locals ; )....They are open pretty late 2-3am, but you generally have to order through the glass window after 10pm. If you ever drop by try the Denver omelet (believe me you'll eat for 2 days) or the steak sandwich with fries (yes, they serve more than just breakfast)

11.description: Denver omlette the best n cheap hamm off the bone and pancakes taste like cake yummm ...its in the hood but locals dont bother everyones there for the food

8.description: This place has been here for years, I love their breakfast platter and home made hash browns. I usually get the ham of the bone breakfast with over easy eggs and hash browns which comes with toast as well for the great price of $5.75. Can't beat that plus hey cook it right in front of you. They also have oh we breakfast options, like omelets and grilled cheese sandwiches.

0.description: Delicious Breakfast pancakes ham & cheese eggsI would definitely recommend this place to anyone this place has the best breakfast

7.description: G&N is the King of Breakfast and has been a pillar in the Austin/Cragin community for years! You can get the best Grilled Ham and Cheese sandwich here. Their pancakes are huge, you get plenty of potatoes and they do not cheat you on meat. Did I mention the food is VERY REASONABLE?!?!?! If you're looking for a great breakfast or a late night Patty Melt this is the place to come to. Do not let the neighborhood fool you!

0.description: If I hadn't gone to another Dots I would have given this store an extra star but after seeing how put together the other Dots was...I had to deduct a star!I mean the staff was great but the selection wasn't as put together or polished as the one on 95th street!They also didn't have the same sale of taking an extra 40% off of clearance items like the other store!Would I go back, yes but it wouldn't be my first choice!!

3.description: You can call your order in, wait thirty minutes before you go and get it and the order still won't be ready once you get there! I love their Tacos but I hate the service! Sometimes they are rude, and you always have to wait forever for your food. However once you get your food you will be a Happy camper! But beware of the hot sauce they put on tacos, I think it's straight from Hell because it's so hot! I always go for the mild sauce! Good food, service sucks.

1.description: I grew up eating these tacos, and they are still the best tacos ever!! Anytime someone is going to Chicago, I beg them to bring me back as many taco as they can!!

2.description: Stopped in there last night.  The place is filthy and disgusting!!!!!  I ordered 2 tacos and gave it to someone standing outside.  I don't care how good their food is...the place is disgusting!!!  I was in shock!

9.description: i was out west getting white girl wasted and after a few hours of going hard it was time to feed all the loud and liquor i consumed ;- ), my cousin suggested peeples its like a million other ghetto shops as i like to call them, no seating bullet proof glass full of colorful characters. unlike others have commented the wait was not long, we were "entertained" by some guys who wanted to warn us of the dangers of being fukd up out here by retelling a story of some very pretty ladies like us who wrapped their car around a pole and died. i had two deluxe chicken tacos w/out lettuce and they were sooo good. yes they were super greasy and falling apart but the chicken was seasoned perfectly and the veggies were a perfect compliment. next time im on the westside wasted i will keep this place in mind

10.description: This hell hole in the wall has all the disrespectful service, ignorant patrons and dubious sanitation you might expect from a finely scripted ghetto nightmare. Open late, Peeples Taco Place is one of the only options in the area and now I know where the inspiration for the Whodini classic, "Freaks Come Out At Night" originated.Frequently crowded, with the most disgruntled customers hanging outside on the sidewalk near the chain-smoking guy with one eye playing bootleg DVDs he's selling of the latest movies still playing in the theaters, you may wonder, "if it's so terrible, why"?With a standard fare of greasy-spoon staples (cheeseburgers, fish sandwich, italian beef, etc.), the family run Peeples Taco Place is best known for tacos (duh). Experienced locals order spiced ground beef or steak on small corn tortillas folded in aluminum foil with shredded lettuce. Mind you, neither the cooks nor the proprietors are Mexican but at just or $1.60 a taco, this lapse in authenticity doesn't seem to bother the munchie crowd who orders them by the dozen.Problem is, the grossly over-weight old folks who operate Peeples Taco behind the plugger and hand-drafted note infested bullet-proof glass are glacially slow, forgetful, hard-of-hearing and with an unabashed snear could utterly care less about your time or patronage. Yes, be prepared to wait... and wait... and wait still some more.Nobody knows why it takes so damn long, but during your crucible of tolerance you're forced to eavesdrop in on the colorfully profane conversations of blue-jean clad local drug dealers and dirty gym-shoe wearing wanna-be gangbangers as they holla obscenities at their various baby-mommas on uniquely decorated cellphones while standing or pacing as they count a knot of small bills. It's not actually unsafe (statistically I don't know for sure which murders sustained a conviction), but it's as close as you will get to feeling imminently in danger without actually needing a tourniquet soon. Nothing revs the appetite more than the fear of getting accosted. This would be a great "dare" or bet for someone you kinda don't like -- "If the Cubs DON'T win the World Series, you have to pick-up 5 hot tacos from Peeples Tacos at 7 past Midnight; if the Cubs DO win, I'll buy you a purple Jaguar with tinted windows."My pick is the Italian beef, which at $2.75 including fries is greasy enough to oil a semi-truck. Generous and cheap. Try not to stare at the preparation or it may be hard to keep down as an afterthought.Somehow Peeples is a sick twist on Chicago comfort food. Familiarity can be reassuring, even if it's bad. Lots of folks have grown-up on this crap. Is it any wonder why obesity, heart disease, and diabetes kill more residents than anything else. If it's before 9, go to the CA Beef joint across the street. pay a little extra but walkout without the caption "If you dare" silently hovering above your meal.Lord help me to never stumble into Peeples Taco again.

4.description: The best tacos in town!! I visit ever year when I travel!! Call ahead for no wait!

6.description: Oh Jesus God do I love these tacos.If you are in the mood for some greasy greasy tacos (and even some pretty decent Italian beef sandwiches) check out Peeples! If you ask for spicy be prepared because holy crap are they spicy. A lot of people like the fries, I don't really care for them, but the tacos--Oh the tacos!! So good. So greasy. Don't expect to lose any weight from this food! You will probably gain some! Also be prepared to be patient, the service is slow but it is so worth it. Yum yum eat em up tacos oh yeah. Christ I might just drive there today.

11.description: I'm not sure if this place is in buisiness or not, but the tacos here aren't  bad. They are greasy, though. I do have a complaint that they are way too slow in getting your order ready.

5.description: This is my second home!!!!!!

7.description: Love the cheap tacos from this place since it's right down the block from me!Don't go after sundown though... unless you have pepper spray, a tazer, holy water and a big bodyguard named Tiny.

8.description: My experience at Peeple's Taco was a trip!  A buddy and also co-worker of mine lives near Central/Chicago.  So we're about to get off work and he asks me if I've ever had Peeple's.  "No," I reply.  "Shit, dude!  We're goin' to Peeple's to get us some tacos!  I'm drivin'."  Peeple's tacos are not prepared Mexican style like tacos from e.g., El Farol or Atotonilco.  Peeple's proudly serves up awesomely greasy heart-attack ground beef tacos!  Soooo tasty joy!!!  It is the perfect meal to safely line your stomach either before or after a night of hard drinking.  You'll experience Four Happiness from eating one or five of them!You WILL WAIT for your food!  Oh, you bet you will!  The large African-American women who work there behind the bulletproof glass pick up the pace for NO ONE!!!  One patron waiting for his food banged on the glass "HURRY UP WITH MY FOOD!  YOU GONNA MAKE ME MISS MY GOD DAMN BUS!!!"  Another patron:  "Man, you fat!  Move faster!"  I don't know about you, fellow Yelpers, but I don't insult the person who's preparing my food.All in all, I recommend Peeple's to those who rate their food with grease stains.  1 = miso soup and 5 = Peeple's Taco.  As Dr. Nick said in the Simpsons episode where Homer gains 63 lbs to go on disability:  "if you're not sure about something, rub it against a piece of paper. If the paper turns clear, it's your window to weight gain!"

0.description: So if you are expecting authentic Mexican tacos you are not in the right place, however if you want pretty good "soul tacos" you have come to the right place! I usually get about 3 tacos. Tacos come in mild, hot or mixed. I love hot food but their hot tacos are really hot so I get mixed. I get my tacos supreme which come with tomatoes, cheese and onions. They are open late night so that's a great option too. A place with pretty decent tacos.

Mildly dangerous, especially in Summer or in the evenings.  But it's got some real character about it.  For instance, there's a sign on the entrance that says, "Did you know you could get 10 years in prison just for shooting a gun?"

1.description: The service was horrid, the cashier didn't know the specials and was over charging me! Now, I can understand a mistake but 3 times overcharging is a problem!  Then they were slow, slow, slow...still shaking my head to that fact!When I got my okra it was cold I had to send it back to get a hot batch, I didn't have a spoon for my mash and the pepper tasted old!  Maybe they shouldn't take it out of the jar until you order because prepackaging the peppers doesen't make their service any faster.The chicken was good nice and crisp cooked just right but the service was so bad that I won't be back to this location!

0.description: Eh, the chicken is pretty good and fresh, not quite as good as Popeye's, though similar, but definitely greasier; they also offer 'regular' and 'spicy'.  Mashed potatoes and gravy were yummy.  Kinda cool thing, if you happen to be in this (not-so-great) neck of the woods, is their 'two-piece Tuesday' special ($1.00!!).  Needless to say, it's usually packed those days, but still, you can end up with dinner for two people, even with sides, for like $5-6.  Service is usually pretty quick and friendly, because the place is generally busy.  I think this location is to-go only, even if it's not, you're probably better off doing so.

3.description: Hot Nails... Hot mess... waited for nothing... the way wax sooo hot... never again

1.description: Horrible place. When I got a pedicure here I got an infection so they probably don't clean anything . when I got my nails done the technician kept getting mad at me because she was messing up. Nails looked horrible.

2.description: One star because I had no choice.  HORRIBLE place to get a pedicure.   The technician that attempted to give me a pedicure was an older gentleman and did not seem to know what what was doing at all.  He never asked me if I wanted my nails cut down,  my cuticles were barely cleaned of old skin, and he actually cut part of my skin on one toe.  The polish job was awful as well.  I understand putting on gloves for sanitary reasons...BUT HE PUT ON USED GLOVES!!! WTF! I requested he get a new pair and he did.  Folks we are paying for a service and should demand 100% from these nail salons!  Will never return!

0.description: I went here to get my nails done because I had no time to go to where I normally go... and never again will I go here. I don't know what this lady did to my pinky finger or my ring finger but my fingers were BURNING. I asked her to shorten my nails a LITTLE BIT and all she understood was 'short' so she nearly chopped my nails off. The designs they had.. so not pretty. lol -- I wish I could have taken a picture so you could see what I mean... it took me several minutes to decide on what I wanted because most of the nails on the display looked like childrens drawings - if you don't believe me, go and find out for yourself. I actually found myself praying for her not to do a horrible job. lmao My nails came out decent.. but seriously, my experience was not so great.

3.description: Reviewing the food  alone without judging anything else is absolutely amazing. The chicken and Rib Tips are just a few of the of the dishes you have to try. This food is not recommended for those who are trying to watch their waist line and when you're done eating you might not need another meal for a while.    In regards to the lady above the woman taking  the orders does not handle the food the men who handle the food wear gloves they deal with raw chicken they have no choice but to wear them the comment on the ladies look was childish.    The restaurant is very small and can get crowded easily so I recommend placing you order for pickup. It is not in the best neighborhood and I grew up there so it would be highly recommended to place your order ahead but don't let this  obscure your judgment on going great place to eat.

1.description: Too small for ordering your meal, fighting with the peddlers. Food awe-ight. It's been awhile since I last went, will probably be longer til I go back

2.description: Came in for lunch and bought a double cheeseburger with fries to go. by the time I got to  the schools cafeteria (couple blocks down) my bag was soaked in grease and about to break! ...... the woman taking my order looker dirty and was walking in and out and wasnt even bothering to wash her hands.I noticed they had a refrigerator with containers that had cole slaw, spaguetti and what looked like beans or mashed potatos GROSS!  .... NEVER will be coming back here again ... sorry

0.description: The chicken here is better than a lot of the competition. I like the current special of 12 wings for 8.99 they have going on. The customer service is excellent for a neighborhood fast food chicken joint.This is a definite go to place when you need some fried chicken after a night out on the town.

4.description: Love their bbq sauce, which you can buy by the gallon!

1.description: 4 stars for extremely fast delivery. Had orange chicken and Mongolian beef. Both very good, especially given the neighborhood.

2.description: Best Beef fried rice ever! The portions are ample and the price is cheap. They don't skimp on the beef either. I come here often for my fried rice fix.

0.description: Always good to have a See-Thru Kitchen close by. I've been going to different ones over the past 7 years. This is one I would definitely recommend. I know, it's not Joy-Yee's, but not bad for the hood.

1.description: Lmbo!!!! There isn't much to be said about Carolyns! It's a neighborhood lounge that I have been going to for years. I originally started hanging here back in my motorcycle club days and have recently been going back when my Wednesday nights get too boring and I get sick of my couch.Strong,cheap drinks. Dancers on Wednesday nights. No food but there is a little restaurant next door. Total hole in the wall but it gets the job done. And they take an EXTREMELY long time to make your food. The lounge itself tells it's age, but that's not important when you come here. It's a cool spot!Watch your surroundings walking back to your car at night! Lol.... but serious!

0.description: I like this neighborhood bar. Always a great place to have drinks and listen to some great music. Nice place to meet a group of friends.

3.description: I finally stopped in after passing it frequently when in area. I called in my order and was told to come in 15 minutes. I ordered jerk steak fries, chicken taco and the chicken tips. Everything was pretty good, meat jerk seasoned well, moist and tender. Cost had gone up from menu I had but hey. I will return just know that like with a lot of places calling in order doesn't get you your food upon your arrival. Still waited about another fifteen minutes for my order.

1.description: Excellent jerk chicken nachos!  This is a CASH ONLY spot. Had to run to the bank and come back, but that's okay my food was ready when I returned, and it was worth it!

2.description: I work in the neighborhood and was looking for a new place to eat.  I came upon reviews for this place and I was not disappointed.  The Jerk Tacos are out of this world good.  Make sure to bring some cash they do not take credit card.  I would highly recommend this place if you like caribbean cooking.  And if you never tried you need to.

5.description: This place is as good as it gets! The meat is so tender, the flavor is dynamite! If you haven't tried this place, I feel sorry for you! LOL Let's just say I'm hooked on multiple things on the menu, the jerk chicken nachos, the jerk chicken nachos, the chicken tips... Hmmm Hmmm GOOD! :-)

6.description: Excellent food right in my neck of the woods.  No long waits and food served fresh.  The jerk chicken fries are everything I need in my life.

7.description: Stopped by yesterday after a long day at work and I ordered chicken and steak tacos, they were DELICIOUS & MEATY I stopped by my sister house and she smelled my tacos in my car and I had to share so my story is bitter sweet LOL I wanted my tacos all to my self and the workers are very Nice with pretty smiles and great customer service, Congratulations on your Restaurant and you will see me again...SOON!!

0.description: I was upset going to work and boy was I in for a treat. I moved to Chicago in 09 and had been looking for superb jerk anything. I need to look no further. This establishment is the best I have ever tasted. I'm trying to not get burned out because I can't stop eating there.They have my business until the bitter end.Very pleased customer!!!!!

4.description: Their Jerk fries are to die for, I love them with extra cheese, topped with jerk steak, sour cream and onions.  And it's made to order, so it's best to call in but the wait is well worth it!

1.description: This place has really low priced shoes and coats.  It gears more towards male clientele, especially for the clothing.

0.description: Found out about this place from my nephew. I just love the jean selection they have at this place. Price range is great. I can't comment on the rest of the items in this place because I haven't bought anything else. LOL

12.description: OK, my 2-stars recently was a little overzealous.  They're still cheap, have a decent selection of BASIC stuff, a very nice produce section, with even a smallish organic wall, lots of cheapo bulk sundries and tons of pre-packaged meat for the largish families that tend to frequent Food 4 Less.and their deli still sucks.

3.description: Like to shop here for their specials and other items that are usually over priced at stores near me.  I've never bought fresh meat here, that's because I am very very very picky about meat.They have a bakery, a deli section and also sell hot foods - of these three, I've only tried their bakery items - which are not bad.  Staff has always been friendly.  Times are tough, and to me it's worth it to drive away from my home to save $$.

1.description: I frequent this grocery store mainly because it's close to me, and when I do i stick with what's in sale. The best time to go here is either early in the morning as soon as they open or late at night right before they close. They have pretty good sales most of the time. But check the dates in the items you buy because I've had to return things that were past the expiration date.

2.description: I like the place, good merchandise, reasonable prices. What I don't like about the place is the long ass lines I have to make to checkout. That's a reason why sometimes I prefer to pay a little bit more for a better customer service at A&G.

9.description: Not the cleanest store. Quite overpriced, actually.  Sometimes the sales seem like a good deal, BUT most of the time you need to buy 10 items of that specific product for that sale.I'll stick with Aldi.

10.description: The prices are very competitive and they have a good selection of items. I don't really like their produce dept. because sometimes they are overpriced or don't have as good as a selection as other stores. I get good deals on meat and frozen foods and other goodies. I got a 4 lb. bag of chicken wings for only $6! Wooo hooo! Sometimes this store can get really crowded, but the lines are not that bad.

4.description: I come here to get a few items that are not as costly as Jewel or Dominicks!I would also say choose wisely if you decide to get there reduced meat some of it looks past okay to sell!! I have run across some meats that are discolored and frankly even if its reduced I still want to be able to eat it!!!With the amount of people that come through the doors of this store I think they keep it clean!I am big on customer service and I have to say that they do have great cashiers and when I couldn't find an item the person took me right to the aisle and said if you need anything else just let me know...now that was a special employee!!!This isn't the lowest prices in town but if you shop wisely you can come out ahead!! I do have to agree with one review that said most of the sales come in when you buy 10 or more items but so far that has worked in my favor especially when I get a gallon of water fo .48 cent!

6.description: I love to Shop here since it's right in the neighborhood,  however the lines can get extremely long and you could be looking at a twenty minute or longer wait time. Other than that I can usually get in, get what I came for and leave out a Happy camper! They are also building a gas station so I am looking forward to that!

15.description: Hi hate this store but give it 2 stars because I'm sure it's right for someone out there.   I don't like that you have to enter on one side of the store and exit on the other.  Makes just running in for something a bother. Their prices are not very cheap at all, at least for anything I've ever went there for.  Most of the meat is in family sized packages and the seafood is prepacked.  The beer, wine and liquor are all located in diffrent areas.  In fact all the liquor is in a locked case and you have to wait for the cashier to get the keys and retrieve it.  Just a sucky experience overall.

0.description: A friend of mine swears by Food4less. I would not go out of my way to shop here, but it's worth the visit if you are in the area.  It is definitely set up like a warehouse.  The majority of the products are  dirt cheap.  Preferred this adventure way more that my Aldi experiment.  Produce was much better, prices were comparable, and the selections were way better.  Like most low budget grocery stores, it was brimming with processed foods.  I am not kidding when I say that I filled my cart with for less than $90.

5.description: Nice store, decent prices.  Right now you can get pumpkin pie, apple pie and others at $2 from the clearance section.  Dinner rolls can be found at 0.25 a pack!  I shop here all the time. The sales keep me coming back!  You also get discounts on gas towards your purchases.  It's a must shop for families on a budget.

13.description: This honestly has to be the most disgusting grocery store I have ever been to. I recently joined planet fitness gym that's in the same lot, so after working out tonight I decided to stop in to pick up a few things for dinner. From the moment I stepped in I could tell this place was GHETTO (they have baby formula locked away at the front of the store), the place looks filthy at a glance, and most of the employees look like they're on parole. Anyway, I made my way over to the produce section and found everything to be over priced for the quality. All the vegetables looked old and dirty, so I settled for a prepacked bag of spinach. When I got to the meat section I was seriously turned off by the "fresh" meat, so I walked over to the frozen cooler section to pick up a bag of prepacked chicken. As I approached the cooler I noticed the plastic sheet covering the bottom of the cooler had a large piece missing, so I could see underneath it. As I got closer I realized that under this cooler was a RAT GLUE TRAP in plain sight, it was like it was meant to be seen. I still feel disgusted thinking of it. I quickly walked away and picked up a bottle of salad dressing before getting out of there as fast as I could. I am seriously considering contacting the health department because that was too much. Safe to say I will never go back.

11.description: all the after school meals are here...

8.description: I first tried Food4Less in Evanston, fearing the worst from this location. In 2009 I was unemployed for 7 months, and getting more for less in groceries has been really important to getting by. I'm happy to report that this location is A-Okay!The produce was plentiful and fresh. Sure, I still couldn't find Kale, Chard, or Tofu (it isn't a Hippie Valhalla), but I was able to get many staples, and loaded up my Yelp Eco-Totes with twice the food for the same price as other grocery stores (*cough S&VT, Dominicks)!During the day the crowds weren't bad, until I got to the checkout line and the gramma ahead of me decided to ask for a price check on every item and not empty her cart until the checker had finished ringing the previous item. At Food4Less you bag your own groceries. I got a free small eco-tote with my purchase. As I filled my totes with groceries the gramma and her daughter were bagging their groceries across from me, and clearly disenchanted, mumbling loudly about having to "Go Green". Cultural differences aside, I'm making this my Go-To grocery for big trips. Sure, I'll have to hit Cermak Produce and Dominick's for other items, but Food4Less saved me so much money, it's well worth the extra trip!

14.description: When I can't find it at Aldi you go here!! Cheap, clean and bright it fills in the holes that Aldi and the bodega on the corner just can't. Make sure you don't park too far out when shopping the other store sin the strip...the grocery carts lock up about 4 parking rows west of the entrance.

7.description: I love shopping here, it's very convenient and i always get what i'm looking for. I would recommend coming here also the people that work there are very nice.

3.description: If you are budget-oriented and looking for a good quality office furniture store, this place is a dream. We went here while refurnishing our home office, and couldn't be happier with the items we bought (bookshelves, desk, ergonomic chair, etc.). Their prices are very reasonable and everything was in great condition. Give stars.

1.description: Pros: polite staff. Cons: everything else. I came here in April to look at ergonomic chairs. The saleswoman told me a story about how they stand by their products, and I decided to buy a used chair from them - which turned out to be an expensive mistake. The back support and reclining mechanisms began malfunctioning after a few hours of use. I contacted the chair's manufacturer, but they said the chair had an invalid serial number (counterfeit product?), so the chair was not covered by warranty and not eligible for replacement parts (which cost almost as much as a new chair). I then tried to return the chair to Rightsize Facility Performance, but they required me to track down and talk to the original saleswoman, which took days of playing phone tag. I returned the chair in early May and got a receipt, but it's been over a month, and the refund hasn't appeared in my account yet.Also, they claim that they steam-clean the chairs, but when I brought home my chair, there was still a great deal of dirt embedded in the fabric.Shopping here isn't worth the hassle. And the prices here are much higher than other used furniture stores or Craigslist.

2.description: Nice items but overpriced for used furniture. Long wait time just to get a sales rep. Even then, poor service and felt like i was getting pushed out.

9.description: I used Rightsize to furnish our 6,000 sq ft office space a couple of years ago.  They were among 3 vendors that I looked into and I picked Rightsize because they were well priced.  Everything went smoothly in the beginning but the transaction went downhill fast.  Without going into too much detail, here is a list of things that went wrong.  1) Guest Chairs were supposed to have leather seats and we got a fabric seat so we had to return those. 2) We were told that the bench seating we ordered would not come until 6 weeks past  our office opening;  they offered to supply us some temporary chairs in the mean time. (When we ordered this, we were told it would be in on time.)  When they sent us pictures of the chairs, they were a group cheap plastic chairs, all different colors and styles. We canceled our order for the bench seating and we found a local custom upholstery shop that could build it in 2 weeks with the exact same fabric and for slightly less $$.   3) The owner  or President of the company called my interior designer and told her that I had said she was unpleasant to work with. Not only was that a complete lie because I had never spoken with anyone else except my rep, but my interior designer was the only person who helped me get through this transaction. 4) Rightsize eventually started calling me everyday demanding payment for the balance of my invoice, even though I hadn't received all of the products and they hadn't come in to fix my punch list of items that needed to be addressed (missing rails for file cabinets, the guest chairs with the wrong fabric, etc). This was 2 years ago, so hopefully they have improved their service since then, however I will avoid them at all costs.

10.description: Bought a used Steelcase Criterion for $99. Looks brand new. In case you're not familiar, that chair retails new for $879. They had hundreds of options; I saw more than a dozen different used Aerons in the $300-$450 range. I was just buying one chair, and they were as sweet and helpful as if I had been outfitting a tech start-up. I didn't need an appointment - just showed up on a Saturday, when their hours are 9-3. Absolutely worth the drive through a super sketchy neighborhood.

4.description: I was searching for a new office chair and felt absolutely lost. I perused Office Max, but didn't feel the selection was quite there. I hit up Relax the Back, but couldn't bring myself to drop $2K on a chair.  Luckily a Yelp search for places to buy office chairs in Chicago yielded the recommendation to check out rightsizefacility.com.  Honestly, I almost overlooked this recommendation, but I'm so glad I came back to it!  I stopped in after work today and was amazed at the selection of really nice office chairs!  I came away with a pre-owned Steelcase Leap chair in leather for ~$400!  HUGE.  I'm so pleased with how easy this was and the prices were much more palatable than buying brand new!  I highly recommend checking this place out if you're looking to get your hands on a high-end chair without breaking the bank!

6.description: I'm so glad we discovered rightsize facility {Office Furniture Center} today. As a graduate student, I spend hours at a desk writing and reading. My old chair -- a basic HON task chair bought several years ago at Office Depot -- gave me endless hours of back pain. After a good deal of research, I knew I needed to invest in a better desk chair, but I also didn't have the money to afford a brand new Aeron, Zody, Leap, or Knoll Life Task. The Office Furniture Center really saved the day for me: they had the exact model of chairs I was searching for, and most of their selection was very reasonable priced. I was able to go to their warehouse on a Saturday morning, walk around their large and well-stocked showroom, and leave the same day with a barely-used Zody chair. I couldn't have been happier with the experience.There was only one person working the floor on the showroom, but she was very helpful and answered all of our questions. She also gave us enough breathing room to allow me to really test-drive the chairs before choosing one.Overall, I'm so pleased with both my purchase experience and the product inventory. I only wish I had known to come here years ago!

11.description: I bought a chair through their online ordering process--I gave them my credit card info and scheduled a delivery date.  This resulted in me having to answer several calls from them, FAX all this info to them, give them my credit card number over the phone, etc.  The price I checked out with online got increased (tax and delivery) and I was told the day I wanted delivery (Sat.) was not a day they ever delivered on.Basically, they made a lot of it okay and did deliver my chair (an hour after they said they would), but the online ordering process is EXTREMELY misleading.  You're not really ordering at all!

5.description: This is one of the worst companies I have ever done business with, and regret having ever selecting them.I purchased nearly $40,000 worth of cubicles, benching stations, and chairs from Rightsize.  While the sales process was relatively smooth, everything else was absolutely horrible.They missed my installation date by several weeks (as of this writing), which caused me to pay extend my existing lease since I had no where for my office to sit.  They did not communicate about any of the delays, nor bring up any issues proactively.  In fact, it was like pulling teeth to even get anyone to call me back.  Good luck getting anyone via phone or email if the hours aren't 11am to 3pm Monday thru Thursday.  And within those hours, expect voicemail or excuses about internal meetings.  Forget about them returning a call, you'll wait days (if you are lucky).  If you do get to speak with someone, they'll tell you how nothing is their fault, they will blame UPS or another client, or whatever else they can.Of the stuff that they did deliver, it was wrong.  The cubicles were not configured as per our drawings, and we received different (cheaper) materials than what we ordered.I've left several messages to the president of Rightsize asking for help, and no one has called back.  Thank god I only put down 50%, because they are still not done the project and I don't think they ever will be.

7.description: Ordered from them twice for our office furniture.  First order, they forgot the bolts, we were told that it would be no problem to get replacements at HD, well they were metric bolts which needed to be ordered at some cost.  Second order; much larger, 2 weeks for delivery (OK) but when delivered there was no inventory of the parts (these were cubes and there were ~100's of parts, pieces and hardware).  But we were assured that they were all present; no such luck. We needed to resubmit to them what parts were missing -  how???,  they supplied no inventory so how were we supposed to know; so we supplied images of them, and numbers required ~ 7 sets of items in total.  Should have been fine except it took another 2 weeks to get the  'second' delivery of parts.  This was again missing items from the  list provided (with images) to them, and again required 5 days to receive them.All in all, a very frustrating experience; sure the people are somewhat nice, but not competent and at times argumentative.I'd recommend them for fixed items, but the more complicated orders seem totally out of their competency (any thing more than a table or chair or filing cabinet).

8.description: I wanted a Steelcase Leap chair for my home office, but they retail for $800+ new. Rightsize (AKA Office Furniture Center) had a bunch of used v2 Leaps in stock for $350.
