I saw their Yelp deal and contacted them about it, and received a prompt response from a salesperson with a code to use during online checkout. The warehouse was easy to find and had convenient parking, and as soon as I showed up on a Saturday morning they wheeled my chair out to the entrance immediately. The chair is in great shape, only gently used, and quite a bargain for a high-ticket item that I was dreading having to purchase new.I'm dinging them a star because they initially billed me for the incorrect amount, but a few emails to customer service fixed that. All in all, a nearly flawless transaction. I'm incredibly impressed that they responded so promptly and courteously even though I only bought one item. Their warehouse is absolutely HUGE and they seem to do a high volume of business through it. I'll definitely be back for future pieces to round out my home office.

0.description: This place is simply amazing.  They've got something like nearly 100,000 square feet of showroom space dedicated to office furniture including chairs, desks, storage units, vertical wardrobes - you name it.  Best of all, their online inventory is virtually real-time, so you can do a preliminary search for what you need and visit the showroom and ensure that it works.  I was on the hunt for a very specific storage item for a home office that I found quickly and easily via their website.  I went to the warehouse and was shown some alternatives, made my selection and was able to bring it home that day.I was shopping for one or two items - not a designer with a $20K budget.  I was still given terrific personalized attention by Jessica.  In fact everyone I encountered there was helpful and very eager to help.I'd recommend Rightsize highly for home office or select home furnishings.  And the prices can't be beat.  Candidly, I paid almost IKEA prices for an incredible, built like a tank, used (looks new) piece that easily would have cost 6 times what I paid new.  Herman Miller, Knoll, HON, they carry amazing brands.  Huge thumbs up!

12.description: I have been looking for a good seafood boil type of place!! This place delivered big time. Food was delicious, and a generous portion I might add... I can't wait to go back!!

3.description: I got the shrimp platter it was definitely delicious but the Manheim location tastes 10 X's better... Both locations take link so that's a super plus !!!!! The Cajun seasoning brings it all together perfectly

1.description: I recently was referred to this place by a friend, I could not believe how convenient and tasteful this restaurant. One thing everyone must know Seafood junction prides themselves on NOT frying anything!! The service is quick and easy, Only negative about this place is the area its located in... Im guessing the majority of consumers would simply continue riding past this place, but best believe THOSE individuals are surely missing out!!  I will add pics the next time I visit, was so busy stuffing my face I didn't think about pictures.

2.description: Surprisingly good food in the hood!I found seafood junction on Instagram. The picture looked so good that I felt obligated to go try them. Although I've lived in Chicago for many years, I've never been further west than the United Center. I've just never needed to do anything over there. So to me the area didn't seem very dangerous (I went at 7pm in July), but when my friends found out where it was they told me it's not the safest (and they've been to the west side). I'm not trying to discourage anyone, but just wanted to put it out there. I'm fact, I would actually encourage people to go if possible because it really is good food and such a great value!

9.description: Very delicious food !! Hands down the best fresh seafood market in the city. I had the mussels which were delicious as well as the shrimp. Lol I'll probably be back next week. Do not plan to eat inside this establishment though , it's pretty much carry out only and yes IT IS  on the westside of Chicago (Debit and cash only)

10.description: I came on my lunch break to get the salmon and shrimp combo along with a few extra orders for my coworkers!!  The food was good but the service was like a 4... So I decided I'd give them a second shot after work.... I called in my order and was told 10 minutes...  35 minutes later I got my food and was assured that my food was correct...  I got all the way home, which is another 25minutes, to open the box and it was completely wrong... I called back and he said come back I'll fix it.. I get here he's gone and they tell me another 15minutes !! The workers were extremely unprofessional ,on their phones, cursing, and down right rude!  Not worth the taste....

13.description: The food is excellent!!!  One of my Facebook friends posted pictures of the food he bought from Seafood Junction and it looked so good that I had to go there the very next day!!!  I ordered the dinner that had 1 lobster tail, 1 huge claw of crab legs, 10 large shrimp, 6 clams, corn on the cob, broccoli and baked potatoes.The only bad part about this place is that they tell you they will substitute the 6 clams for 6 shrimp and somehow you don't get either one of them. I got all the way home on the southside of Chicago to find that I was cheated out of my clams and extra shrimp. So make sure you double-check your order before you leave.Otherwise, the food is great and that's all that really matters to me.

16.description: Had a taste for crab legs and Hubby and I were too lazy to go out and ran across Seafood Junction on GrubHub. Took a chance and ordered snow crab legs, mussels, clams, and shrimp platter. It came with corn,  broccoli and potatoes. We were glad we took the chance. Everything was tasty and fresh. And it was a LOT of food for $59. Will definitely order again.

6.description: Be warned this is WEST SIDE!  For the last 5 months I've place about 10 orders with this restaurant all are delivery for obvious reasons, each order was on average $40+ so with business over $400.  I'm sorry to say, enough is enough!  Owner simply doesn't care for customer service nor does he care to improve with suggestions.  Service: Has gradually gone down from July to November.  Some tips: allow yourself 2hr for delivery, and don't use any special instructions they can't read.  Be ready to make your own butter sauce at home, as my order often missed dipping butter sauce.  My order in July looked fresh green and nicely packed, by Oct' they were yellowish, Soaked in grease packed in leaky styrofoam.  Price: I agree with other posts prices have gradually increased on everything.  I now think this place is average value vs. what's available at other restaurants. I don't mind the price increase - but my 1 star is for their service which has gone down tremendously.  Take a look at older pictures vs newly posted.  I'm not comparing them to Joe's Seafood, but rather a similar much friendlier places like Happy Crab.  NEVER again!

15.description: What can I say? Who knew I liked steamed and broiled seafood. It absolutely great.  However, since they've opened they're prices have continued to increase. ...but hey, it's seafood. Love the seafood salad and fresh veggies.

0.description: Yummy yummy seafood best place ever wish they had a sit down so that we could eat inside the place.. Highly recommended..

5.description: I recently have been trying out new dining establishments on Chicago's west side and I'd heard about Seafood Junction via a Facebook post. The reviews on Yelp seemed to be mixed but mostly favorable so I decided to check them out last Sunday. I called in an order for the Tilapia and Shrimp combo (approx. $13), When I arrived 15 minutes later I was greeted by a friendly staff and the meal was ready and waiting. It consisted of 12 seasoned shrimp and 1-2 fillets. I expected the normal "fried" rendition but the shrimp were boiled and the fillet were baked/grilled. They were accompanied by a half ear of corn on the cob, seasoned potatoes, broccoli florets and a lemon wedge.. Both a mild shrimp sauce and tartar sauce were included. Overall the meal was quite good. One extra touch I appreciated was the fact that the container holding the food wrapped with cellophane so much that when I arrived home 15 minutes later the meal was still hot (which explained why I didn't smell anything while driving home...lol). There were other seafood items offered which I have yet to sample but as for this one it gets 4.5 stars!

11.description: Tried it for the first time since I been hearing a lot about it. Food was real good and healthy since nothing is fried, all steamed....I love the fact that they take link as well

8.description: I never even heard of Seafood Junction until I saw a Facebook post about it. The plate she posted looked really good, so I decided to go today after work. The area it's in is really rough! It makes you not want to get out of the car. Horrible parking and a lot of riff raff hanging around outside the restaurant. You literally have to watch your back (and bag) in this area! It was extremely busy when I went inside the restaurant. I waited about 20 to 25 minutes for my food. If you want faster service, call ahead. Customer service could've been better. I ordered the lobster tail with the shrimp and veggies. The food was good for what it is, but they could've used more flavor. The portions were small. I should've got more for $21 and some change. Also, the prices are high for this restaurant to be in a bad part of the city. I would go again when I have a craving for seafood.

4.description: Fisherman's Island Chicago is significantly better (better flavor and generous portions) than Seafood Junction (cost more, small portions, and bland)on 87th!

14.description: Isn't it illegal for restaurants to accept link. Link is not supposed to buy cooked food.  I hear the food is good,  however,  I can't deal with businesses that operate illegally,  that makes me feel,  "what else are you doing that's not supposed to happen?" No thank you. What's worse is that people are posting that they accept link....

7.description: Today was my first time here and I took my wife with me I spent 70$ and I must say it was money not well spent. The people were nice, well actually the girl who took our order was,but we didn't go there for the people. The food was absolutely horrible I don't see what the rave was all about with this place. I ordered shrimp and lobster the lobster was tough and everything was completely bland and smelled extremely fishy the vegetables that it came with all tasted fishy. Do your self a favor and don't waste your time or money at this place unless you like BLAND and FISHY tasting sea food. FYI if seafood smells fishy it's a good sign that it's bad or on the verge of being spoiled

1.description: I recently went to this Salon and had a great time! I got a great massage, mani/pedi!The staff is wonderful and welcoming! They serve cheese, fruit and juice while you are being serviced. Beautiful music for a great atmosphere!

0.description: I've noticed this place in the past and my regular nail technician had a long line of people. I was a walk in and I needed a fill in and design on my overlay. She did an excellent job and the design was beautiful and I received a lot of compliments.I only patronize AA nail shops, the art is always unique and detailed. They also care for your nails and feet and don't rush you out the chair. A few days later I returned for the foot softening pedicure and all I can say it was worth it. Other services include: massage, brow arching, paraffin waxing, etc.

This is another Family Dollar that we go to when we need to get items for our volunteering event!It is set up like most Family Dollars but the staff is great and we will be back when we are in the area and need to pick up supplies for an event!

1.description: When I go to this Save-A-Lot its never to really shop!  I have a specific items in mind for the volunteer event we cook for so I'm in and out!My only complaint is the Swaggerty sausage is now thin and cost more money but that's not the supermarkets fault its the company, but I still needed to get it off my chest...lol The seniors use to love those sausages!So all in all I have not had a problem with this store the staff is great and I will continue to shop here for my volunteering events!

2.description: So on my way home I realized I need some groceries and wait what do I see... Save-A-Lot. So just the name got my attention because I definitely love to save. What I failed to realize that the store has like an Aldi's theme store, except they carry brands like Oscar Mayer, Goya, etc. (so bring bags or you'll have to buy them). I don't mind bagging my own groceries but I don't see myself coming back soon. Unfortunately, the selection isn't that great, the prices weren't all that special, and the employees aren't really helpful.

0.description: Never had any issues with this store except for not having my Jennie o ground turkey in stock on one occasion. But besides that's 5 stars they have a variety of good priced items and the staff are always nice and friendly even the security guard!

Ladies if you think you need to flock to the Gold Coast for a great looking weave you are sadly mistaken!! I just had the pleasure of receiving one of Koko's killer weaves!! ( I am hispanic) and let me tell you her superb craftmanship concealed my various bald patches(long story). Koko was very understanding to my needs and she was VERY thorough with sewing my weave. It looks so natural and I feel beautiful again!!! All of this for an amazing price of 150.00!!!( Hair is not included) Koko is an amazing talent and I can't stress that enough
They have a great selection of paninis . Good place for lunch or just to grab a panini on the go.

58.description: MacArthur's is THE place to go when you want soul food, outside of going to your mom's house (or in my case, my friend's mom's house since my mom lives in Atlanta and I'm in Illinois! LOL). Not only do they have great food, but they are prices are ridiculous (ridiculously GOOD that is!). I bought meals for myself and my two kids and it cost me less than $20! While I'm not a total fan of the west side of Chicago, I tend to conveniently forget this fact when I have a craving for MacArthur's mac & cheese or banana pudding. The last time I went, I freaked out because I only had my credit & debit cards on me (no cash). I was pleasantly surprised to find a sign in MacArthur's window informing me that they had an ATM on the premises. And luckily for me, the ATM worked just fine and I was able to take out money for my future purchase.You are able to view the food and have the server choose what you want if there is something specific you want, especially in terms of the meat (thighs, wings, etc.). The entire staff was very pleasant, which was a bonus, as I already knew that the food was great. The décor is nothing to write home about, but it's clean and it's comfortable, which is more than enough for me when I'm starving. I enjoyed the fact that the atmosphere was nice (no loud crowds, no loud music playing overhead). This place can get a little crowded on Sundays after church services are over (there are a million and one storefront churches on Madison, and everyone who attends seems to find their way over to MacArthur's after church). I've found that the best time to eat at MacArthur's is during the week, immediately after work. I also enjoy taking the food home and eating it there. Either way, with great food and even better prices, you just can NOT go wrong with MacArthur's!

56.description: You better try the smothered pork chops! I have to ask for half portions on the sides though, can't eat it all. Spot on Mac. Oh yeah Mac is a good guy.

29.description: My favorite Cafeteria style soul food joint in the city.  Yes you have to travel far deep into the westside, but its always worth it.  The banana pudding is bomb.com too.

42.description: Thank God I found this place while I'm working in the Austin neighborhood, I'm not touching MacDonalds again with a ten foot pole. It's a cafeteria style soul food restaurant, and that food is goooooooooood!

23.description: Great food and extremely low prices for the quality of food. We arrived around 4:30 and there was waiting but a steady line of customers. We had two dinners (one meat w/2 sides) and a small cobbler for $20!!! Portions were generous and good!!!

47.description: The food here is absolutely delicious and should receive 5 out of 5 stars but unfortunately the service reflects the great prices. Not the most courteous staff but if you don't mind it for 2 or so minutes, you'll have a great experience. Definitely try the meatloaf. Cash only and there is an ATM outside. There is usually a hellish wait on Sundays (lines out the door) and I've never been any other day so I don't know if it's any different then.

8.description: Lived in Chicago all my life, but this is the first time at Macarthur's.  Honestly was disappointed. The line moved slowly because the ckerks couldn't keep up.  I had under cooked baked chicken--runny & red.  Mashed potatoes stiff & entire meal was cold.  Will not go back.  I wanted to like it.

31.description: I used to come here back in it's hey day when it was across the street before it moved to the bigger location. The quality of food hasn't been the same I think since 07 or 08. The mac and cheese used to be so creamy, greens were cooked from scratch, baked chicken packed with flavor. Went there recently and food was just so so like cooking it over and over just got old. It's not as good as it used to be and those who used to eat there know it.

34.description: I really like the soul food from this place. It isn't too fancy and the line is long most days but its worth it. The food isn't pricey and other than the line to order, the food is already made. I love the baked mac and cheese, bbq turkey legs, and smoothered pork chops. The banana pudding is awesome too. I definitely recommend this place and been coming since they opened.

16.description: Great food at a great price. I had enough food left over to take home for a second helping....

13.description: I've been to MacArthur's several times, and I've never had anything I disliked. With that being said I will tell you what they do well:Collard GreensMacaroni and CheeseCandied SweetsFried ChickenBeef Short RibsMeatloafCornbreadPeach CobblerThe service is cafeteria style, the ambiance is casual family-dining (think Naugahyde booths), clean, and bright. Since the remodel they have a private room or two, and outdoor seating. The more "special" offerings vary based on the day of the week, but some standards are available daily. There is almost always a long line, but they efficiently move you on through.

11.description: I just can't believe how this Chicago staple went down the way has! Smothered pork chops are dry they didn't have any greens and the staff was rude! It breaks my heart!

39.description: The food is pretty good. We had the short ribs dinner and the meat was fall away from the bone tender and seasoned well. I can see why this place is so popular. (Soul food/ home-style cooking.) It was totally worth the long line. (The line can easily be out the door at 845pm and they close at 9pm.) I went Sunday night, 8/1/13. I will definitely eat there again!

37.description: My coworkers wanted to cater lunch for the holidays and decided to order here. The baked chicken lacked flavor, fried chicken was okay. Now...what really made me angry was the baked macaroni with American cheese on top...who does that? It was terrible. Also, the greens tasted like they came out of a can. People who rave about this place clearly haven't tasted real soul food.

0.description: Foods good, but sometime the service can be slow and poor. Just tried to order a cake over the phone, nearly impossible.

38.description: Good price. Ok food. Greens had a weird unneeded flavor.Mac and cheeee was ok... not very cheesy nor was it real cheese... it was american cheese.Smothered chicken was good.Smothered pork chop was ok.Yams... too sweet.

51.description: I actually went months ago but just now finally reviewing the place. Once again, i dragged my friend with me b/c: 1) I wasn't familiar with neighborhood ( i'm a southsider) and 2) I needed someone to be fat with, lol. So we went ahead and went, thankfully we got there before the after work rush especially on a Friday. As the previous reviews says, definitely was cafeteria style and be prepared to order.One thing i did not like was how the mac and cheese is made, slices of cheese baked on top? I was informed that was unfortunately how they make theirs, bleh.But i did love banana pudding, i had to take some home.Pretty good spot for soul food home cooking.

27.description: I couldn't even finish the meal that I paid for. The chicken was undercooked, the cornbread was dry and the mac and cheese had NO flavor.

32.description: I've been to MacAthurs a couple of times it use to be better but its ok. The fried chicken was alright it was one of those things where its not good but its not bad either.the Mac and cheese was pretty good but I have had better.the greens were decent. Now the candied yams were delicious. They have become higher than they use to be with less food but all in all its nice to at least try it.

54.description: MacArthur's has soul like church on Sunday. After my favorite soul food spot closed down, I desperately needed a replacement. Not too bad of a line when we went to this institution on Chicago's West Side. Which I was told is a blessing, because it's commonly not that easy. Be ready with your order, because their clearly ready to take it *read between the lines*. I was with my guy whose getting married, since we just got fitted, and two youngins. My guy and I chose to share most of what we got because we're soul food blood hounds. I had the fried chicken, Ribs, greens, mac and cheese, and corn bread. My guy got the catfish, smothered pork chop, spaghetti, and mashed potatoes. Fried chicken was crunchy and juicy. Ribs were surprisingly good, lotta sauce, but real good. Their greens were good too, could have used a little more heat and vinegar. The mac was kind of a let down, but it was still enjoyable. Loved the corn bread. The catfish is outrageously good, same to is to be said about their spaghetti. I was not a fan of their smothered pork chop, just didn't work for me. Mashed potatoes were pretty boring too, but that's because my German momma makes the best around. For dessert we had their red velvet cake and banana bread pudding. Both delicious. I was really happy with MacArthur's. Overall they hit the nail on the head for soul food.

48.description: I have tried this place once before about 5 years ago and didn't like it then. I tried it again recently and it's still disgusting. The good:Great portionsAwesome priceThe cornbread muffins with yam juice on top. YUMMY!The bad:I ordered the smothered porkchops, mashed potatoes, and mac n cheese (not my idea too much starch on one plate)The porkchops YUCK undercooked, too much breading and not seasoned.The mashed potatoes now how could you mess up the most easy staple of so many meals. They were chunks of boiled potatoe mixed with boxed potato. It's simple get a potato, milk, butter, salt and pepper and mash until your heart is content.The Mac N Cheese again YUCK I would have to describe it as macaroni mixed with egg, milk, and no cheese crammed into a pan with sliced cheese on top.

44.description: Wonderful! I will be returning...and I will definitely be sure to call in my order, the line was ridiculously LONG! :)

24.description: I have begged my husband to take me to this restaurant MacArthur's for 3 years I wish I would have listen to him when he said this food was NOT good! The Mac &cheese was WHITE the dressing had no vegetables or meat it was literally corn bread! If I could have gave NO STARS I would have! You are better off cooking your own soul food dinner  at home!!!!

7.description: I am sad to read such negative reviews.  I have had great meals here.  It is my favorite Soul Food in Chicago hands down.  I try to go healthy, yes I know it defeats the point, but I love that it can be done here.  Broiled catfish is juicy and flavorful.  I love the mac and cheese.  Not too greasy but just enough so.  Great greens.  Yams are sweet but less so than at other places.  I like that they don't dress them up with all kinds of fruity flavors or cinnamon.  Cornbread is nothing to write home about and the corn bread dressing was just too heavy, flavorless, and gritty for my likings.  But the rest of my dish made me smile.This is a great place to bring a family.  Good kid friendly seating.  The line was flowing nicely.  The place is clean and extremely affordable.

49.description: SIMPLY THE BEST SOULFOOD IN CHICAGO ......MAYBE EVER!!Man I found myself lickin my fingers literally after eating the heavenly baked chicken collard greens and mash potatoes !!!!If your in Chicago and haven't eaten here or had a meal to go you are missing out!

40.description: Fantastic flavor, really stuffs you up for under ten bucks

53.description: Probably a little bit of grade inflation because there really isn't much else around Austin, but there is some pretty tasty comfort food here. Everything is stick-to-your-ribs: meatloaf, mac and cheese, fried chicken, salisbury steak, etc., all served cafeteria style and with plenty of hot sauce at the tables. Nothing is fantastic, but you'll leave happy and full, and isn't that what matters?

30.description: The food was okay not spectacular. I had the perch fish with macaroni and cheese and green beans. The macaroni and cheese  was rich in flavor and creamy. However, on top of each portion was a slice of yellow  (goverment)cheese that ruined the feeling of getting a southern cooked meal. The  perch was horrible it  was too salty and undercooked. I wish I had ordered the catfish. My biggest complaint was that they ran out of candied yams. However the highlight of my meal was the peach cobbler which I would suggest to anybody have for dessert. I think that I had a lot of hype for this place. In addition I'm also comparing this restaurant to the southern food that I had when living in Memphis. That's a hard sander to live up to. So I will give this restaurant another try and hopefully have a better review.

46.description: Really enjoyed my visit to Macarthur's.Staff was really friendly.Place is nice and clean with plenty of parking.They have a huge selection of entrees from which to choose from.I was a happy camper today.Definetetly giving them the thumbs up!!!! I WILLbe coming back.Also,great bang for the buck!! I ate like a king for under $10!!!!! NICE!!!!

1.description: I don't eat this type of food very often, but my family caters from MacArthur's sometimes for family functions.They do fried chicken very well, along with their mac & cheese. I'm not a huge fan of sweet potatoes or yams, yet I do like a little sweet on my plate and theirs are good as well...candied.Their greens are always cooked well, but lack flavor. Same with the beef ribs. They don't use any sauce, yet I noticed that they are always very tender and the meat almost falls off the bone. Once I use black pepper and hot sauce to spice my plate up a bit, I enjoy it. This is a welcomed treat every few months.

55.description: MacArthur's is great!!  Stay away from the smothered pork chops they are salty as brine!! Mac and Cheese is good. The mashed potatoes needs more salt and butter they are kinda bland but ok with gravy.

9.description: The food was DELICIOUS! I had fried chicken, catfish, collards and yams. I am the type that needs salt and pepper on everything but I didn't even touch it for this meal! My only complaint is that the place looked outdated, it wasn't dirty, actually clean but just needs an upgrade. Pictures on google from 2010 showed a beautiful shining, brightly lit restaurant and it wasn't like that. The only other thing is that there were no signs that indicated what each dish was. The pics from 2010 had signs, that would of been very helpful. There was also no posted menu with options and pricing. I just moved here from Boston and this was my first soul food visit in Chicago, I definitely will be back.

26.description: Please save your money. I would not recommend this place to anyone.  The food is was missing the soul from soul food.  I order the Smothered Pork Chops with side dishes of Mac and cheese, and Yams.

25.description: I'm from the south and I'm not that great of a cook. When I want good southern cooking I go here. The chicken, mac and cheese, cornbread, even the cake was deliciuos. Reminds me of home!

12.description: Solid soul food...know what you want because the lady behind the counter will take no shi* from anyone...don't know what you want and...No Soul Food for You!!!Menu changes everyday so come often to try other dishes.Fried Chicken...nice and crispy, juicy and full of flavor...one of the best I had.BBQ Ribs...not as advertised...no sauce, but was in a liquid (mostly its own fat)...just ok...but will not order again.Sides:Candies Yams ****Spaghetti ***Collard Greens ****Mac & Cheese ***Potato Salad **Peach Cobbler ***Banana Pudding **** Green Beans ****

59.description: Growing up in the south, I love cafeteria style food (e.g., Luby's, Wyatt's, Furr's) and I've missed it, so I was really excited to try MacArthur's... MacArthur's missed the mark w/ me and my fiance. If I didn't have diabetes before, I have it now. I had the fried chicken, cornbread stuffing, mashed potatoes, and cornbread. He had cubed steak w/ gravy, sweet potatoes, mac n' cheese, and cornbread; and we split the peach cobbler.The fried chicken was cold and overly greasy... grease was dripping off the meat, and it wasn't seasoned, just salty. The cornbread stuffing... Jesus Christ, they must have dropped the salt shaker in the batch, it was too salty and just not good. The mashed potatoes were awesome, just delicious. Too bad they don't have cream gravy, just brown gravy. The cornbread was dry and crumbled everywhere.For my fiance, his cubed steak was salty and flavorless, and he said the steak itself was too soft, and there was no chew to it. His sweet potatoes were OVERLY sweet. It was good but there was too much brown sugar. Mac and cheese was good, despite the slices of american cheese on top. As he says "you really can't fuck up mac and cheese." The peach cobbler was too sweet, slimy, there was no crust, no crunch, just soft baby food for people with no teeth.Overall... I've had better southern food, hell, I make way better southern food and I've been told my food is better than people's grandmother's. But MacArthur's was just too salty, too sweet, too dry and a definite pass.

21.description: I've been to MacArthur's several times, and I've never had anything I disliked. With that being said I will tell you what they do well:Collard GreensMacaroni and CheeseCandied SweetsFried ChickenBeef Short RibsMeatloafCornbreadPeach CobblerThe service is cafeteria style, the ambiance is casual family-dining (think Naugahyde booths), clean, and bright. Since the remodel they have a private room or two, and outdoor seating. The more "special" offerings vary based on the day of the week, but some standards are available daily. There is almost always a long line, but they efficiently move you on through.

17.description: Ordered Short Ribs they were ok. Black eyed peas had no flavor, mac and cheese was mediocre.  No kids menu for my 5 year old daughter had to pay full price so she could play over food.  No prices for dinner posted.  Fried chicken was really good tho. Ran out of sweet potatoes (10min wait) and greens (2 hour wait) @ 1 o'clock Sunday afternoon. WTF!?  If you want some better soul food go to Pricilla's in Hillside just about 10 minutes away with no traffic.

10.description: Good price. Ok food. Greens had a weird unneeded flavor.Mac and cheeee was ok... not very cheesy nor was it real cheese... it was american cheese.Smothered chicken was good.Smothered pork chop was ok.Yams... too sweet.

5.description: MMMMMMM!!!!! My whole family loves this place! I never mind waiting in that long line because I know once I get to that display case it is going down! I only ever  order a combination the same things. I also like to base my reviews on the cleanliness of a restaurant because I am very critical of filthy restaurants regardless how good the food or their reputation is and MacArthur's is CLEAN!-Fried Chicken-Baked Chicken-Mac and Cheese-Greens-rice n beans-PEACH COBBLER!!! (You will lick the spoon)I hate peaches. I would never just be sitting there eating a peach. But their peach cobbler is so good I have it every time I go!. It is super rich and sweet so I always get the small and it leaves me very satisfied. I will always be a fan and a regular

3.description: MacArthur's is a cafeteria-style restaurant that serves up Southern food.  I was a little disappointed at first, as I thought it was an AYCE :P Some friends and I came here for a late-night grub, and we were all pretty excited in trying this place out.  There was a long line, which I thought was a good indication on the food.  I tried their smothered chicken, covered in gravy (the chicken was juicy, had great batter, a nice crunch, and yummy with the hot sauce), the macaroni and cheese (it was too mushy in texture and really bland), and corn (just a bowl of regular corn niblets).  The corn bread that came with the platter was more on the dry side.  I'd like to come back and try out their meatloaf, baked chicken, the seasonal yams, and the collard greens.+smothered chicken

35.description: I heard about this place from a friend. Judging by all of the pictures of famous people visiting this place it seems they are pretty popular. I had chicken, cabbage and greens. The chicken was great, but the sides lacked seasoning. Fried chicken 1-5=5. Cabbage 1-5=2. Greens 1-5=1. Pound Cake 1-5=3.

19.description: The food was okay not spectacular. I had the perch fish with macaroni and cheese and green beans. The macaroni and cheese  was rich in flavor and creamy. However, on top of each portion was a slice of yellow  (goverment)cheese that ruined the feeling of getting a southern cooked meal. The  perch was horrible it  was too salty and undercooked. I wish I had ordered the catfish. My biggest complaint was that they ran out of candied yams. However the highlight of my meal was the peach cobbler which I would suggest to anybody have for dessert. I think that I had a lot of hype for this place. In addition I'm also comparing this restaurant to the southern food that I had when living in Memphis. That's a hard sander to live up to. So I will give this restaurant another try and hopefully have a better review.

28.description: I've only been here twice. Each time that I've been here, there was a line that extended all the way around the restaurant. The walls have pictures of celebrities, athletes, and political figures that have visited the restaurant. Kind of like Pink's Hotdogs in California. They have daily specials for $6.99-$8.99ish which include 1 meal and 2 sides. They are definitely NOT on the stingy side when it comes to their portions. I ordered the baked chicken with candied yams and macaroni and cheese. The backed chicken is nice and juicy. We ask for a mixture of dark and white meat. The server gives us a breast, leg and wing. The candied yams are perfectly sweetened. The macaroni and cheese has the perfect amount of cheesiness. I will definitely be back to try the rest of their delicious food.

45.description: This is just for the peach cobbler. I tried the peach cobbler and I wasn't impressed. I wouldn't buy it again. It didn't have that  "made from scratch" taste, you know? I don't know if the peaches were overcooked or canned. That's alright. They have plenty of other items for me to try

33.description: This place is a staple of Austin. And they've got pics of celebrities who have come in all over the wall. It's a no-frills kind of place, with a setup akin to a school lunch line.  It's very simple soul food, at dirt-cheap prices. So don't expect fine dining, just good old fashioned artery clogging buttery fried foods.

43.description: First time at a southern soulfood place, one word DELICIOSO!!! Everything is good, candy yams are sooooo savory, the smothered chicken was a little salty for my taste but good, mashed potatoes are great not greasy or too buttery, I love that! The Mac-n-cheese was awesome, everything is full of flavor! Oh and the fried catfish was sooooo good too! Good service, clean, line moves fast. Going back for the huge BBQ turkey leg on an empty stomach!

2.description: The lines are extra long, so be prepared to wait. Not sure I like the cafeteria style serving...but it is an interesting experience. The restaurant has a lot of seating and is pretty clean given the amount of traffic. The quality of food is comparable to a buffet...but I think it looks much better than it actually tastes. I'd choose 6978 (which is also soul food and about 10 minutes from MacArthur's) over this restaurant any day.

18.description: Nothing but great experiences each time I go to this restaurant. Of course, going on Sunday afternoons are going to be a bit busy. If you go during the week, the lines seem to move fast and the servers behind the counter make sure to give you plenty of food. Love going to this place each time I visit Chicago.

41.description: I was so eager to try this place that I took a one-way $100 cab ride from the Loop! Perhaps my expectations were unrealistic.  I was immediately put off by the cafeteria serving style display. Some of the items looked days old; fish was dry and almost translucent around the edges. Fried chicken might of been good days prior. The candied yams were too sweet, The greens and cornbread were the only hits. Peach cobbler, was too sweet, mostly crust and a scant amount of poor quality, canned peaches. There are much better places in Chicago for Soul Food. I definitely would not go back again.

52.description: I grew up in the south and I know good cooking and this place is spot on.  They have such a large variety of food to choose from.  The set-up is cafeteria style.  There is typically a line, but they never disappoint.  It is always fast moving...with the exception  of running out of fried chicken here and there.  Then there is a slight wait.  While you are standing in line take an opportunity to scope out what you want before you get to the person that is taking the food requests.  They are cash only so bring cash or you can use their ATM inside.  By far the best soul food place in Chicago.  Many people do not care for the neighborhood, but if you can look past that you'll enjoy a great southern cooked meal that is perfection.  Anytime relatives come to visit from out of town, this restaurant is a must visit.

50.description: I am in NO WAY a soul food connossieur...PuertoRican food is what I know...BUT MacArthur's smothered pork chops, will you marry me??????I have been here plenty of times, but am just now getting around to reviewing.I went with my mom and my best friend from Miami and they loved EVERYTHING.Meatloaf was great, catfish was great and all the sides were good too especially the sweet potatoes. Please order the banana pudding. I know you will be full, but just order it to go!We went for the lunch rush so it was busy and the ladies behind the counter were nice and helpful and I didn't feel rushed.There is a 10 dollar minimum for credit card purchases and three of us ate for under 25 bucks and had more than enough to take home for leftovers.I don't scare easily so the area really doesn't bother me. This is definitely my kinda restaurant when I am having fat girl days.

4.description: Been comin here since cross da street and once I have ordered the Fried Chicken dark, Mac n Cheese and Greens, or either Cabbage, Their chicken came hot, flavorful, crispy da mac n cheese, when it first comes out hot Mmmm on the Greens, I have yet to be let down, their a dependable comfort food staple wit Soul on the wayside!!!!!

6.description: I wavered between 3 and 4 stars for MacArthur's, but just on the fact that there are so few soul food spots in Chicago, I decided to go with 4. Overall the food is real good - not as good as my mother-in-law's, but still worth it. The fried chicken was decent; the ribs were super tender and delicious. The yams, my go to side for soul food, were great but less sweet and more spiced. The mac and cheese was good but a little on the bland side. Peach cobbler was yummy - also more spiced than sweet. Plus it's fast and reasonably priced. Definitely worth a visit.

22.description: Keep it moving...food is tasteless and not much to look at behind their cafeteria  line  counter. Embarrassed for them for calling this Soul Food...shame on the cooks !

15.description: Throughly enjoyed my meal here. Yes, the area may be a tad rough, but of course the hidden gems usually are the hardest to find. The price was very affordable for what I got. I ordered a breast, two legs, macaroni & cheese, collard greens (comes with a piece of cornbread) and a bottle juice and only spent $9. What a deal!! The food was so delicious and definitely filling. Cured my hangover right up. The mac & cheese was a bit drippy, but good nonetheless. I definitely WILL be coming back!

57.description: I had to go back with a co-worker who wanted to try it and was glad to see some of the old "oomph" back!  The cube steak, mac 'n cheese and corn bread dressing were excellent!  The fried chicken was still not as good as it used to be but I enjoyed my meal!

20.description: Best chicken ever. They put Popeyes and KFC to SHAME. This food is so good down to the peach cobbler! You won't be disappointed! They're also reasonably priced. I wish there were other locations but I will go out of my way to return to this restaurant ANY DAY.

36.description: One word......NASTY! This place is soo overated! If you consider this place as being home cooked food then you clearly dont know what home cooked food is. I will cook before I dine here again, sorry westsiders...... very disappointed.

14.description: So sad someone told this person they could cook, please. Just because your family tells you can cook does not mean you can cook for the public. whoever is cooking this food may be a good cook (not great or awesome ) for thier family does not mean you have the ability to cook for large number of folks. this food is swimming in grease all of it. No seasonings ,NONE.

1.description: The first time they did a good job. On my hair. So the second time i ask for a perment dye...so as the week went buy and i washed my hair i started to see the color come out so they gave me a rinse i xould have donw this myself..they got my hair straight but they didn't do what i ask. If you Let them do your hair make sure they do what you ask for..what i paid for i thought i was getting a permanent color

2.description: My sister took my daughter here to get her hair "done", and when she came home I did not like it at all. First my sister says they charged her $55 for a 11 year old child because her hair was thick and because she doesn't have a perm, what kind of mess is that. My daughter just got her hair done last night now this morning its all puffy and have tangles. My child has a very nice grade of hair, so I thought it would of been silky straight and manageable, but it was not and that's money down the drain.She had to put her hair in a ponytail this morning before school, even though she wanted to wear i down. My baby was sad about her hair this morning, but you live and you learn!

0.description: I've been getting my hair done here for a couple months and the service is usually very fast, friendly and professional. My one complaint would be the the blow dryers tend to get VERY hot and begin to burn after a while. I have thick hair so it takes my hair a good while to dry but my scalp is dry as the Nevada desert so it burns. (Hence my 4 stars) They also colored my hair and I must say I love it. Highlights, wash, blow dry and style all in a little less than 2 hours.
Now closed.  Probably because my negative Yelp review scared away potential customers. Behold, the power of Yelp'ing.

1.description: I always wondered what this store was like I kind of figured it was a clothing store. Yesterday I went in for the first time and was shocked at the amount of clothes they have. They also sell brand name clothes and disney clothes. I  fell in love with the store as soon as I walked in. Everything is well organized by sizes and gender. This is for kids only. Clothes are organized from Newborn - 2T,  2T-4T, 4-6x, 7-14/16. They have uniforms for school, french toast, all different kinds of shirts and pants. They have cute accessories and toys this store doesn't have a mess like other stores nearby. I used to shop at the stores next to this one like CW and Conway, but America's Kids is my favorite place to shop for kids. I didn't give it the last star because it's kind of hidden in a corner and there is no customer service desk. When returning or exchanging clothes you have to go the security guy first. I also love how you can get a refund on the clothes or store credit, unlike other stores that have a strict policy of no refunds only exchange.

0.description: Great prices, great kids and infant clothes, a variety of styles to choose from.... And school uniforms....... I'm always satisfied with my purchases and can always find something unique as well.

I LOVE THIS RESTAURANT! I been going here for years and my tummy is always satisfied. I usually get the chicken wings, Italian beefs, foot long polishes, steak tacos, and etc. There mild sauce is DELICIOUS and their food is reasonably priced :-)

28.description: Great food better than Harold's chicken shacks!!!!!

1.description: Great no frills, take out chicken. I found it searching Yelp for a new place to try after 10pm on a weeknight. I was able to park right out front and when I walked in it was empty. This led me to question my decision to drive over. But I placed my order anyway and just as I turned to walk away from the window, I noticed a line had formed behind me.  I was happy to see its popularity and happy to have been ahead of the crowd when ordering. As I waited for my ordered, I came across a poster which lists the various locations in the Chicagoland area.  For anyone who lives here, you would agree that many establishments cater to certain areas or parts of the city. I found it interesting that there are both west and southside locations. After dodging a few beggars posted up at the door, I retreated to my car and made it home to dig in. The chicken was very tasty and hot. The fries were fresh and flavorful.  As with all Chicago based chicken establishments, it was drenched in "sauce" which is just okay IMO. But the place is a welcomed addition to my late night bites repertoire.

9.description: Love Love Love Uncle Remus. Calling in your order first is highly recommended. The sauce is to die for! And I love the fries!

29.description: This is a carry out spot.  The chicken is delicious but the wait is not.  A short wait is 15 minutes. if you get your food in less than 5 minutes then it was probably ready already and you want a new order. It would be 5 stars but again the wait + the cover charge to leave the joint (the guys outside asking for money when you leave with your food) = 4 stars tops.  The food is delicious if its cooked fresh and the sauce is pretty good (for those of you who rate food by its condiments). For those looking for a comparison to Harold's, it's about neck and neck with a GOOD Harold's(you know what I mean). It doesn't taste the same (because it's a different spot) but it's every bit as good as a good Harold's and certainly better than J&J or Shark's for chicken.

23.description: This place and the one in Broadview raised there prices, a lot. A 6 piece wing dinner is now almost $9.  The chicken and sauce is good, but not THAT good.

5.description: Fried chicken in my favorite food and literally this is the best chicken I've ever had. It's that sauce!! This location is carry out only which I didn't realize so we ended up just eating it in the car which is definitely hard because your fingers will be sticky!! Expect to wait a bit which I don't mind because you know you're getting it fresh! Also, don't park in the parking lot because there is a sign that says you might get towed. We came on a Wednesday and they had a 6 wings deal and then we got a two piece dark in addition. It was all delicious but I preferred the two piece over the wings. This was a lot for two people and we were stuffed!! Also we didn't eat the rolls so if we could substitute that, I would next time. I'd like to check out another location that has a dining area but I feel like the reviews aren't as good. I'd be sad if I went all the way out there and the chicken wasn't as saucy!!! But literally, have been thinking about the next time I'm going since we finished our meal. Check it out!!!

31.description: I haven't been to the actual store, but my friend is a huge fan and she got me a box of fried chicken wings for the first time today. Even though they were cold, two hours old, and reheated, they were still awesome. The sauce is amazing -- it's like a mix between sweet and sour and BBQ. SO GOOD.

25.description: Years ago my coworker would bring these to work for us.  They were sooooooo good and now I work on Madison and am soooo excited this is right down the street from me ...I will be visiting on my lunch breaks!!!

12.description: This is my 3rd time eating from this restaurant and I must stay I am never disappointed. The sauce that they use on this chicken must have crack in it, because its addictive. Definitely worth trying.

21.description: Tender chicken. Salty. Crunchier than Harold's. Sauce is good but not enough on meat and fries. Competitive prices for a chicken shack. Overall, very similar to Harold's in flavor.

16.description: There's not a lot of chicken shacks so I was force to come here first u gotta get past the guys whistling yo baby at u at the front of the place and then once in the doors you encounter the cd. Dvd. Bootleg man after u finally stand around rejecting all those guys u wait ten mins to just place your order thru a card.board tape window for the gurl who was on her cell phone to say oh we closing in 10 mins we don't have no chicken ?????wtf  say wht u want about the Southside... but at least whn I go to a chicken shack that's open I get product this place. Is why places in our neighborhoods are often given a poor out look from the atmosphere to the customer service by far the worst black owned business I've encounter n yet people wonder why we don't support one another well off to Boston market I goooooooo.

17.description: Good wings, love the sauce!  But took an hour to get my food, which was only a 6 piece wings w/ fries.  I'm glad that the employees were friendly & patient.

10.description: Delicious! I ordered a 12 pc. Wing with mild sauce. There was a perfect amount of sauce and the food was hot. I ordered and waited and prep time was about 7 to 10 min. The chicken is crisper than others I have had. Think thick crispy batter

11.description: Best chicken hands down! It is very flavorful and the sauce is the perfect compliment. If you need to reheat any left over chicken later, it remains crispy even under the sauce! Pure love. I have been told multiple times that Harold's is better, however I disagree. Living in the medical district the closet Harold's was on Western, and it just didn't compare. The neighborhood can be a little sketchy, but just get your chicken and go because the food is well worth the visit. They also have really good fried okra.

26.description: Best chicken in Chicago HANDS DOWN! Harold's has nothing on Uncle Remus.

27.description: can I get 6 wings, fried hard, salt & pepper, w/ extra mild sauce, oh & no mild sauce on the fries???? i love that chicken!! sometimes I wish I still lived in chicago just to get some uncle remus :-(

35.description: Okay........I am not ashamed to say I like Uncle Remus better than Harold's Chicken. Being born and raised on the southside of Chicago, I was sheltered from trying a lot of foods on the westside. In 2006, an ex-girlfriend, who was from the westside, brought me some of this stuff and I have been hooked eversince. The sauce is sweeter and they give you a roll instead of a slice of bread. The only reason I won't give this place 5 stars is because sometimes the women behind the glass, taking your order sometimes needs an attitude adjustment. There has even been times where they would run out of chicken. (Imagine that)Harold's I still love you, and we have been together for a looooooong time, but on the actual taste side of things Uncle Remus has the slight edge.

0.description: One of our favorite spots for wings and catfish....mmmm going tonight. Been going here for years. Great hours. Now that we live in city easy to get to more.

20.description: Uncle Remus is better than Harold's without a doubtAsk for extra sauce!

19.description: Well this place is not pretty to say the least. Scary to the eye but the chicken wings are pretty tasty. Not better than Harold's in my opinion. But it is good and cheaper!. Don't expect the best service but that's fine with me I don't have to tip! Very Ghetto and hood but the bird is Fye!

33.description: ok so this is the best place to go when you want some chicken with good sauce, i go to this location specifically for their grab pan, which is 10 pieces of chicken, bread and fries for about 11 dollars, i love it. now dont be scared because its in the hood, they wont bother you

2.description: OMG did I love the chicken at this place! Since I moved to this area, I have searched high and low for some decent chicken and all the places out here in the suburbs, to put it mildly, have been a major disappointment. Finally I found a place that knows how to do it right! I am originally from Kansas City, and we have some pretty fantastic chicken places like Go Chicken Go, Stroud's, RC's and several others. I also have family down South in Georgia and Florida where places like KFC, Church's, Popeye's etc. can hardly operate a restaurant in many towns because all the independents with their great great grandfather's recipe beat the shit out of them and the locals know their chicken (try Po' Folks if you are in the St Petersburg/Tampa area). A coworker of mine that stays in the city recommended Uncle Remus and I am glad I took him up on his advice as the grub was spectacular.Don't be in a hurry if you are coming here as the line does not move along at a rapid pace. "Fast Food" this place is not. They make your meal to order, and I wish I would of read the reviews here at Yelp more closely and called in ahead of time so it would of been waiting for me when I got there. The girl at the counter was very sweet and hospitable and gave me a short rendition since me staring up at the menu probably gave away that I had never been there before. I went with the three piece with fries and a roll and made my way to my table. I also picked up a side order of fried okra, as it is a personal fav of mine. There are very few tables here if you want to dine in. The vast majority of folks took their food carry out. Even before I sat down the smell on the walk over was heavenly. Even now I am licking my chops thinking about it. They douse the top liberally with hot sauce to let it seep in unless you request it on the side (saves me a step). This is a tactic that is very common in Georgia and the Carolinas as well, though not to be confused with "Hot Chicken" which is a product that is almost exclusive to Nashville (or people from Nashville). The sauce is a delicious and tangy addition, but not much in the way of heat so that it jives with most people's taste buds. I would be curious to know what is in it, as I have never had anything quite like it before so I am guessing it is something they concocted in house. I went up and got an extra side after tasting though. Delish. I am also not sure what these guys use in their batter, as it is probably one of those "I could tell you but I would have to kill you" situations. It is both flavorful and spicy. The skin has a lovely peppery flavor and is nice and crispy without being over breaded. This contrasts with the succulent meat of the chicken itself and the tangy flavor from the sauce to create pure chicken nirvana. SO FRIGGIN GOOD!  Also, a word to the wise, let it sit for a bit before diving in. They literally take it from the fryer to your basket and put it in your hand, so it is scalding hot. It probably looks like I have a cold sore on my lip right now from taking a huge bite initially. Rookie mistake on my part. The roll I had was quickly turned into a makeshift "sandwich" by me ripping some chicken off and cutting the roll in two. My Mother used to always consider this bad manners ranking right up there with drinking milk straight from the carton. I say screw all that noise. When I saw other people doing the same thing I felt an immediate sense of affirmation. I have actually seen a few people at a chicken place in the burbs trying to eat fried chicken with a knife and fork. Seriously? These freaks need to stick with their hummus dips and certified organic {insert food here} and leave the real food to the professionals.   The fired Okra was also on point. As a person who has bought fresh Okra and tried to pull this off myself at home, trust me when I tell you it is very easy to screw up. The UR Okra was nice and golden brown, but not overcooked, which is the most difficult challenge in getting it right. Prices here are quite reasonable. You can get a feast for under 10 bucks. Overall, this place ranks among some of the very best fried chicken I have ever had, which speaks volumes coming from me. After having a couple of month drought when first moving here, I am glad I discovered this place when I did as it is a important staple food (at least for me) to have in the arsenal. I sort of wish they had waffles too, as I have a thing for the savory and sweet combo from chicken and waffle joints, but no need to stray from the path when they already do chicken so well. If you are in need of some good Southern cooking, this is your spot. According to the clerk who took my order, this place has been in business for over 50 years, and after eating here it is easy to see why.

34.description: This place is simple. Carry out only, there isn't even seating for while you're waiting on your order, so call ahead and you won't have to wait long. The people are nice but busy, so don't waste their time. The food is incredibly well priced. Honestly, I can't speak to anything they serve besides the chicken and fries, because every time I get near that hot sauce I don't have a choice. Now, I'm not really a fan of most fried chicken and I would have never experienced the bliss that is Uncle Remus if I didn't happen upon a "Fun Lunch" for the honors students at the middle school where I used to work. That being said, Uncle Remus chicken is mind-blowing. I love it. I think I used to get more excited about "fun lunch" than the kids after my first experience. Seriously, I don't think you can be a part of a fried chicken conversation without having had this chicken. I love it and I go out of my way to get it.

32.description: Uncle Remus offers tender, if small, pieces of chicken coated and fried in a crispy, if flavorless, batter.  The one thing that this place has going for it is price: it's a bargoon.  Despite being so close to the Oak Park border and only a block from a large CPD station, I wouldn't come here at night.Oh, and the lady who served me was nice, as were the other patrons.

18.description: Because I grew up in the area, it's not a problem to me. I know this joint is in the hood & might not be so inviting or appealing to the eye but never judge a book by its cover.....UNCLE REMUS IS STRAIGHT FYE!! ON POINT & WILL HAVE U COMING BACK FOR MORE!!! There is no comparison to Harold's! Uncle Remus is the best chicken joint there is!! NO DOUBT ABOUT IT!!

13.description: Went to order today never been there before because am not from the town and was told to do a phone order I had to spend 35.00 for her to take my order,such friendly ppl so any one that have a small group or are alone don't expect to be able to order over the phone unless u gone SPEND 35.00 on ur phone order was looking forward to eat there because of the reviews now I have no interest in eating some where that I have to spend 35.00 to place a phone order when it's just me passing thou this town.

4.description: The chicken was GREAT! I have no complaints whatsoever with the chicken..the saucy chicken was finger licking good and tasty down to the bone. I ordered fried okra and got fries...no biggie...they have limited parking and you can't call in your order after 3pm unless it's over $35 FYI

24.description: Oh yea...this chicken gives me goose bumps just thinking about it.  After I moved from the Southside and broke up with Harold...I didn't think I'd fine anyone better, but then a friend introduced me to Remus.  I must admit, I was skeptical at first.  His neighborhood is a lil rough, but once you get pass the DVD & Loose Squares guys standing out front, and have a little patience, cause it's gonna be a wait...you're be introduced to your new uncle!

6.description: I hate going to this place because of the location but nothing has ever happened while there and I must admit sometimes I get entertained by the customers. The wait time can be long. It's usually crowed but I know why. They have the best chicken ever.  So it remains one of my favorites.

22.description: There's not a lot of chicken shacks so I was force to come here first u gotta get past the guys whistling yo baby at u at the front of the place and then once in the doors you encounter the cd. Dvd. Bootleg man after u finally stand around rejecting all those guys u wait ten mins to just place your order thru a card.board tape window for the gurl who was on her cell phone to say oh we closing in 10 mins we don't have no chicken ?????wtf  say wht u want about the Southside... but at least whn I go to a chicken shack that's open I get product this place. Is why places in our neighborhoods are often given a poor out look from the atmosphere to the customer service by far the worst black owned business I've encounter n yet people wonder why we don't support one another well off to Boston market I goooooooo.

15.description: BEST CHICKEN I HAVE EVER TASTED.  Hands down!!! Notice my first sentence is in all caps.  Words can't describe how good their food is.  The roll was yummy and fries too.  Love that mild sauce.  I'm from St Louis and the chicken is so good that I would drive 5 hours to Chicago strictly to get me some chicken from there and then drive back home.

7.description: I could easily make a case for giving this place five stars and the only reason why I don't is because they put the sauce on the chicken rather than on the side. Anyhow I went here expecting to get half a chicken and have two of the pieces saved for later. Yeah that didn't happen.  The chicken was so good that it didn't survive a few minutes let alone a few hours.  Everything was fried up hot and crispy. It was seasoned down to the bone so good that you didn't even need that sauce that sets it off and takes things to a whole nother level.  That aside I wish this place lacks both parking and seating so keep that in mind.

8.description: Food was good, mild sauce ummmm I've had better. Told then sauce on the side and I open my bag of goodies and everything from my fried okra, fries and bread had mild sauce , chicken was good tho.

30.description: This chicken tonight was great!! You have to love the sauce!! Lol. ;D

3.description: Eat up bring a friend you will love it!!!! Best chicken and sauce in the city! Harold's who??

14.description: Best chicken delicious. I drive from the suburbs to get this chicken reasonable prices . A little slow but wee worth the wait

0.description: Knowledgeable staff. Friendly-family like atmosphere.

1.description: I thought the shaved ice lacked flavor. The condensed milk didn't go together. You could freeze a taro shake and shave it. It would be cheaper too. In the Philippines we call it "scramble." LOLFor the ube and halo-halo ice cream macaroon sandwich, you could buy them at Fresh Farms and you'll have 1.5 gallons of ice cream for almost the same price.

9.description: They have so many flavors and toppings here! Even more choices than your typical LA shaved ice shop.This tiny shop has a lot to offer: frozen yogurt, shaved ice, macarons, macaron ice cream sandwich, coconut water, and bubble tea!The guy who works here is really friendly and knowledgable about the shop/company and the variety of food they offer.The quality of shaved ice is good but i wish they give you more toppings!

12.description: The green tea shaved ice was pretty good. It goes well with the condensed milk and mochi. The owner is very nice.

21.description: My favorite dessert place has opened in Evanston! They have another location in Lincoln Park which I love. Snow dragon is a place to get a really unique and delicious dessert. It's very different from frozen yogurt, ice cream, or gelato! The texture is very light and fluffy and is hard to describe- you just need to try it. It is very airy yet satisfying at the same time. I have only tried the green tea snow since I got it the first time we went earlier this year at their other location and loved it so much I have not been able to stray. They do have lots of flavors though like taro, pumpkin spice, coffee, strawberry, and many many others. They also have a variety of toppings. You can take a look at my pictures to see the two topping bars. I personally prefer adding fresh fruit to my snow. You can pick two or add more for an additional charge. Finally, you pick a drizzle to go on top. I highly suggest the condensed milk. Other than snow, they have different dessert options like frozen yogurt, macarons, bubble tea, and cake pops. Something for everyone! I would highly recommend this place for dessert. Give it a try! The man who was there (Owner? Manager?) was also very friendly, kind, and helpful. 5 stars!

16.description: This was the first time that I have had this as a dessert and it definitely will not be my last! Honestly, I can't describe how light and incredibly delicious the snow tastes. I will probably be visiting this place once a week because I'm addicted to this place. I got Watermelon snow, which strawberry and cheesecake for my toppings with a raspberry drizzle. I can't wait to try other combinations as well. The shop and the customer service was great. I will definitely be back for more snow. Oh and the macaroons were good as well!

17.description: Welcome to Evanston!!  My kids and I enjoyed this tasty treat.  We opted for the green tea shaved ice/snow with condensed milk on top. Service was super friendly and I look forward to more of their offerings especially the hot tea with the cold weather coming!  They also have the self serve frozen yoghurt with toppings here too. Complete with the frozen yogurt macaroon sandwiches!

10.description: I had the tiramisu shaved ice. It was a bit expensive for the amount we got. I prefer buying it from the Korean bakery at golf, it's called bakersville. They give you a lot and it's not even that expensive. They even give you icecream on top of the shaved ice. Those two are a bit different but I would still prefer the one from bakersville. I thought that was a waste of money.... But I would like to try the macaroon ice cream sandwich next time. Hopefully won't be disappointed.

5.description: This is a must try place and product. Flavored shaved snow is a different and personally, a lighter take on dessert compared to ice cream and even frozen yogurts(although they also have organic frozen yogurt) in the store. Regular sized order is $4.99 which consists of a good  amount of shaved ice, 2 toppings(various popping bobas,chooclate mini cups,cheesecake bites,mini mochis, etc.) and drizzle(chocolate, condensed milk, rose and a few more to choose from)... On top of an amazing service. The place is small and can sit around 8 to 10 people. They have small round tables and high stools. My friends and I tried different flavors of shaved ice and they were allWonderful! I had the taro flavor and I love how it's not too sweet and the taro flavor excels even with the condensed milk drizzle, cheesecake bites & mochi toppings. I liked the coffee and tiramisu flavors as well.  Their mango flavor is a must try as well. The owner gave us a macaron with Ube flavored ice cream and that was so good! The macaron was light, perfectly flaky and the ube ice cream is exactly how ube ice cream should be (we have Ube in my native country. Ube is like Taro here in the US). I will definitely try the green tea, watermelon, and red bean flavors next time I stop by!

11.description: There is a reason why I went here 3 times in one week, and why the owner recognizes me now (whoops...). Also because I'm a sucker for shaved snow, and I can't even start on how excited I was that there's finally shaved snow in Evanston. Too bad it's tucked away in a hard-to-find storefront by the North Face store /parking garage entrance on Davis (you're welcome I gave you directions)Note: this is NOT Hawaiian Shaved Ice with the coarse ground ice and syrup on top. This is something one million times more amazing called Shaved Snow. It's a Taiwanese dessert where the flavor is already frozen into the ice, and then a special shaver shaves it into a fluffy pile. Imagine the equivalent of if cotton candy and ice cream had a baby, and that's what the texture is like - fluffy but cold and well-flavored. On to the actual shaved snow! There's a lot of flavors, ranging from chocolate to mango to taro and many more. I tried the tiramisu (good), mango (decent, mango flavor wasn't strong enough - I'm very picky on traditional flavors!), and chocolate (also decently good). A small costs $4.99, and could be split across 2 people for a light after-class snack. You also get two toppings included in the price (the toppings are much like those you would find at a frozen yogurt bar). The owner is very nice and clearly cares a lot about the place, even making sure I enjoyed my dessert and charging my credit card after I was satisfied. The space is very small, though, with only 3 tables inside. Luckily, the owner puts everything into to-go containers just in case. They also have macaron ice cream sandwiches, macarons, frozen yogurt, and bubble tea. The bubble tea is a no - it's more like a smoothie, and was somewhat powdery in taste. Fortunately, everything else was a hit. Ice Cream sandwiches are amazing, even if they don't match up to my favorite at Icebox in Cupertino, California - I had the halo-halo, and both the macaron and ice cream were good! Macarons were also light and fluffy, and I would buy again.

3.description: My taro shaved ice with the pink chocolate balls reminded me of a unicorn. Okay weird, I know...This place has been on my to-try list forever. The concept is from LA (where froyo, cupcakes, milk teas and other delicious yummy food trends have been conceived). I was even more excited when they replaced the old Red Mango in downtown Evanston with a Snow Dragon Shavery and Yogurt!Went with my bestie on a Wednesday night and the owner was super hospitable and explained the different choices and toppings. $4.99 will buy you a small with your choice of 2 toppings and condensed milk garnish. They have a ton of fun flavors (even seasonal pumpkin) and I've been told they have about 40 in their Lincoln Park location. I've had "bing soo" before in Asia- the traditional iced shaving dessert-but Snow Dragon's shaved ice was different. It was very light, delicate, and smooth- with snow-like consistency. The shaved ice in Asia are actual mini ice chunks doused in condensed milk with different fruit/red bean toppings. I had the taro and my bestie had the tiramisu (which I tried) and both were yummy and different. The consistency is different than frozen yogurt and I finished my shaved ice in less than five minutes. Solid and a fun new place to try out! I definitely want to try the macaron ice-cream sandwiches next time...but to be absolutely honest, I'll pass on the shaved ice. It's too light and delicate for my taste, but I definitely recommend that you try it for yourself because it's so unique!

0.description: Let me start off by saying I think they add crack as a secret ingredient (kidding, kidding)  I can't wait to go back!  This place has shaved ice, frozen yogurt, macarons, and boba tea.  SHAVED SNOW Snow Dragon Shavery and Yogurt (SDSY)'s shaved snow comes in small ($4.99 for 1 flavor, 2 toppings, & a drizzle), medium (6.99 for 1 flavor, 2 toppings, & a drizzle), and large ($8.99 for 2 flavors, three toppings, & a drizzle).  Their snow flavors are: original, green tea, strawberry, black sesame, chocolate, taro, coconut, lychee, pina colada, vanilla bean, mango, milk tea, tiramisu, watermelon, and red bean.  They had an assortment of toppings including various popping bobas, jelly, crunch, Oreo crumbles, and fresh fruit.  Their drizzle flavors are mango, condensed milk, caramel, honey, chocolate, rose, strawberry, and raspberry. FLAVORS (of shaved snow):-Tiramisu:  It was heavenly.  Not too rich, not bland, not too sweet.  I have never tried shaved snow in Hawaii so I don't know how it compares, but this stuff is like nothing I have tried before.  It's very light & fluffy so the flavor isn't too rich. It's like phyllo, but smooth and creamy.  -Strawberry: My husband's favorite. Sweet, but not too sweet. Creamy.-Milk tea: A bit too bland for my taste.-Watermelon: delicious and refreshing. It would be a perfect summer treat, but I have no complaints eating it on Chicago's cold winter days.  -Chocolate: this one was disappointing.  The consistency wasn't as light. It was also way too rich. I couldn't finish it. I felt like I was eating a large, cold brownie.-Coffee: Good, but I still think tiramisu was better.-Mango: Delicious. Another hit. Similar to the strawberry (not too sweet).-Taro: I didn't know what to expect, but this was surprisingly good.  ICE CREAM MACARONSI've tried their green tea as well as ube ice cream macarons.  The ice cream tasted really fresh (no freezer burned parts, no ice particles. Just good flavor, without being to rich).  Both tasted great!SERVICEJust note that there are NO SAMPLES.  The flavor of shaved snow you choose is, well, shaved from a huge chunk of "ice" so Mike (one of the owners) told us we would be unable to sample the flavors.  That being said, Mike was extremely patient and helpful with helping us choose flavor combinations.  I can't wait to go back and try the other flavors!

20.description: Its a family owned business and you can see that they really care about the place. My friend and I went to this place last night and it has many great options. We ordered the taro shaved ice with strawberries, mochi and a condensed milk drizzle. Ee also order the great tea ice cream macaron sandwich! It was better than i expected.

19.description: Their macaroon is the best in Chicago area, and one of the best I have ever tried, comparable to the ones in Europe! And yet, their green tea shaved ice is amazing too. Must come.

2.description: Yay!  Snow Dragon Shavery is finally open in Evanston!  We love the Chicago location, but parking is terrible there.  The shave ice is the same - plenty of fluffy, tasty varieties to choose from.  Lots of topping choices as well.  Don't forget the condensed milk drizzle. The guy shaving our snow was super nice.  There are only 3 tables inside, but maybe when it gets warmer out, they could offer outdoor seating?One other customer got the macaron ice cream sandwich.  It looked delicious, so I'd love to try it next time.  They also have regular macarons that are perfect for smaller appetites.  We are looking forward to coming back here again soon.  :)

18.description: OMG - I have a new favorite food! Shaved ice is so delicious! I had 2 servings on my first visit. Snow Dragons is an excellent place to go. The shaved ice is light and sweet and the owner is very friendly. We will go back again. And again. And again.

13.description: Snow Dragon Shaver has awesome hazelnut Gelato and live cultures yogurt, good for the tummy. Rosie is sweet and kind.  Great place!!

4.description: My favorite dessert place has opened in Evanston! They have another location in Lincoln Park which I love. Snow dragon is a place to get a really unique and delicious dessert. It's very different from frozen yogurt, ice cream, or gelato! The texture is very light and fluffy and is hard to describe- you just need to try it. It is very airy yet satisfying at the same time. I have only tried the green tea snow since I got it the first time we went earlier this year at their other location and loved it so much I have not been able to stray. They do have lots of flavors though like taro, pumpkin spice, coffee, strawberry, and many many others. They also have a variety of toppings. You can take a look at my pictures to see the two topping bars. I personally prefer adding fresh fruit to my snow. You can pick two or add more for an additional charge. Finally, you pick a drizzle to go on top. I highly suggest the condensed milk. Other than snow, they have different dessert options like frozen yogurt, macarons, bubble tea, and cake pops. Something for everyone! I would highly recommend this place for dessert. Give it a try! The man who was there (Owner? Manager?) was also very friendly, kind, and helpful. 5 stars!

6.description: I literally can't even this place. Snow Dragon is amazing - I've been waiting forever for Illinois to get flavored shaved snow and now it's few blocks away from my doorsteps. So much flavors to choose from for the shaved snow - fruity, decadent, tart flavors.. you name it. I've tried the black sesame and taro flavors already. Highly recommend those with the condensed milk. Also, I'm a big fan of the ice cream macaron. I got the ube flavor macaron and it reminds me so much of my hometown in Taiwan. Beware, this place is going to get you addicted!

15.description: Seems they are closed in the winter.

7.description: The owner here is so nice! He was very friendly to us, and walked us through all of the shaved snow and toppings, frozen yogurt, and ice cream macarons in the store. One time, I walked by and he was giving out free samples of frozen yogurt. The shaved snow is delicious. We got the green tea flavor, and it came with all of the typical toppings you'd find at a frozen yogurt place (popping bubbles, mochi, fruit, etc.). To top it off, it was drizzled with condensed milk on top. Very unique texture! Would definitely come back and try more flavors.

8.description: This place is amazing! Their shaved ice is delicious and a fun new treat that you can't find anywhere else. I wish they had something like this on the east coast. Even New York doesn't have a shaved ice place like this.If you've been to Hawaii and tried their shave ice, this is slightly different.
