Instead of plain ice that gets shaved as it rotates in the machine and has flavored syrup poured onto it (almost like a light, fluffy, snow one), Snow Dragon instead flavors the ice first before freezing them into big blocks to be shaved down. Then you just choose what toppings you would like to add on, and what flavor drizzle to put on.I tried the green tea flavor, which is very popular, and the new chickoo flavor (a tropical Asian fruit that I've had before in the Philippines. I would describe the taste as something close to a pear in both flavor and texture), which turns out to be pretty mild in flavor.According to my cousin, this location in Evanston is a little smaller than the one in Lincoln Park, but they give you larger portions and the really friendly guy working here is more knowledgable about the food. I highly recommend to everyone that you stop in and try a great new sweet treat when you're looking for something better than the boring old ice cream shop and Pinkberry just isn't doing it for you.

14.description: I was so excited to find out there's a Snow Dragon in Evanston! I've been to their Lincoln Park location before, and this one is similar, just a lot smaller. The owner is always very friendly and helpful. If you've never tried shaved snow before, it's a really unique desert with light fluffy texture.  You pick the shaved snow flavor, then choose a drizzle and add toppings. We got the green tea and black sesame shaved snow with condensed milk drizzle and three toppings ($8.99). There's many toppings to choose from, and most of them are sweets and not fresh fruit - I wish there were more healthy options! There were only a few fruits, which did not look very fresh. Also, the price seems a bit high to me - the serving size is quite large, but it's just ice and flavoring, so it'd be nice if the shaved snow came with more toppings. The green tea had a strong tea taste, which I really like, and the black sesame was also good, though not as flavorful. I've tried the red bean and watermelon flavors before and found they are also not as flavorful and tasty as the green tea. If you want to try something else, Snow Dragon also has macarons, macaron ice cream sandwiches, drinks, and organic frozen yogurt.I'll definitely be back but only because the green tea shaved snow is phenomenal, and will probably pass on other flavors, which really don't compare to the green tea for me. Overall, I really like the idea of Snow Dragon but wish they had more fresh fruit of better quality, and include more toppings in the price.

2.description: I placed an online order with a service called Bloomstoday.com on Oct 5 to have a birthday floral arrangement delivered to a friend on Oct 6. The online company apparently contracts local floral shops in the area of your delivery, and The Flower Pot and Basket Shop received my order. I chose this particular service because it guaranteed delivery by 5pm.. Being a birthday gift and surprise, (to an elderly friend in a not so great part of the city, early by 5pm delivery... that was perfect.) Well, The Flower Pot botched that plan up. When I discovered just after 5pm my arrangement had not been delivered, I called Bloomstoday.com because they were my only contact ( I didn't know who the local shop was until everything had been f*cked up) Bloomstoday.com was closing and could only offer to send me delivery confirmation on Oct 7. I was livid! I had ordered the flowers for 5pm delivery Oct 6 not late delivery & definitely not OCT 7th!!  Finally, well after 8pm my friend calls to thank me for the flowers she just received. She said the delivery guy was just leaving her front door.. 8pm?! Are you kidding me?! Then to top it off the flower arrangment was suppose to have 1 Happy Birthday Mylar balloon which was left out & not delivered! Such incompetence.!Needless to say, I complained to Bloomtoday.com and they gave me the name of this florist they used; but I advised them I won't be using them or their incompent florist  The Flower Pot and Basket Shop in the future. Point blank. Period.

44.description: By far, my favorite sex toy shop is Early to Bed.  EtB's boutique is fun, welcoming, informative, has quality merchandise, AND still sexyyy.Hold up, hold up, hold up...fun, welcoming, and informative for a sex toy shop?  Slather on some lube there's going to be a celebration!In store, EtB let's you see, touch, and read about before you buy.  Ever want to know what silicone vs. CyberSkin feels like...well now you can fondle them both.  All of their selection has a "display" version where you can actually hold (if you wish) the item you're interested in.  Many of the items also have attached customer reviews so you can get an idea of what you're in for by someone who has already given the toy a test drive.  In you're adventurous...or hungry...they'll even let you taste the lube if you ask.However, best of all EtB is budget friendly while also always going the extra mile to make sure their store has quality toys and porn.  Yes, they have expensive toys, but they also have very reasonably priced toys that won't break the day after you get them.  Their online store is just as great.  Most online sex shops just have 98792466 items and you have no idea what you're buying, where it's coming from, or if you're getting ripped off.  EtB's online store is smaller than most, but still has a sizable and diverse selection.  The only thing to note about their online store is that although their prices are reasonable they can't really compete with Amazon.com.  If you're like to support a kick ass store then spend the extra $10...if ya just want your toy then always check Amazon.com for the same item first.Have toy questions? Feeling a bit overwhelmed, I told her "not yet" and continued looking around. I circled the store once before she asked me again if there was anything I had questions about. We had some playful banter about it being my first time and she told me if there was anything I needed just to ask. Really, great fun, great products, great vibe. Highly recommended.

45.description: Beautiful shop full of helpful folks and fun things to try out. Not intimidating, easy to find what you might be looking for, or figure out what you're looking for if you don't yet know. Try it out.

33.description: You know what's remarkable about this place?  Yeah, it's a sex-positive, feminist-owned, passion-driven, queer-friendly sex toy shop that's close to everything and moderately-priced.  Everything you've heard is true.But...what really stuns me about Early to Bed is that staff really watch out for customers - "oh, let me check and see if this has batteries in the packaging," or "do you need any advice about how this works?" or "hey, you should do this when you get home." and they know the  products. "this fun factory is waterproof, but that one has a stronger vibrate," etc.I've lived in other cities and never found a store comparable to E2B, where you walk in and feel welcome, happy - no, GIDDY!  Excited!  It should always be a blast buying erotica or sex toys - yes! - and all too often it's creepy and off-putting.  I love that you can get a sense of the products without their packaging, feel how hard they go, or even ask questions.My friends and I make a pilgrimage here once a year to see what's "up" (get it?  God-damn, I am funny).  I highly recommend you do the same.  As soon as possible.

43.description: I love you, Early to Bed.The workshops. The quite friendly staff. A very accessible location. A clean and inviting storefront. And their products.This is what sex positive stores aspire to be.

2.description: This is my shop of choice. They're always very knowledgeable and super friendly. Their website is a handy tool with a shop and knowledge base. I like that my friend was able to order something for me long-distance and it didn't need to be shipped to me, I could just pick it up, since I'm local. So many businesses don't allow pickup if you order online. I remember hearing about the shop before I ever actually moved to Chicago. I think I read an article about it or by one of the staff in a feminist magazine. Always a good sign that the place will be female friendly and won't make me feel like a pervert for walking in with a vagina.

18.description: Been a huge fan of this place since I moved out of Uptown in 2010.To this day it's the only shop I feel comfortable enough to physically walk into.  Their online videos are great too and so informative.  I really love this shop!  I feel like it's personally catered to me.What else is there to say?My boyfriend walked into the store with me once.  He was quiet the whole time until we approached the woman at the register.  He said, "Man.  It is SO chill in here." and she chuckled haha.

41.description: This place is outstanding.  I feel like it's a curated show in there--someone has obviously picked the best of the best goods out of the millions of products available.  The staff is really friendly and open. And there are descriptions and reviews by staff and customers that are extremely helpful.  I love Early to Bed and only shop there--even though I moved away from Chicago a few years ago.

52.description: I would never go anywhere else for sex toys. I've had the most comfortable, fun and educational experiences at ETB! The staff is knowledgeable, but won't interfere unless you ask for help. They respect customers' privacy. However, they are happy to help you if you need to know what something is, want to feel it's vibration power or hear what people like and don't like. There is nothing at all skeezy about it (as is the case with most sex toy stores in Chicago) and you can tell that everyone who works there believes in sexual health and making sex toy shopping a fun experience, not an embarrassing one. LOVE LOVE LOVE! In fact, all this talk makes me want to go right now. BYE!

50.description: Okay, so going into an "adult store" can be scary and intimidating... I had butterflies in my stomach before stepping foot in the door -- but friends (who don't even live in the city) highly highly recommended E2B, so, yeah, had to give it a shot.The store is set up amazingly inside.  I love it.  Not overwhelming.  Not sketchy.  I mean, yes, there was a group of giggling (18+) kids... but meh.  My gut knew that was going to happen so I just ignored them.I got a first timers kit -- LOVE IT.  Lube, two vibes and some accessories.  Then I threw in another vibe (10 pulse settings.. TEN!), and some vegan cuffs for good measure.  They put the batteries in for me as well, so I was all set when I got home.I'll definitely be back.  I'm hooked!  PLUS -- this is the biggie... Got an old, dead vibe??  They have Vibe Trade-In days where you can get $10 towards a new toy... and they'll recycle your dearly departed vibe.I follow them on twitter (@Earlytobed) and they're always responsive and helpful.  LOVE LOVE LOVE.

4.description: I ordered through FTM Essentials, which is the same company but with a portion of their inventory specifically geared toward transgender individuals. I ordered a Masho Packer and an Aslan packing strap. They gave me 2-day shipping, everything was packaged very nicely in a sealed priority bag, and they even included a few pamphlets with resources for trans folks, and tips for how to keep my packer healthy. They also included a little candy! Awesome, guys! Great stuff. They also worked promptly with my pathetic, anxious butt when I messed up the order a little bit, and combined my two objects together and refunded the second shipping. Great work, buds!

6.description: Wonderful business, sex positive staff (of course..) and female-oriented- I've been a customer here for at least 5 years. They used to be on Sheridan, which was much closer to my house (*sniff*) but now I will totally trek out of the way to get what I...ahem... need.

22.description: Wonderful establishment. Staff was very knowledgeable, nice, and helpful. Very pleased with my experience, and I would certainly go back again. The shop is obviously very pro-feminism, but had a nice selection of products for men. All in all one of the best adult bookstores I've ever visited!

15.description: I recently bought my first real toy, some Luna Beads, and a book here. The salesperson was knowledgeable, relaxed, and down-to-earth. The only reason I don't give it five stars is I wish she'd told me more about the Luna Beads before I bought them - apparently the only Luna Beads they had for sale are generally for older women who have gone through pregnancy (I am not in this category now). This is widely available information online, and there are other sizes of Luna Beads for other categories of woman-bodies. I wish she had mentioned this. Possibly she assumed I knew more than i did. I haven't yet tried the Luna Beads and so they may work out - but I can't return them if they don't because this is Early to Bed's policy. No returns on books or toys. Other than this issue, I enjoy the store! I also appreciate the hours they're open. Thanks ETB!

57.description: Absolutely *fabulous* shop.  Incredibly helpful staff who are sensitive and knowledgable.  They're there for the kinky chick who's just looking for a new harness and the new guy or girl looking for their first toy.  They also offer an array of awesome classes that are fantastic- I highly suggest taking one!Take all of that, *plus* they support a number of local women's organizations in Chicago.  Incredible!!

20.description: I love early to bed! Such a friendly staff and awesome stuff! The manager Searah is amazing! Go here for all you adult needs!

36.description: Probably the least intimidating, and dare I say cute, sex boutique I've been in so far. It's smaller (and has possibly less variety) than other shops, but this is the one I feel best about supporting - Searah's shop is the most lgbtq-friendly and she might be the most knowledgeable. I absolutely love her posts and videos on the website and she seems down to earth. Plus, they have workshops - I haven't gone yet, but I plan to soon.The gal who was working there (not Searah) wasn't as approachable as I'd like...for some reason I like a little input before I buy something, but that won't stop me from coming back. Anywho, there's a little of everything in here - and a LOT of bondage tape! Also, you can buy online, which is great if you live towards the south end of the city. Love it!!

14.description: Early To Bed is wonderful. The staff and the reviews of each product are informative and helpful. I like that you can handle an example of what you purchase before you buy it. The prices are moderate, but you don't want cheap crap when it comes to sex supplies. You just don't. So Early To Bed's prices are exactly what you want - they don't break the bank severely but they don't sell cheap, flimsy crap either.Interesting tidbit, after I had a hysterectomy, I wondered whether I still had a Gspot. My knowledge of my parts was dismal at best at that time, and Early To Bed's friendly staff let me know that not only do I still have one, but there are a myriad of ways to make it feel awesome.I'm so blessed to live in Chicago where we have this sort of thing. Searah, the owner, is super nice too! Support your local businesses, people. You'll be glad you did!

12.description: Ronnie saved Christmas! I was just about to give up my search for a red and black Santa hat. But a friend reminded me that Lovers Lane would be a good place to look. I called and the sales associate said they had red and white. Just as my spirit began to fall, she said we may have one red and black one. I think I scared her with my excitement. when I arrived, she greeted me with a smile, and without even knowing it, pointed me in the direction of something else I had been looking for. Ronine you rock!

3.description: Definitely a place to shop for a bachelorette party. I was in unfamiliar territory when I was invited to such a party (being a guy and all), but I wanted something trashy and slightly embarrassing. While I went with the intentions of looking for something along the lines of edible underwear, I instead got a gift basket than included a small whip, fuzzy handcuffs, and a cheap blonde wig. The staff was helpful too.But their "outfits" and lingerie seemed to be on the cheap quality-side. I was hoping for a skanky doctor's uniform (it's what we're in school for), but the only ones they had were wrinkled and had tears in them - like returned halloween outfits. So I'd say get the lingerie from Victoria's secret, but get the novelty stuff at a place like this.

1.description: As far as their selection, they're pretty over priced. It's really disappointing that they can't carry cheaper water based lube than the ones they have (and from past experiences in working in adult retail, I know for a fact cheaper alternatives exist).The staff is welcoming when you walk in, but the upselling is way too out of hand. I know it's their job, but after the second time of telling you that I know what I want and do not need help, please listen to me and leave me alone.I do, however, enjoy that they have my favorite cheap little egg. But yes, I do know that type of vibrator is cheap and will break within the year. I wish they'd stop telling me. It's easier for me to spend $10 once a year than $100 on a Lelo up front.

2.description: The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable about toys, items, etc. They come across as very comfortable and nonjudgmental. It's almost a little shocking to hear them talk about genitalia as if they were talking about a ham sandwich they had for lunch, but it makes for a very comfortable environment. On the very negative side, however, the staff is EXTREMELY pushy. My advice would be to not show any interest in any one product because they pounce on you and will talk your ear off, pressuring you to buy whatever it is. DO NOT even ask what the Liberator products are. Not sure if they're on commission or not, but they sure act like it. The more expensive the product you're looking at, the more they will push it on you. They won't even let you speak while they bombard you with their sales pitch, and they recruit other sales people to pummel you with sales info too. Be warned that it will be hard to walk away with what you genuinely want rather than what the staff convinces you that you want. Also, as to be expected with most adult novelty shops, it's quite overpriced. NO RETURNS. Which they will not tell you until after you buy something and have a receipt, only circling the (non) return policy at the bottom of the receipt.

9.description: Everyone thinks the sales people are pushy, they actually are just really friendly people who like sex toys and talk about them like they are cars or t-shirts. Marilyn is such a big help and was awesome to me when I was in there. Great selection, some stuff is a little over priced, but the bonus is you can get Qdoba or Potbelly next door when you're done.

10.description: Knowledgable sales staff. I went in there to shop for Halloween outfits with my friend and while wandering too close to the dildos I got a full blown (no nudity) sales demonstration from one of the young ladies working there. She demonstrated the Gigi and the we vibe 2. They both seem like really awesome additions to a sex toy collection but that wasn't on my shopping list today. Prices are the same as online distributors so that's a plus.  We didn't find the costume we were looking for but there were a lot of sexy ___(occupation)_____ options so check it out.

13.description: UGH. Go elsewhere! I originally went into this store because they offer a discount to performers; another burlesque dancer recommended I go see their selection of corsets. It is located close to my home and just off the Brown Line, so I was glad to have it so conveniently located. My experience shopping at the store, however, was terrible.After verifying my entertainer discount, I browsed through their selection of corsets. A few are nice, but most are cheaply made with plastic boning but are sold at outrageous prices. They start at about $50 for a polyester corset with a plastic zipper and only go upwards. Their selection is aimed at bustier girls-- if you're a B or, heaven forbid, an A, you're out of luck. There are no mirrors around and not a single salesperson approached me to offer me a dressing room. Finding nothing, I browsed the rest of their selection. The salesperson approached me when I was looking at their toy section and began a thorough demonstration of a $100 product. I indicated I wasn't interested and she left, only to return every few minutes to give me a hard sell on their $70 products. After indicating to her my price range ($20-$40), she showed me only one product that fit the bill then returned to her reasoning about how a $100 is an "investment." Her aggressive upselling kept me in the store for an extra 45 minutes.The aggressive upselling continued at the counter, whether I was prompted to buy toy cleaner, batteries, lube, and a catalog. Thinking the catalog was free, I tacked an extra $2 on to my bill. The clerk neglected to give me my entertainer discount and, when confronted after the transaction, indicated that their computer was incapable of providing refunds and I was free to select an extra $6 worth of product if I liked. Upon asking to speak to the manager, the manager told me the same thing until I pressed for them to cancel the transaction.Sex shops are already creepy enough to begin with. I thought a place with female staff and a female manager would be a comfortable experience, but I have never felt so harassed in a store in my life. No thanks.

16.description: Stopped in on a Saturday afternoon and was greeted by a friendly sales staff.  Excellent selection of toys, costumes, lingerie, and other goodies.  The folks here know their stuff and struck me as knowing more than anyone really should about sex toys.  That said, they're way helpful and cheery - a far cry from other stores I've visited where I felt like I needed a shower as soon as I walked in.  Recommended for those looking to spice up their activities in the bedroom/kitchen/bathroom/coffee table.I got the feeling that the sales folks here do work on commission, so be aware.  4 stars.

6.description: Lover's Lane always seems to have some of the most sex enthusiastic staff! I've gone into a few different Lover's Lanes and this was no exception. I heard her loudly explaining some sex toys to a very uncomfortable couple across the store and accidentally made eye contact with the fellow...Oopsies!My friend and I were quickly approached and were explained tons of items in details. I was shopping for items for bachelorette party and my male friend was kind enough to accompany me. It was his first time in there so he was a bit shocked with their candor and....loudness. haha. She actually gave me a couple of awesome ideas for the party! I went in just to pick up some invites for now but ended up adding a couple of items to my purchase. Definitely would go back to this location, but it can be a bit rough getting in and out of this small parking lot.

15.description: This store is great if you want a sluty outfit or corset however their selection of sex toys is actually quite small. I was hoping for a wide range of choices and for what I was looking for was disappointed. I noticed several other comments about the sales staff. They actually were not really pushy with me. Just welcomed me when I entered an asked once or twice if I needed help. Maybe I gave off a poor student vibe?

0.description: Everything you need for all of your sexual pleasures and fantasies are housed here.The ladies that work here were very personable and were more than helpful in choosing some bedtime goodies. I was in the store for just 20 minutes and walked out with everything I wanted and needed. I think the ladies were glad that I wasnt uncomfortable when they approached me and the fact that I wasnt an over zealous perv either. Also, there is obviously a no return policy when you purchase products here. C'mon no one wants your used buttplug or dildo...lolSo for all of you peeps that get off the brown line @ Diversey that want to check this place out, do it as you may see some things that you like and need. No mature sexually active adult will judge you.

5.description: The store is clean and welcoming, you don't feel embarassed to be in there. The selection of toys is smaller than suburban locations but still enough to get the job done, whatever you might be into. They had Halloween costumes out, I'm a plus sized gal and I spend Halloween with little kids but if you're looking for a sexy costume and you aren't a special size they definitely have a wide selection. However, the sales girl Nikita was super pushy. I appreciated the attention and the idea of her trying to help but I told her my budget was $20... she showed me an $80 toy. I repeated my budget she showed me the $60 toy. Repeated budget once again and she showed me a $40 toy. I understand the concept of upselling, but this was ridiculous. I felt like she didn't care at all what I wanted, only how she could squeeze the most money out of me. The upselling continued at the register to the point I felt harrassed instead of helped, and just wanted to get out of there are soon as possible. It is unfortunate because I love Lovers Lane and generally have found it to be a great place with friendly girls.

11.description: Good lord, leave us alone people! My husband and I want to peruse the funny outfits and gizmos in peace!  After dining at Nori Sushi across the street, we decided to just check it out for some light-hearted entertainment...who knows maybe we'll find something nice in the process!  But immediately upon entering, we were accosted by the 2 over-eager sales people.  Don't get me wrong, they were hilarious and engaging, but I guarantee there would be a higher chance of us buying something if it didn't feel like you were watching our every move!  I could have been spared the in depth presentation of the massage oils, self-heating this and that, from the sales person. It felt like a lecture on bio-physics.

8.description: Yeah, I don't shop in these sorts of stores.  They are amusing, to be sure, but really?  ...eh. However - I was in the market for a corset.  And not just any corset (because I bought one off of Ebay and was extremely disappointed in the flimsy construction and pointless bendy plastic "boning") but one of those old school, Gone With the Wind, steel bastards that someone has to put their foot on your back in order to tighten to the point where your lips are blue but you look freaking fabulous???um, well yes.  Lovers Lane has these and for not much money either.  Mine was $50 and even though the satin ribbon lace on the back will have to eventually be changed, it is a REAL, excellently made corset and oh my does it make you stand up a little bit straighter.  Plus its cute and pink and not like some old lady girdle, which I had originally expected to end up with.  The sales staff is a little aggressive and over the top, but that's OK, I got to hear the super young salesgirl explaining proper application techniques of a massage oil to this lady in her mid 50's that was so freakin hilarious I almost busted a gut right there in the store.

4.description: The store has an average selection of outfits and great fitting rooms. The sales floor lady was attentive, however tried to promote massage oils,  catalogs, etc. from the first minute to the check -out. Also I have a feeling the heel of the shoes I purchased seemed to be higher than what I tried in the fitting room...strange..

14.description: Whether you want to be The Slut, The Dominatrix, or demure this Valentine's Day (or any day), Lover's Lane has it all! Located right off the Brown Line (Diversey) with a parking lot, it really couldn't be any easier to reach. Stop into this just-opened-yesterday, only-one-in-Chicago Lover's Lane for a wide array of outfits, men's briefs, costumes, racy stockings, and so much more. I was particularly impressed with their huge selection and decent pricing of gorgeous bustiers. You'll also find lube, sassy shoes, electronics ;-), silly party favors, and romantic (?) games. There are more than enough friendly and helpful staff to guide you to the perfect item for you. I even picked out one special item for my wish list!!

7.description: shoulda just walked out after the attitude i got from one employee/mgr who pushed her way in after i already spoke w/the other salesgirls there (who were sweet)...next time im shoppin for gifts ill go to another locationi sure hope this chick didnt get commission on what i purchased

1.description: Ordered chicken tenders were moldy and green. Had been satisfied with customer service up to this point. Highly disappointed. Will be contacting health department.

2.description: Their catfish is good! Well seasoned, not greasy, and plentiful! The amount of food I got was worth the cost (less than $6). It came with fries & a drink.A great place to grab a quick meal. The employees are friendly and they take credit/debit cards too!Next time I'm in the area, I'll check out the fried chicken.

0.description: I Love the Chicken! Some of the best in the West side of Chicago, decently priced menu items for your pocket book, and well proportioned meals for your tummy. Their Lemon Pepper seasoning mixed with some hot hot sauce is tantalizing to the taste buds, just mind your P&Q's in the area of course.

3.description: It's not what it use to be.  The prices have NOT changed but the portion had. You definitely don't get what you paid for.  Beware and be sure.

1.description: Colemans # 2 is like a staple for BBQ on the Westside of Chicago. I was not disappointed. When I lived in Oak Park,and Forrest Park I used to make it by there. The RibTips and the Steakburger is what I always got back then and that's what I got again...and 7 wings with Mild Sauce. Nothing's changed except that They've improved!!... The Tips were extremely tender,and the steakburger was awesome and yummy. I can't describe it any other way!, Colemans remains consistently good!!

2.description: I live nowhere near the location of Coleman's (used to be 2 locations but only 1 now) but happened to be in the area after visiting a friend and decided to treat myself.  The last time I tried to get food from here was on Labor Day 2014 and by mid-afternoon, their ribs were sold out.  Have wanted some ever since.  When I got there on a Friday, the line to order was like one I've never seen.  Standing room only.  I started to turn around but I really wanted their ribs.  Why? Because they are the BEST!  I ordered a slab of ribs.  They told me it would be a half hour.  I wanted to cry - it was after 8 p.m. and I was ready to go home but I waited for my food.  Why?  Because they are the BEST!  It did take the entire 30 minutes but what I got was juicy, meaty ribs with yummy sauce that includes fries and bread.  Will I be back?  Of course I will!  Thanks Coleman's - you are still as good as when my late Daddy used to bring us your BBQ back in the 80's.

9.description: I grew up on Colemans everyone claims Harold's has the best fried chicken but they have no idea what they're missing.

10.description: This place is down right scary, but their rib tips are fantastic!Two blocks east of Austin, close to Oak Park, yeah, it's not a good neighborhood.  The food and workers are protected by a wall and there's standing room only for the customers.It's worth the risk.  The sauce is easily better than Robinson's.  The tips are ladled over fries and a piece of white bread soaks up the good stuff on the bottom.I've never been bothered by anyone in the neighborhood and they're open until 2am.

4.description: Best bbq on the Westside n the chicken is fy I've been coming here for decades n it never changes bcause it ain't broke

6.description: Love this place for "real" bbq! It's worth a trip from the suburbs to the city. I like Famous Dave's like the next person.. but let's face it.. that's not the same. I've been going for years, quality meat every time!.

11.description: I lived right around the corner from this restuarant for over ten years, so I'm what you might call an expert. I was never bothered by anyone, as the first reviewer(Christina R.) even said. I wonder what was so scary if no one bothered that reviewer. If you think a "black neighborhood" is scary, because most of the people you see there are black, then don't come to black neighborhoods. If you want great ribs and sauce though, and aren't bothered by seeing a lot of black people, this is the place. They also have another location around 555 N Cicero. Both are often very crowded, as most places with great food usually are. Your best bet is to call in your order, and then pick it up a little later. This will save you some waiting time. If you like sauce soaked bread, let them put it with the meat, If on the other hand, you like all the sauce you can get on your meat, ask them to put the bread on the side.

5.description: I've been going to Coleman's since I was a kid and fries with mild sauce were 60 cents!  1980's, that seems like a lifetime ago.  I lived over there for 33 plus years and I have to say Chicago Avenue is not the safest spot, but it's not the worst either.  I've seen it get better then worse, so If you can catch a park in front of the door, you can get in and out.  Best thing to do is call your order in and it should be ready when they say, but don't wait too late, they stop taking call-ins after a certain time.   I love their food and the prices, although have gone up, still aren't bad compared to other places.  It's worth traveling back to my old hood for good eats!

7.description: ive been comin here for years & i cant believe i havent written a review for them ever! every time my girl & i want some good bbq we come here! they have awesome rib tips, ribs, chicken and fries! i LOVE the mild sauce they put on the food. the restaurant is just a small take out place. people say its not the best neighborood but i dont think its that bad. the food is definitely worth it!!

8.description: They are under construction currently. You can't even tell that they're open, the inside is brand new and my food was excellent. Hot, saucy, and seasoned well.

0.description: My kids know this as "mom's favorite chicken place"! Nuff said. It's Coleman's or nothing!

12.description: If you can get over the guilt that almost everything in this store is priced as low as it is because it's almost all from China, then you can find some major bargains here.As far as mens' clothes go, they have tons of basic things. Button-down shirts and jeans are all gigantic sizes. However, prices are just a little bit more than a thrift store, so for some items, it's worth it. Unfortunately, some displays have items in giant piles, such as for hats, gloves, socks, scarves, etc. I did score a Thinsulate hat and glove combo for $6, six-pack of Hanes socks for $4, and almost bought a pair of orange Sperry Topsiders for $29. Keep in mind, this place is also cheap because everything was bought in bulk. It's warehouse-sized, and I am grateful I came at night when crowds were thin.The location isn't that great, but if you're out driving on Cicero Ave or North Ave, it's worth a stop.

3.description: Customer service here is atrocious!! Manager Ben was extremely rude! His attitude was appalling! Ford city location. Assumed i was there for an exchange and when i told him i was there for a refund he started throwing his head around and rolling his eyes and huffing and puffing. Then he stormed off and yelled he was going upstairs. I asked for a manager and they told me he was a manager and called security. What?! Unbelievable! Worst service ever. Must not b the first time this happened seeing as soon as they saw i was unhappy a security officer showed up. Ghetto!!

1.description: I was looking for school uniformsI didn't  fined nothing I like itHuge storeCheap  clothes  for  the family similar like rainbow stores qualityAnd kind expensive $$I think kmart , walmart  target have better prices on evrething

2.description: Let me start by saying that this particular Forman Mills location isnot in the best part of the city.It is located in the area known as Austin, located in the shopping centerat North Avenue and Cicero.And, what I had heard about them was that they were on the sameorder as a Burlington Coat Factory or a Marshalls so I felt I needed tocheck them out for myself.This location is huge, warehouse sized actually with so many departmentsof merchandise, Mens, Womens, Childrens, Shoes, Domestics and a smallHousewares Department as well.And, okay, I have to admit that I found an XOXO Handbag which I lovedbecause it was kind of furry and I like furry things so I looked at the price andit said $15.00 and I couldn't believe how inexpensive it was.I also bought another handbag/purse, black leather with fringes becauseI like fringes too and that one was a couple dollars more but so completelyworth it.This store has a huge assortment of clothes for the munchkins in your family/life,all at surprisingly low prices.Actually they have a really great assortment/selection in every departmentfrom what I saw.I definitely think that it's worth the time to look through these departmentsbecause you will find some great deals and you will definitely save some bucks here!Nice store associates on hand today as well, very courteous and pleasant.So, in ending, I am pretty thrilled with what I found today at Forman Mills,and yes, it may be out of the way and you may need to be able to spendsome time looking through the merchandise but it's my guess you willfind something great.I sure did.

9.description: huge selection, cheap prices but beware: I've never seen a worse checkout process.count on at least 15-20 minutes to pay.sometimes there's not enough workers back there, sometimes there's more than enough, either way it doesn't matter---it's like they're contractually obligated to move as slow as possible and never, ever smile or say thank you.it's also confusing as to where you go for returns vs where you go to pay for something; an employee will bark at you if you're in the wrong line, and it's pretty common for people to cut in one line if the other one's too long (and it always is).overall, an F for customer service.

10.description: I am rating the Villa Park store! The store itself has some very nice clothing that I loved! HOWEVER! Today I went to the store to exchange some of my husband's shirts and everything went well until I found these pair of pants that were under the 50% off rack along with ALL the other same kind of pants. When I went to the register to check out, the cashier told me they were not a red tag price! So the cashier asked some other associate to come and check the price to make sure they were under the red tag, I even walked over to the rack where they were and the associate said "yeah, they are under the red tag" but the other customer service helper refused to take that answer! She called the store manager and the store manager said no to giving me the pants for the sale price! UM... EXCUSE ME! YOUR ASSOCIATES ARE THE ONES THAT PLACED THE PANTS UNDER THE SALE RACK!!! What was even more embarrassing was that there was customer in front of me waiting for something and even she kept saying that they should give me the pants for the sale price since it was under the rack! The cashier kept telling me they should not be there! WELL OKAY! DO I WORK AT THE STORE? NO! MAYBE THEY NEED TO TRAIN THEIR EMPLOYEES A LITTLE BETTER BECAUSE YOU SHOULD NOT FALSE ADVERTISE CLOTHING!!! I loved the store but today has seriously made me angry! Never tell a customer that they are wrong when even your own associates are proving to you that I am right!Horrible service today and I am sure those customers that were standing by me agreed since they left!I am definitely going to be writing a complaint letter to the store!

4.description: The prices are great for families, perfect for kids and teens. The racks and selections are outstanding. But I have one major issue with this place. They take forever at checkout. I understand a little wait. But waiting until you have literally 30 people in line to add more cashiers is counterproductive and bad for business! HIRE MORE CASHIERS!!!

6.description: I like coming her because you never know what your gonna find for a great price, however it is over crowded with clothing that are misplaced in various places and clothing are indeed thrown on the floor and there is always like 1 or 2 cashiers open when its flooded with people. The customer service is decent and the check out lines are horrid.... But it does have great clothes!

0.description: Forman Mills is really a "bric-a-brac" or "knickknack" mills.  If you don't mind this part of town being a bit shady, I would say pop in every once in a while since that place just sells random merchandise.  We found our nephews' and my brother-in-law's Christmas presents at their toy department.  As we were wrapped up with our shopping trip here in FM, a fight broke out in the back of the store.  CPD officers were on site with the manager on duty.  Customers really could care less because the line to checkouts was LONG.  Nevertheless, all cashiers were available and many registers were open.  The line was moving rather swiftly.  If you are paying with a credit card, ensure to have a valid government-issued photo ID ready.  Any retailer cannot take the hit with contested charges and suffer from much shrink due to operational errors.  It is what it is, ladies and gentlemen.  You will see some random soda spills on the ground and unfinished coffee cups lying on the shelves.  Workers are gonna concentrate on busting shipments, and managers are gonna call police several times a week to keep the store in check.  I personally can stand shopping at Forman Mills, as long as I know what to expect.  There's additional parking at the lot on the corner of Lamon and Le Moyne.

5.description: I'm reviewing the villa park location. It Isn't on yelp yet, anyway what a huge store. Watch out when you walk in, there's a security tower righ in the middle of the walk way when the automatic double doors open. Poor layout. Hate to admit it, but I almost walked into it. Seems that the clothing they carry in villa park is targeted to a certain race of people. Should carry more sporting brands like Nike, Adidas, UnderArmor, Puma, Polo..Not everyone likes ghetto-wear clothing Sean John, SouthPole, Rocawear, LRG...Every clothing item is pretty much defective in some sort of way, mostly in underwear, socks & T-shirts. You'll find a cut tag, a black X on tag less T's or stamped "irregular". This is because the manufacture rejected the sale of their produced item. Look closely at a shirt that has a cut tag, a sleeve may be 1cm longer than the other. That's why it's so cheap. If it doesn't bother you then you'll get a great deal. The store is messy and the staff seem to make prices up at check out. I bought socks and t-shirts for work. Some of the things I purchased didn't have tags. What a nightmare. They'd bring up something that looks alike and charge me that price, kind of wierd? The managers I believe are in black shirts and look as if they came from Reno 911. I wouldn't even feel comfortable using a credit card. Yeah the store just gives me that feeling.

13.description: They may have some good clothes under the piles and racks of outdated b.s.  this store is great for retired men that wanna look young

11.description: Biggedy bam, mutha flowers!! I found the "new AJ Wright" (god rest its soul) and it's the obnoxiously red and yellow painted building on the corner of North and Cicero Avenue! This store opened a few months ago and it looks so strange from the outside -like a big warehouse that would sell industrial materials or something. I had been afraid to go in there because the neighborhood is a bit rough in them thar' parts, but it was my boyfriend's birthday and I wanted to treat him to a gift. He too is mourning the loss of his favorite store (AJ Wright) so I was hoping to give him a double bday present -the hope that he has found an equitable replacement *and* an actual gift. He acted as my bodyguard and we braved the deary, rainy elements to venture out to that part of the city. I was actually really impressed! It was very AJ-Wright-ish but actually kinda better because it wasn't all chaotic and disorganized. They actually had a bunch of cute stuff. Tons of cute T-shirts, jeans, purses and (ooooooh snap!) ladies, -I found my funky shoe place once again! -And I'm embarrassed to say I added two more pairs to my ridiculous collection! The crowd was cool too. There is a well built (and handsome!) security guard in the front and a bunch of regular old people -lots of families, diversity. I even got a compliment on the shoes I was wearing by one of the sales clerks (I made sure to credit -you guessed it -AJ Wright). It was a great experience! Cashier Tammy was very nice too and even alerted the Supervisor when I asked if there was a damaged merchandise discount (there is-10%) since the shoes in my size were a little beat up but I still liked them! Total damage? $38.93 for two pairs of shoes and a funky belt. So glad I checked it out! This could be a dangerous habit being on the way home from work and all but I'm gonna try to resist the daily temptation!! (But, of course, give in once in a while!!! LOL)

8.description: After hearing for the longest about the low prices, I decided to check it out.  I went twice to give it a chance.  Yes, the prices are inexpensive, but the selection is not the best.  The ads claim there is a wide variety of clothes, but both times I went to the Austin neighborhood store, I didn't find what had been advertised.  In other words, it's not much there for adult women.  However, I recommend those who have small kids at home or work as nurses/nurses' aides go there -- they carry a lot of clothes for those groups.

14.description: Ok. So the store itself has items that are in good condition for a great bargain price. However, I regret having to use the bathroom in this place. I could not hold my urine any longer, so I rushed to the bathroom, my aunt and I, and had to have an older lady that works there enter the code to let us in. She was a pleasant African-American lady but when I tell you her response to what I saw in that bathroom you may rethink that opinion like I did. I went into the bathroom, and I reached for tissue, they were all out. Luckily, my aunt was in the other stall with tissue so she passed me some. But, as I reached back and looked on the other side of the wall, feces was spreaded everywhere! i do mean everywhere! It was sooooooo disgusting..and it really ticked me off. I understand the prices are cheap, but if you are going to lock up the bathroom as if you had it built in gold, please make sure its sanitary first. The worst bathroom experience in a public place in my life!!!! I will never ever use a bathroom in this place again! I told the woman after I came out that feces was all over the walls in there. She chuckled! You work there....either clean it or do something about it..as disgusting as it was...if that was my place of employment and a worker came to me and said such a thing..I would definitely do something about it. But, I guess she didn't think the same. Also, the lines are too long...the employees are not fully aware of their products and aren't really good at helping indecisive customers at all.  By me coming in not knowing what I want, this should have been a huge selling point for them..instead..it was an epic fail. Geez! I'm lucky to have given them a 2. If this review was solely based on store appearance and customer service, they'd be getting a 1.

7.description: Huge selection I was able to find a couple of pairs of pants a shirt and a hoodie for under $50. Great deals.

1.description: Worst subs ever not deli meat ham and cheese bread wet almost like wet Italian beef no onions and I wanted cold sandwich wasn't offered meat was like it was boiled horrible

0.description: The item I order most when I go to Sun SUB is their chicken tenders!!! They are big, juicy, and flavorful. I always get lemon pepper, nacho cheese, and mild sauce on my tenders! They also have great gym shoe subs!!!!!!!!!

I don't go that often but this is a good place to go. It's always busy and if you can deal with the regular haggler who comes in the store selling stuff you might enjoy it.When I go I get a gel set/fill with white tips. They always look real good and the staff there are fast. Full set-$18+Gel full set-$28Fiber glass clear nails-$23Acrylic fill-$13Gel fill-$18Pedicure-$20They also offer eye brow waxing and eyelash extensions. I've never tried it but from what I have observed the customers who do, it looks great.

3.description: If you're in the area working late and there is no where else open this is your place.

1.description: Good pizza, horrible service. Tonight I placed an order for a delivery and had a $3 credit from the last pizza they screwed up. It's been an hour and 20 minutes and my pizza hadn't been delivered yet. Called to cancel, the phoneworker (didn't get her name but she always answers the phone) was very short and not apologetic whatsoever, and the manager is never available to speak with. Never ordering from them again. Absolutely terrible.

2.description: 4 stars you say, are you bat shit crazy my good man (I often say that). 4 stars for a pizza place, have you gone over the edge??????????????NO I am not huffing paint in the basement, or hopped up on goof balls.I give it 4 stars because they are guided 4 stars, let's say that they are B list stars, not Cruse, or Hanks, maybe Hoffman or Riley.In the area of Oak Park we are known for our bad Pizza, it may be the worst place in America to get pizza, especially delivered.There are some good pizza joints, but the best two will not put it in a car and bring it to you. I respect that, and when I want a really good pie, I get my narrow ass in the family truckster make my way to them.Sometimes the sloth takes over, and my food snob ways take a vacation, and I want somebody to get their narrow ass in a beat up vehicle and bring me some grub.Normally that comes in the form of a dough covered in sauce, and other accoutrement, baked and slung at me in cardboard.Victors covers all the bases when it comes to this:cheap - checkFast - checkgood - checkmultiple options - checkcredit cards - checkif you want good pizza, fast, and in a cardboard box - then call Victor's.

5.description: The pizza is okay but the lasagna is better! I will stop in every now and than for a slice. The hot wings are good.

6.description: Was a loyal customer for late night eats, then when I called to ask for delivery all I got was a rude worker who answered the phone by saying "closed". What??? Terrible service. Apparently even though they are open until 11, her manager said they cannot take our order. We have eaten from here for a very long time, order at this time, and usually enjoy the pizza. But this was the last straw for me. Never again!!!

7.description: I used to eat this pizza long ago as a kid on many friday or saturday nights. Pizza was decent, but not sure if its still good like it was since i was a child.

0.description: Ordered through GrubHub for an after-school group. They delivered on-time, reasonably-priced yummy pizza! The students loved, so we will definitely be ordering again!

4.description: This is the 3rd order my office has placed. And every time,  the food has been exceptional!  The portions are very large. Food is always super hot and fresh. Delivery is amazingly fast. I highly recommend Victor's. And will continue to order from them. Honestly,  I would rate them much higher than 5 stars if I could.

0.description: Typical Subway. Service could be faster during the day but the night guy is great.

Yes, I will admit that I wear a weave but you would never know it because of Joi. I heard about her from my extended family and I'm glad I went there. If you're not from/familiar with the area, I'll tell you now that It's not in the best of neighborhoods, but for the price and quality you're just going to have to deal. Joi (the owner) is super nice and the cast of characters that come in and out and who work there are...well, just that, but it does remind me of when "Barber Shop" and "Beauty Shop" came out and there was all this talk about how it was a true showing of life in the 'hood. That was never my personal experience before but now I can definitely see it. Anyway, I'm starting to get off track. Joi does good hair and have you looking like you're supposed to (as opposed to a hot mess). Just like a good stylist is supposed to.

1.description: Great urban greasy spoon. I know of no where you can get a full meal for under $4. Their chop steaks are great. Been going here for years.

0.description: Some of the best Italian beef in Chicago. Not the best, but certainly up there. Love the environment as well.

1.description: This place is simply delicious!My younger brother treated me for takeout. The chicken is very fresh and flavorful!Wow. Yum yum yum

9.description: First time at 3D's and the half jerk chicken was great.  No wait,  I'll be returning!

29.description: Best jerk chicken around! Chicken is always moist and the flavor is delicious. We try and go weekly! The cabbage is terrific and full of flavor. We love 3D's!

23.description: Tasty jerk chicken.  pay extra for the sauce and it's HOT. I got the 1/2 white.  kinda rough neighbor hood but worth the drive from the burbs. I got some "looks" but that didn't stop me!

5.description: I tried this place for the first time yesterday and i will have to say I am impressed. I have tried a few other Jamaican restaurants in the city that left a lot to be desired but this restaurant did not disappoint. I ordered the combo plate and choose curry goat and jerk chicken that came with beans and rice, cabbage, yams and hard dough bread. Everything was yummy! The goat was very tender, the jerk chicken was seasoned nicely and the sides had a great flavor. One thing I thought was odd was that they didn't offer Plantains, especially since it was a Jamaican restaurant. Just make sure that you you know the price of what you are getting! We were told one price over the phone and when we arrived the price was $10 higher! After a little discussion lady there was nice enough to honor the price she gave over the phone but that is something that they should be careful about. I would definitely recommend.

25.description: I came here on a Sunday, which was strange because when you walk in, the menus all over place state that they are closed on Sunday's . Anywho, THE FOOD. I had the curry chicken with cabbage, macaroni and cheese (which is not on the menu, anywhere, you have to ask) and rice and peas, all very excellent, but a little salty for my taste, my boyfriend said it was not salty. ( I don't cook with salt). My boyfriend had the jerk chicken, it was good and salty, but the jerk sauce they give you is awful. The inside of the place is not to clean, but the food was okay. I prefer Uncle Joe's in Hyde Park.

12.description: Great food taste was awesome and prices were super affordable for the amount of great tasting food you get.

21.description: Who ever gave the food here a bad review must be off their rocker! The best jerk in the city of Chicago!  Even those nasty places on the south side.. The jerk sauce is amazing!!  Call in your order the wait can be crazy, the cabbage is superb.  Its just all good !

16.description: This is my go to jerk chicken restaurant. the sauce is amazing. the meat selections are full of flavor. the cabbage is Delicious. the rice and beans are so so. not giving five stars only BC of the wait time and the fact that you need to have cash most of the time because the credit card machine is always broken. Call ahead and bring cash. I will definitely continue supporting them.

17.description: You have to try the Jerk T-bone Steak and smothered potatoes with ma and cheese on Sundays. I had one on mothers day for the first time and  I almost died and went  to heaven. For $16.00 it was well worth it.

10.description: Went here the other day ordered jerk chicken and jerk fish. Got home opened the bag the chicken  was decent  however the Fish was the Worst they gave me the tail end of the fish! nothing with meat on it. I called the store the person  I called told me to bring it back then he stated that they were out of fish smh. I won't be returning

11.description: The food taste amazing and the prices are very affordable.  It's not a sit down restaurant so order your food and take it home and enjoy you will not be disappointed and take into account the portions are huge. Sunday is steak day right off the grill and they are thick and delicious!

26.description: Oh boy where should i start. I have ordered twice from this place and i must say im disappointed. first let me say that I AM JAMAICAN and i know what the food is suppose to taste like.  I HAVE ALSO WORKED AND RAN A JAMAICAN RESTAURANT WITH MY MOM IN NEW YORK. This is not there yet. I think they have been too americanized or not putting the attention into the food that they need to. I have tried the oxtails, its ok (humongous pieces of meat that need to be cut in more appropriate sizes, which means it was hard, wasnt cooked as well. i have tried the curry goat and was given a whole bunch of fat with bones...not good. I gave it 2 stars because i plan to go back and try the jerk chicken. that will be my last straw. it appears that they have spicy seasoning down pat. i wish they would get better quality meat and better service. The menu appears to be very limited as well. everything, and i mean EVERYTHING is served with rice and peas, cooked cabbage and sweat potatoe (im not sure how this is even apart of the jamaican dish). at one point we ordered just rice, when we brought it home, it was covered in this dark , thick , tasteless sauce, with a chunk of onion or garlic. ughhhhhhh just gross, and defeated the whole purpose of ordering the rice.

27.description: I tried the talapia with red beans and rice. The rice was extremely dry and the fish didn't have much flavor not like jerk should. I waited quite some time for the food and thought that it would be worth the wait and it wasn't. Ive had wayyyyyyyy better jerkthan this. I won't be returning!!!

0.description: Very friendly service, extremely tasty chicken & goat, and great prices sums up 3-Ds.We went on sunday so we could get the jerk T-bone.  IMHO, not worth it, but the curry goat and chicken were VERY worth it.The T-bone wasn't at all bad, but it is cooked medium-well which I guess should probably be expected.  I'd even go as far as to call it good, but just not worth it considering that...  The chicken on the other hand has a perfect amount of smokiness to it and tastes great with the slow heat from the Jerk sauce.  You get a whole (cut) chicken at a totally reasonable price!  The curry goat fills a large styrofoam takeout container when you add in sides and tastes great.  Not overpowering curry, great flavor, and overall just good.  Watch out for bones though!  Both of these were just delicious.Everything had a price in the $10-12 range and you got plenty for the cost.  Our total taxed bill was $40 which made for roughly 6 fat kid meals.We did have to wait a little while since something we ordered wasn't ready, but the dudes inside were really nice while we waited and even offered us a couple of free Jamaican soda's for hanging around.  Waiting wasn't a problem for us, but the bullet proof glass might be more for your protection than theirs - if you have allergies the smoke could possibly bother you, but I came out smellin' fresh.

20.description: This is my go to jerk chicken restaurant. the sauce is amazing. the meat selections are full of flavor. the cabbage is Delicious. the rice and beans are so so. not giving five stars only BC of the wait time and the fact that you need to have cash most of the time because the credit card machine is always broken. Call ahead and bring cash. I will definitely continue supporting them.

19.description: Triple D's is that place you go to when you can't make it to Maywood to Tropical Times. I only gave it 3 stars because out of the few occassions that I've went, the chicken has been soggy instead of the skin being crispy. It's always seasoned well, however, I like to eat my chicken without the hot sauce, so, I judge a little more heavier on natural taste and texture..I just hate soggy chicken! I have never tried any of the sides.  Overall, it's a hit or miss, sometimes it's good (skin crispy), sometimes it's not, and like I mentioned, I've had too many "not" right days.

2.description: The best jerk chicken on the westside of Chicago these people are actually from Jamaica so you get that authentic taste thanks 3-d's you're the best

18.description: I like this place so much that I budget for it every month. See... Give them a call, stop by pick ur food and enjoy. Simple as that. I usually go for a whole dark chicken no-bread. They like to call it Whole Dark No-bread lol

13.description: Great jerk Chicken and Omar's a good guy

4.description: Amazing!!! Fresh and delicious Jamaican. I'm very particular about my Jerk and they got it right - from the flavor, to it being ready on time, to the gentleman who greeted me... Thankful to have a good fix nearby. Call ahead!

24.description: These guys know what they are doing! I've tried the jerk chicken (very good), oxtail (excellent), curry goat (excellent) and tilapia (ok).

6.description: Had the goat curry for lunch. It was very good. Meat was soft. Had it with red beans and rice, yams, cabbage. Loved it.

22.description: This place has excellent food.....if you catch them on the right day.  When it's right, it's right! And even when it's wrong it's not too far off from being right :) I can say the prices go up each year but for most restaurants this is expected. The only thing I'd advise is to call in your order. The wait time can be long. The cabbage is some of the best I've ever had!

15.description: It's hard to believe a place would open at 1pm for a lunch crowd, but this place was not even open at 1. I look inside and it's just one guy trying to prepare the food. They might have good food, but too bad some people miss out because the owner is not prepared to serve it up. If you say you open at certain time, BE Ready to Open. That's Business 101!

7.description: I tried this place with my co worker. We ordered the shrimp dinner. We got back to the office and noticed that the food was very watery. The rice, cabbage and Mac n cheese were soaked in sauce. We began to eat the food when we noticed a long hair in our rice. It was disgusting! To top it off the bald head black man told me when I called that we were never welcomed back there again and it wasn't there hair it was a Mexicans hair! I told him oh you don't have to worry about me coming back to this nasty ass establishment ever again. Also the front receptionist is so rude the one with the glasses. She has a horrible attitude!

8.description: I went on a Sunday for Steak Sunday. I added Shrimp to my order. I had mac n cheese & the smothered potatoes for sides. I have been following them on IG & I've been planning to check them out for about a year now so I was REALLY excited. I enjoyed my food, it was about a 20 min wait, I wanted a med rare steak, but was advised it would take 30mins so I took what was ready which was well done. I still enjoyed it and I'm gonna come bk & try different things. They also accept call in orders which seems to be suggested if you don't want to wait.

30.description: This place has the best jerk chicken from a restaurant in Chicago. Very affordable and the jerk sauce is seasoned to perfection. Please note, they provide take-out only so there is no dining in available. This place is well worth the trip.

3.description: The food is delicious! Authentic jerk. Curry goat and oxtail,  nice and tender and we'll seasoned. You can see them jerking on the grill.  When ordering on the phone for pickup, I recommend you confirm the price. We confirmed the price twice and were still given a higher price when we arrived. After discussion, the quoted price was honored. Also, don't expect your order to be ready when you go to pick it up. We had to wait a 1/2 hour more even coming after the time the food was said to be ready.

14.description: This is absolutely the best jerk chicken in town! It's authentic! The chicken isn't spicy, which allows the entire family to enjoy. The bread and sauce provided is definitely one of a kind! Did I mention the great, fast service? Well, the guys are always friendly and kind! I can't pass by without stopping for such a treat!

12.description: This place is a must stop.  The Italian beefs are great.  I get the deep fried polish and cheese fries.  I have had all the sandwiches and like this place very much.  But they deep fry the polish for me and that is heavenly.  Now I must tell you about the French fries.  This is a must must must have item.  These are what fries should be.  Fresh cut, thin and crispy.  I think they are cooked in olive oil.  The best I have ever had.  They are addicting.  Also there is easy parking and when you leave go through the alley and out onto Cicero avenue at the light.  Please don't miss this place.  It is sooo good .

3.description: Best BBQ pulled pork!!!! This place is a gem on the west side tried pulled pork,cheeseburger and Italian beef all were delicious as well as the fries

1.description: I have to say I have past this place quite a few times, and never really gave it a second look. Until one day I was hungry and had no desire to cook. And this place being in my neck of the woods, I decided to stop by. I am really glad I did! This place had some delicious food. The Italian beef was delicious and the ingredients were fresh. And the fries were amazing, I wished I had gotten another order of them. They cook them in olive oil, man oh man are they delicious. The owners are warm and friendly.  I will definitely be returning to this place to try some of their other items, and to grab some more of those delicious fries.

2.description: Wow! I was SO impressed with the customer service. It was my first time here so I asked to try the tzatziki sauce. She not only did she give me sauce, but also two pieces of gyro meat....and WOW it was amazing! You can tell that they buy top of the line quality products. The sauce was homemade and the fries are cooked with sea salt in extra virgin olive oil! So good!

9.description: I was surprised at the size of the hot dogs I ordered.  They were plump and juicy!  I didn't have to eat for a long while after having two of those and an order of fries.  The woman behind the counter explained that they only use the best hot dogs they can find.  They also make a point of using the best beef for their burgers, and they fry food in extra virgin oil.  She said if people must eat fast food, why not have "mindful" fast food?  The prices were reasonable, too.  Don't forget to ring the bell near the door before leaving to let the cooks know how good their food was!

10.description: This place is a gem! My boyfriend and I stopped in for a couple beef sandwiches and were not disappointed! So juicy and delicious! The man working up front even let me try some of the gyro and chili!! All delicious! I also really loved how clean the place was. The owner even gave us some homemade bread pudding to go. Can't beat this customer service. We will be back very soon!!

4.description: Awesome little neighborhood spot to grab something to eat.  I had the Philly Cheesesteak and it was great.  I was very surprised at the quality of the ingredients.  The place is very clean and staff is super friendly.  The owner came to say hello and even gave us a free dessert!  I'll definitely be back.  A+ all the way around.

6.description: LOVE this place ! Food is so damn yummy and fresh.  Will def be back.:!  New ownership is doing a great job!  Keep it up!

15.description: awesome service. great fries, beef, gyros and hotdogs.

0.description: I do not usually wax poetic but after our experience here I feel I must...Margie's Beef...How do I love thee? Let me count the ways...Ok, came here based on Yelp reviews of course and its proximity on the way to the movie theater after work. Stopped in with the spouse. I have to say I kind of looked askance at the the area when parking but decided to just park on the side street (by the way they have a parking lot behind the place right off of Cicero so park there if they have space) and there was no problem whatsoever.We came during rush hour on a Friday night so traffic on the street was super busy but inside we saw only a couple of people waiting for their food and otherwise dead which I was surprised at and hoping was not a bad sign...It wasn't, I ordered the gyro burger and she the regular burger with fries. Counter service was by the wife/co-owner and husband was one of the cooks/assistant/waiter. Ordering was quick, kind, and painless.While we were sitting and waiting maybe 5 or 10 minutes (we weren't paying attention) the husband/owner/etc. (Jay) came running out to drop off a bottle of ketchup which was nice. Food came shortly after...The food...My [insert spiritual figure here]...The gyro burger was really popping out all over and I could not love it more...Gyro meat was flavorful and super delicious without being overpowering or over salty, etc. Mixed with cabbage, tomatoes, mayonnaise, onions, etc. was a very euphoric experience. And the fries, just like everyone else says awesome and addictive. My wife said her burger was delicious as well and I definitely believe it though I had my hands super full with the gyro.Talked to Jay and super nice guy who asked how our food was and genuinely cared. Seems like a great mom-and-pop community guy as was the restaurant.I really liked the quotes/precepts from Ghandi framed on the wall and another Random Acts of Kindness sign as well...Really go's to show again all of the above...The only problems, it is too far from home for daily or weekly convenient visits (it would be awesome if we could walk here), but on the way from work it will definitely be our go to place, if you eat in you will be comfortable (nice seats and people watching) though bring some wet wipes because you will definitely need them (maybe a bib too ;-), careful getting in if driving but once there have it and enjoy no worries, otherwise the menu is really comprehensive and easy to read, and most importantly if you eat in (or even if not) enjoy, thank the wondrous owners, and share widely and patronize again.Go here!P.S. I am only worried this place will get too popular eventually so just go while little to no wait!

5.description: Really good beef,great flavor BUT the fries(done in Olive oil)we're excellent!May come back just for the fries

13.description: One of, if not the best spot for a beef sandwich in the city. The beef itself is high caliber - it's from the better front portion of the cow as opposed to the back like most spots get. The bread was fresh and delicious and the perfect size for a sandwich - not too big or small. At first, I was thrown off by the price (6.75) however, you get a massive unadvertised basket of olive oil fried french fries that can hold salt well. The best feature of Margies beef is the giardinera - it's a first prize winning import from New York City and maybe the tastiest I've had - even more so than Tonys on Northwest Hwy. in Edison Park or Suzies in Irving Park. The quality of the olive oil itself is very high - worth the trip for this feature alone. Additionally, they give you cans of soda as opposed to the massive and unnecessary 64 Oz styrofoam Coleman thermos' of their rivals - an aspect I respect. Take note, they have a parking lot so you don't have to park on the street. Go here for a great beef sandwich.

11.description: I had to wait 40 minutes for a double cheese burger that made me late for work never again

8.description: Went here based on Yelp reviews.  Not disappointed!  Burger was big and juicy even though I forgot to ask for medium (so it came well done) and tons of toppings. Fries (extra $2 with burger free with some specialty sandwiches) were real potatoes cooked in real olive oil - delicious and healthier!  Great little place for take out or to eat at counter.

14.description: This is a great little place on the west side of Chicago to get yourself a classic Chicago hot dog, a double cheeseburger the size of your face or a delicious Italian beef sandwich.  And the fries... THESE ARE SOME OF THE BEST FRENCH FRIES IN CHICAGO!!  Every time I go here I wish I'd picked up an extra order of fries.  The fries alone are worth the trip here.To be honest, the Italian beef is good, plentiful, but I have had tastier dipped beefs here in Chi-town.  The combo with mozzarella cheese is delicious.  Check this place out.  It's just south of North Ave. on Cicero, right across from the Coca-Cola distribution center.  Bon Appetit!M.M.

7.description: Best burger I've ever had! Great people and amazing food! Love the fries as well! Awesome spot to come for a quick bite and they're fast with the food. Prices are great as well

1.description: After contacting McDonalds corporate regarding the destroyed front fence, they had it fixed rather quickly. Good job McDonalds.

2.description: This place has slow service for a fast food place, be prepared to wait. The employees don't want to be there and it shows; the customer service is terrible.

0.description: I only go here when my kids don't want to wait and eat. Very slow service! Poor food quality.

3.description: Not the very best place for customer service but....I'm willing to look past that for cheesesteak fries!

1.description: I've eaten here years ago and stopped due to me getting sick from their food. After 10 yrs, I've decided to give it another try. Due to people screaming how good their food is. So, I decided to give it a try. I ordered an Italian beef for my daughter and steak tacos for myself. Well, the tacos were salty, the fries GREASY!! Like they just have the fries sitting in  grease until someone orders it. My daughter did not like the beef AT ALL...when asked if it was better than Marco's beef located at 6008 West Fullerton Avenue, Chicago, IL 60639(773) 745-1015She said no.. I tasted the beef and it was disgusting. I WILL NOT and I repeat, will not eat here again....

0.description: i checked out this place with my classmate on the recommendation of a co-worker who said they have the best tacos in chicago.  and they are AMAZING.  delicious seared steak meat, seasoned shredded chicken and pork...topped with lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, and fresh hot sauce (tastes homemade).  super-fresh tortillas that stay together just until you stuff the last bite in your mouth!  and only $2 each including tax!BUT the best part about this place was the very friendly man behind the counter!  maybe he felt bad for us as he watched us scrounge all our change together (they only take cash!) but he gave us a free sample of fries with cheese sauce & the freshest giardinera!  i would go back just for the hot giardinera.  big chunks of carrots, celery, broccoli, peppers.  seasoned perfectly.  this is serious.he gave us a sample of their fresh fruit pina colada-tasting smoothie, too, which was also deeeeelicious!free parking.  open til 3AM.  friendly workers.  BEST tacos & hot giardinera in town.  DO IT.  note: the entire counter is encased in bullet-proof fiberglass.  might not be the safest place to go alone late at night...

2.description: This place has great burritos. My favorite is the steak with everything on it. They are open late night so that makes it even better for my after party meals. The prices are reasonable too. For the price of one Chipotle burrito you can get 2 here and that taste better I might add.

5.description: I used to go to El Gran Burrito nearly every weekend last year - 2012.  After moving far, far South, I was on the West side and decided to drop by and get a burrito. After all I remember monster sized burritos with plenty of everything. Well that wasn't the case this evening. I simply ordered a burrito with everything. I couldn't wait to feel the weight of the burrito in the bag, which meant it was the same burrito. When the guy called my number, I picked up the bag and to my surprise it was much lighter than I remembered.Well figuring the economy caused everybody to cut back,  I could deal with the lightness of the bag. What I couldn't deal with was the taste of the burrito.  My wife and I decided to split the burrito and we both noticed that the taste was totally different.It tasted watered down and had less ingredients.  I'm going to try their burritos again, but I was really surprised at the taste.

6.description: Good burritos and nachos! Cant complain about the food!

7.description: By far the best burrito I have ever had. Their cheese steak fries the greatest and I haven't found a milk shake yet to top theirs.

8.description: Just make sure they're passing their health inspections before eating there. There are rumors and stories I will not get into.

9.description: El Gran is The Shaun's late night snack attack spot! The burrito are the bomb and are great value for the amount you get with it. The service is fast with convenient parking in the back. Tacos are only $2 and burritos are $5. This spot stays open until 5am over the weekends which makes it the perfect stop on the way home from going out.

10.description: I used to go here at least 3 times a week until i saw one of the workers handle food and then money and went back to help making the food.......Should i say more??? Just nasty

4.description: I grew up eating here and I still CRAVE their gravy bread and cheese fries like crazy! LOVE IT! Great fix for any greasy spoon cravings. U will love it.

3.description: The owner of what used to be my favorite shoe store (Diana Shoes) has opened this bright, shiny new store with better merchandise and the same amazing customer service. I journeyed down to WP find some new shoes for my kid and was thrilled to see that the owner, Tony Kim, ditched the old store & business in favor of this new, gorgeous space that was once home to a banquet hall and Polish restaurant. Be sure to check out the lovely etched-glass entryway on your way in.The shoe selection is better than ever. No longer carrying a side-selection of awkward, trashy shoes they have curated the merchandise to solely (haha) focus on tennis shoes, sneakers and athletic shoes (are those all the same thing?). They even have an exclusive, locked-glass room with the hottest, most-expensive Air Jordans. And, word is Stash will also buy your old Air Jordans on consignment for a 20% cut.I'll definitely be stepping up my shoe game this summer....

1.description: The store is nice, but I wont be in again because the owner is incredibly arrogant and not very helpful. I was ready to buy a pair of shoes until we had to listen to him tell us how great he is. I walked a half a block down to Villa and the customer service was much better. I don't mind paying a premium for shoes at places like Succezz and Saint Afred bc they're customer service is so good.
