I've probably purchased over 100 pairs of Jordans in the last 15 years and I will not give a dime to Stash. The owner keeps treating people this way and the store wont be there in a few years. FYI Im Caucasian and we ll dressed, Cant imagine how he treats minorities and others.

2.description: I had given Stash a review that was 4 stars until I called up about a new Jordan release.  I still think the young man that helped me had great service but here you go... I called up and the man who answered was the Owner and he is the same Owner from the  old store Diana's Shoes. I asked him if they where doing the release he said yes. So I asked him what time the doors open and he said..."Oh you have too be on the list." I said ok how can I get on the list? He said " Sorry you can't be on the list it's for our valued customer that been shopping with us for over 10 years." .....ok so I guess all the Shoes I bought there doesn't make me a VALUED CUSTOMER??? I know a bunch of people who just wait in line on release days here and haven't shopped here over 10 YEARS!  Plus you OVER PRICE your inventory. I will never step a foot in here again and either will my friends.

0.description: Shopping at stash was an amazing experience the layout of the store is organized and clean sneakers selection is up to par,  Moyie and his staff are knowledgeable and very cordial  they all took very good care of me. I also got an amazing price for the sneakers that I really wanted,  he also threw in the shoe cleaner for free this store is a must must visit when you come to Chicago for any true sneaker head 5 Stars for them!!!!

*Le sigh*This particular location is hit or miss when it comes to getting your order correct. Pros:-A drive through -Workers are fairly friendly Cons:-They are almost always out of something. This would be understandable if it where late in the day but I asked for a chocolate donut and butter pecan flavored iced coffee...at 7am. -During another visit, I asked for an egg white flat bread and received a grilled cheese sandwich. Lessons:-Have a "back up" order just in case they're out of something.-Check your order to ensure you're getting what you wanted.

1.description: This place is a warehouse full of great African art, cultural items and clothing.  There is a wide selection of wholesale products from lotion to incense and hair wraps.  Much of the stock is imported from West Africa so you are getting stuff straight from the Mother Land.  The staff are attentive and competent.  I love buying Black Rock soap here from Ghana.  They also have burning oils and body scents as well.  This is the official store for any kind of "smell good" one might need or want.  The place is off the Eisenhower Expressway and has a buzzer outside.      There is a selection of drums and carrying cases inside as well as other percussion instruments.  If you need any authentic West African herbs this place will probably have them.  There are also many framed images to choose for your apartment, house of college dorm.  Some are black Power, other religious and others still are fraternal.  Keep this place in mind when furnishing your place.

0.description: Very large selection.  The facility is about the size of a warehouse and you WILL be browsing for a while.  Their incense is a higher quality than most that I have seen at my local botanicas.The gentleman behind the counter was very friendly and extremely helpful.  Very reasonable prices.
This Man can cook all you want and more .just tell him what you want and he will make it

1.description: Prentiss Florists is excellent, I was amazed at how beautiful the flowers looked after providing a brief description via phone to a warm and friendly order taker.  It was for a last minute funeral and things went off without a hitch. They were outstanding. I'd go back time and time again! Thanks Prentiss!

0.description: I called to order flowers for a funeral service. I was working on a very tight budget, but Prentiss made it work and my arrangement came in right under my alloted amount!!When I attended the funeral, I was shocked to see a BEAUTIFUL and rather large arrangement-it was the one I ordered!!! WOW!! Prentiss does beautiful work at very reasonable prices. Thank you!!

3.description: I love the food here,  the salmon coquette rocks and choose grits or potatoes to go with your eggs. I have taken several friends and we all agree. Excellent food and service along with a comfortable setting

1.description: Just came here for breakfast with a friend. Absolutely ghetto terrible service, than again what do you expect in a neighborhood like this..... Not much. Won't ever be back here again. Waiter was extremely rude with no type of mannerism. Don't go here

2.description: As Ive eaten here for many years and may I suggest that on Sundays you try the duck dinner. Real soul food cooking here...Bernard

0.description: I absolutely love Alices for breakfast.  I always order French toast and Salmon Croquettes.  Its not often you can find a place that serves Croquettes but GOOD Croquettes are even harder to find.  The fact that they taste like somebody's grandmomma is in the kitchen throwing down just for me is the icing on the cake!  And the french toast...I sometimes have dreams about the french toast and crave it so badly that I HAVE TO go get it, no matter where I am in the city.

4.description: When people think of soul food in Chicago they think of places like MacArthur's, Dusty's, Priscilla's, and Edna's....Alice's soul food is just as good--if not better than most of the places I named. Fresh greens, naval beans, black-eyed peas, chicken, cubed steak, smothered pork chops, perch and a host of other items that will make your mouth water. The wait for the food isn't too long (10-15min--cooked fresh), and the prices are very reasonable.

1.description: I was hoping this would be more "AJ-Wright-ish", especially with its shoe selection, but the store was kinda small and the selection wasn't that great. It was sort of a lower key TJ Maxx type store -but I think fair to say with less (if any?) brand name merchandise. It was clean and organized and they did have a few things that caught my eye. I was just expecting a bit of a better selection so I left a little disappointed. However, I would try it again, once some of the merchandise turns over to see if they had anything new and interesting that caught my fancy.

2.description: love love love this store!! being a big girl ist easy to get cute stylish cheep clothing but for my taste its an awesome place (ssshhhh they have an awesome selection of trashy/ sexy lingerie that fits us bbw)!!!

0.description: Conway is a great, cheaper alternative to most stores. They have a great selection for both plus size women and petite women as well.  Their clothes are affordable and stylish and most of the employees are helpful and willing to assist in helping you find that perfect clubbing get-up! Returns and exchanges are easy as pie (with receipt) and lines generally move quickly! Their shoe collection could use some work, and the location w/i North Riverside Mall has a very limited selection which is why I only gave 4 stars. Also, some of the clothes are cheaply made (i.e. ripping, threading coming apart, etc) but overall, this is a very good bargain hunter store!

3.description: Someone recommended this restaurant on Facebook so I decided to try it today. I got turkey wings, dressing w/ gravy and cranberry sauce, greens, mac n cheese, side of candied yams and corn bread. So for my $14 it was a nice size portion. Now let's talk about taste. The turkey wing was very over cooked I'm talking about crunchy lol. There were some pieces underneath the skin that was edible. The mac n cheese had sugar in it so it was sweet probably would have been good without it. The greens were okay. I kinda liked the dressing and candied yams. Overall it was okay but not enough for me to go back. Sorry!

1.description: I love Chef Daddy's. I have been coming since they opened and have always come away with a good meal. Most of the time it is lunch but I did get by this past Sunday and had enough for 3 days. The staff is pleasant and bend over backwards to make sure you have a good experience.

2.description: This is a nice cozy place for a quick, cheap, soul food meal. I saw this place from the Chicago Food Group on fb and I had to try them. For $4.99 you get a meat, & 2 sides. I had the smothered chops, greens, yams, & white rice. The food was DELICIOUS!!! The service was even better. I'll definitely be going back to try other delicious items they offer.

9.description: I love soul food but, I do not love the process of prep and cooking. So, I was looking to try out a new place. CHEF DADDY does not disappoint. I ordered a lil of every side, mac n cheese, string beans, collard greens, okra and had an order of the turkey ribs. The infused flavors touched every palette on my tongue. The sweet, the sour, the zest and the spice. I highly recommend calling your order in, they were extremely busy with walk ins. I can only imagine the line that will be standing down the block for this place. Get your fix in before everybody else catches a whiff from their smoke house.

10.description: Food like grandma or great aunt would make. Soul food lunch for $5 a bomb on everything,but the dressing is so good it made me ask my momma wtf she been doing. You won't regret having this meal.

4.description: I love the greens and the candied yams. Also love the meatloaf. The chitterlings are clean but can be cooked a little longer.

6.description: Omg! I just left chef daddy wanted to know what all the hype was. I purchased a smothered chicken dinner price was $5, dinner comes with two sides and old piece of cornbread and 3 small chicken wings. My chicken wings was undone bloody ass hell in the inside food was horrible. I'm trying to upload pic of chicken for proof smh! Never again.

12.description: I have never written a food review before, but felt I had to do so after having a Turkey Leg with meat that fell off the bone. I truly feel like I have discovered a hidden gem. Right off of the green line Austin stop, on lake street bordering Oak Park, you can already smell the aroma of the charbroiled oven. Please bypass the Churches chicken, look up and see the sign "Chef Daddy's"  around the corner. I love southern food, but since I don't eat beef or pork I thought it would be a challenge. I could not have been more wrong. I had my options of Turkey leg, BBQ Chicken, Freshly made Greens, Baked macaroni and cheese, Corn Bread, and for all of you pork lovers....the line during dinner would not end for their St. Louis style ribs. The Chef himself is from St. Louis, so the diner provides a positive family friendly, clean environment, with St. Louis collage mascot logos on each side of the wall. He even gave me a tour and showed me the inside of the charbroiled oven, that gives Chef Daddy's food that special St. Louis touch.Their special "Five Dollar Hallar", which includes two sides and an entree, had me so full, I regret not taking their potato salad, they were kind enough to let me sample, to go. Southern style flavorful, charbroiled soul food, cooked from scratch,...truly a mouthgasmic experience, and I hope I had you at " Fell Off The Bone".

5.description: Great food at an affordable price! We went with another couple and both families spent $20 each...you can't feed 4 adults & 2 toddlers for that amount of money at any fast food restaurant. And of course I would prefer a home cooked meal without the labor any day! I will definitely have my side items for thanksgiving catered by them. I can't wait to see them on Sunday to try out their dressing and my friend said I missed out on their potato salad so I have an excuse to go back within the same week! #DontJudgeMe #Foodie #Yum

11.description: This place has horrible food that will give you stomach ache. Greasy, cold, old meatless ribs that frankly have been drowned in ketchup. If you want to feel sick shortly after consuming the food go here...absolute waste of money. I would never recommend to anyone.

8.description: Delicious soul food for a great price! Got the rib tip dinner for $8.50. The mashed potatoes were incredible!

0.description: Really torn between 3 and 4 stars so I'll go 3.5. After seeing their banana pudding cake and brisket  online I decided to stop by with my family. We got baked chicken, pork chops, rib tips, black eye peas, Mac and cheese, coleslaw ( even though I ordered potato salad) banana pudding cake and peach cobbler. I know you're thinking what about the brisket? They were out of it along with greens, yams and spaghetti. What we had was good the Mac and cheese was DELISH and the cake to die for. Service was good and restaurant was clean. I would go again but I would make sure to call first to make sure they had what I wanted.

7.description: the mac n cheese was greasy as ever and the meat looked like it had been sitting hours but certain things i was told could be made to order ??? the mac n cheese side order was the only thing i thought was "safe" i stuck the fork in there and it was grease dripping off of it ! my stomach can not take past one fork of grease no thanks ... i will support any family business but I won't spend my evening afterwards praying to the "porcelain God" Smh

1.description: on november 4 , 2013 at 5303 west madison ave.  there is a whale fish and chicken .   this is first time ordering  at this location, and the fries are fantastic,   the gyros and beef sandwish  are the best,   although the neighborhood is run down,  the  food is  good, and prices are very good,

0.description: Call ahead is my only suggestion. The food is always great! The atmosphere is not so great but call ahead and your order will be ready, piping hot, and delicious!

58.description: It was a surprise to find a snow ice shop in Chicago and we actually stopped by on the first day that it opened!They had all the standard toppings, but with an added bonus of selling coconuts as well. The snow ice itself though, wasn't close to the quality you'd expect in California or Taiwan where these shops seem to outnumber ice cream parlors.The owners were extremely energetic, friendly, and it was clear that they were passionate and invested in their store. For some reason, they told us snow ice was a Hawaiian invention. Odd, especially since when the 士林夜市 invention was introduced to Hawaii (which still wasn't the first xuehuabing place in the U.S, but I digress) where there was a slight divergence in style, Snow Dragon definitely follows the Taiwanese mold much more than it does the heavier-sauce based Hawaiian style.Once again, I love the enthusiastic and friendly owners here, but would not visit again unless they have invested in different snow machines than the ones they used on opening day. If so, Snow Dragon could be a go-to place for me in Chicago.The fact that unlike the other Xuehuabing stores in the US, Snow Dragon could serve different unique styles of snow ice. Including some Singapoh or Filipino styles and ingredients could really differentiate this place from the rest. It has a lot of potential as a new dessert shop, so I'm excited to see where it goes from here!Snow: 1/5Azuki: 1/5Service: 4/5仙草: 1/5Diversity: 3/5Price: $/$$$$Satisfaction-to-Price: 3/5

56.description: This place could be really good. I love the yogurt, but the toppings are usually mushy and don't look fresh. The smell is what really gets me. Don't know what it is, but the place has a horrible smell that makes me want to walk out!

29.description: Came here spontaneously because was craving bubble tea, and I fell in love with the place! Such a cute yogurt/tea/macaroon place!I wasn't a fan of their yogurt flavors, but they have some interesting ones like rosewater. I also love how they have macaroons & the macaroons are double flavored! They're kinda pricey, like 1 for $2.25 or something, but macaroons are generally pricey. I got the Taro bubble tea, and I enjoyed it. It wasn't the best, but I have high standards when it comes to Taro bubble tea because I'm a Taro enthusiast. I wish my Taro tea was sweeter basically. My friend got the Matcha Green tea bubble tea, and it was good, but too watered down. My other friend got the Mango bubble tea, and it tbh wasn't very good. The employee was so nice though! He redid the mango drink, but it was still not too good, so he let her get frozen yogurt or give her a refund. She got the mango frozen yogurt and was happy! My other friend got frozen yogurt, and he was highly pleased.My big TIP is: GET THE SHAVED SNOW! It was my first time having shaved snow, and omg, SO good. I got the green tea shaved snow with condensed milk topping, and red bean & cheesecake on the side. So delicious seriously. I will be coming back again for that shaved snow. I'm going to try the taro shaved snow next! Bubble tea: $3.95Shaved Snow: $4.99

42.description: Super unique and full of great flavors and textures, new and old. Having only been once, I can tell that Snow Dragon will become a favorite for me (if not, I'll update otherwise). The shaved ice was great and the flavors of watermelon, rose, and blueberries that we combined worked unexpectedly well. You can choose from a variety of shaved ice flavors and add toppings and a sauce to create your own creation or get recommendations from the friendly staff. The bubble tea was also real good with tiny little tapioca pearls that tasted great. I'm very excited to go back and try the macaroon ice cream sandwich!

23.description: First time to eat a macaron ice cream sandwich. Tastes good but little expensive for my cheap self.  owner is nice and chatty. Kind enough to take pics of me to show off to my friends that the food here tastes good!

47.description: So...I know what you are asking..."Does it taste like a cold-ass dragon shedding its scales into a nice cardboard boat with fruit toppings?"  Yes. Yes it does.The shaved ice has unique texture. Like a dragon. And it provides lots of flavors. Like a dragon.And it is a cold dessert. Like snow.  We got the green tea shaved ice with mango and blueberries.  The ice has milk in it, and has a nice creamy texture that is similar to a chewier gelato.  The regular size is good to share between 2 people, but I wish they would be a little more generous with toppings.  Instead, they were kindly trying to up-sell us to get more toppings for $0.75 each. But I guess they are a little greedy.  Like a dragon.

8.description: Definitely worth a try!Around  20 flavors of shaved snow, interesting and customary froyo flavors (rose water, vanilla burbon, tart, Ect), macaroons and macaroon I've cream sandwiches!Regular shaved snow was just under $6 and its a large portion, I would try to share a regular next time. It was much creamier than I expected, I would try a more typical ice cream flavor next time like tiramisu or cheesecake. We had piña colada and cantaloupe, both were interesting and good. The staff were all very friendly and willing to help.

31.description: Delicious shaved ice. My friend and I shared the black sesame shaved ice. Regular comes with two free toppings and a drizzle. Owner was very friendly and attentive. Highly recommended.

34.description: I had some sort of ice cream (I don't know the name) In Hong Kong a few years ago that looked like these. I loved those ice creams and once I found this place I definitely had to try.I didn't like it. The taste was nothing extraordinary (I got Taro) and it was too sweet (considering I love sweet things!!) and the texture was weird.

16.description: Really great dessert! The ribbon ice tastes like ice cream but in a shaved texture. It's incredibly creamy. I think their froyo is super good! They have 10+ flavored including rose water, bourbon vanilla, and peanut butter. Definitely would recommend here if you have a sweet tooth! Prices are reasonable and I'd recommend splitting the shaved ice since the portions are rather larger.

13.description: Went here on a Saturday night and it wasn't packed. First time going and the girl who was working helped us a little bit. I got the mango shaved. It was good but sometimes I felt like I was just eating flavored ice for $5. Good place to go to for groups and the seating is pretty nice. They have a lot of toppings and give you two toppings.

11.description: My boyfriend brought me here about a month or two ago after visiting the museum one day because I was craving ice cream. So we tried the shaved ice. We recently visited again to try the macaron ice cream sandwich. I enjoyed the shaved ice. We got the taro with condensed milk, fruits, mochi, & jellies on top. The consistency was good & it melted right away. Pretty refreshing & it seemed lighter than eating normal ice cream. I really liked the macaron ice cream sandwich. We tried the halo-halo (filipino shaved ice dessert) one. It was made to order so the macaron was a good consistency, soft & lightly crisp. The ice cream wasn't too hard or icy so it went really well together. I recently went to California & tried a few macaron ice cream sandwiches out there such as milk & etc. Even though they were good, they were pre made & frozen, which made them harder to eat. Don't get me wrong, they were still good, but Snow Dragon's were easier to eat. It's good to know there's a place I can go to when I'm craving a macaron ice cream sandwich!

39.description: The snow is SO good. Haven't tried the fro yo yet but they have shaved snow in all different flavors. Totally worth a try. The owners are really nice people they're always very polite n respectful. Chocolate snow is amazing. Must try.

37.description: I love this place! The shaved snow is a light dessert that's still flavorful (there's a BIG difference between shaved "ice" and "snow" and this is better). Portion sizes are big and the regular is good to share.My favorite is the taro or the tiramisu and definitely with the condensed milk!Reason why it's a 4 and not a 5 is because they are a little stingy with the toppings, and for $6 I expect a lot.That said the flavor is there and this is the only one I can find inChicago :)

0.description: I was so sad when I saw this place opened up and I moved to LA! So I definitely had to make sure to stop by when I came back to Chicago and I was not disappointed. We tried the brick toast with the ice cream, cotton candy and a French macaron on top, and a macaron ice cream sandwich as well. Total heaven for a person with a sweet tooth. I was too full so I ate the macaron later on and I regretted not getting more because it was really good! I also love the space as it has a very fun vibe to it and the owner is super nice. I want to come back and try their shaved ice that so many people are raving about!

38.description: I've read through most of the reviews for this place, so I decided to try it. Normally I'm a huge shaved ice fan and always find new spots in California when visiting, but this was just not doing it for me. All of the 4 different flavors we had gotten were horribly bland, and depending on the person making it, the presentation of your plate can vary greatly. The man who served me practically threw the shaved ice on my plate, squeezed a puddle of 'drizzle' onto one corner of the plate (!?), fruit in another corner, and handed it to me somewhat melted because he was busy talking/laughing to another customer. He was also unable to give me any recommendations and quite frankly didn't seem interested in my business. What an unfortunate experience.

51.description: Love child between Italian ice and ice cream!  Tons of flavors to choose from and now they are serving bubble tea!!

27.description: Came here because I was excited to give the macaroon a chance because it's such a new concept introduce into the Midwest. To my surprise, it was very interesting and tasty. I really enjoyed it very much and do recommend for others to come and give it s chance but but its nothing compared to the west coast and with the price for such a small portion, I doubt I would get it again. Like I said, it was good and something different to try but not again for $8, seems pretty pricy to me. We tried two flavors that they had left for the day: green tea & ube. By that time, it was pretty late so we weren't able to get a chance to try out other flavors. The staffing is very accommodating and nice.

32.description: Loved the many different flavors for their froyo. The shave ice is actually flavored snow blocks which gets shaved down. Not bad, but wanted ice with syrup to flavor it.The portion was a bit stingy, but overall for the quality this place is pretty good.

54.description: This is hands down the best froyo place in the city. Income here regularly and they're always rotating flavors. The rosewater and farmhouse tart are out of this world! I love the chocolate and coconut too. The toppings are also amazing--real fruit including mango; cookie dough, brownie bites, and cheesecake bites! Also they have tons of different tapioca pearls and, my favorite, MOCHI BITES!The shaved snow is amazing too. It's like ice cream but with this unusual airy texture. It comes with two toppings and a drizzle of your choice. I recommend trying the taro or green tea shaved snow with mochi bites and these little clear tapioca (I think) noodle thingys, and condensed milk drizzle!The staff is really appreciative of its customers, really friendly. It's a family owned business and I love supporting them.

48.description: Love this place. Went here recently for the first time after a recommendation and after trying their specialty shaved ice cream treat, I loved it instantly. This is a unique way of presenting a frozen treat. You choose your favorite flavor of ice cream from their menu (and they create a shaved form of it) and then, as per your choice, they add toppings to make up your concoction. I haven't seen a place like this before. I look forward to going back.

44.description: Stumbled in on a Wednesday night with a craving for something sweet. The owners were really nice and helpful with explaining the different options. We ended up getting the shaved snow in lychee and green tea with the condensed milk drizzle. It was delicious!! Wish I lived up here so I could come in more regularly!

24.description: Woohoo!  This place is great!  My family stopped by and had macaron Halo-halo, mango and chocolate ice cream sandwiches and Taro shaved ice.  The ice cream sandwiches were good portions and super tasty.  The macarons held together nicely.  The taro shaved ice was sooo good!  I will definitely stop by again to try their other menu items.  By the way, their staff is super nice and kindly helped us with the menu.

7.description: I'm not a huge fan of ice cream or yogurt, so I was actually excited to try some SNOW!  I kept seeing all these pics on social media of the options at this place and I was intrigued. I went on a week day night, so it wasn't crowded. I went with the Snow Dragon. You can pick 2 flavors of shaved snow, three toppings, and 2 drizzles. It was beautiful and quite tasty. I really can't even describe to you what it tastes like. Very light though, so you don't feel icky afterwards. I will definitely be back to try more flavors and other menu items. That cake sandwich is calling my name.

49.description: In the hunt I for some type of post dinner dessert the wife and I stumbled upon this place.  It's right next to the weiners circle if you happen to be looking for authentic Chicago dogs as well.  Once you walk in you can tell this place used to be one of those cookie cutter frozen yogurt shops that have been popping up everywhere.  They have a little bit more to offer though.You'll see that they have a display full of macarons.  Not the best ones I've ever had but They're a lot better than I expected.  The reason you're here though is the shaved ice they have.  It's a bunch of layers of this ice cream in a cup that get laid on top of each other.  It gives it a unique texture that I haven't quite had before.  They can load it up with toppings too like fruit or those little mango bubbles.  We got taro flavor as it was highly recommended by the staff and I'm glad I got something a little different than I usually would.  You can also check out the frozen yogurt as well. They had some really cool flavors I'd try if I ever came back like rose water.  There's a lot to like about this place they even have some lounge type chairs with candles in the back where you can hang out and eat.  It felt like we stepped into the club.

40.description: Very unique! Green tea flavor tasted much better than the fruity other one.

53.description: Very cool concept but the flavor isn't there. We got lychee and taro and were disappointed with the light flavor. I think the shaved ice cream could be awesome if it had the right flavor :(

30.description: I love this place!!!! got the seasonal flavor of Pumpkin, added cheesecake and yogurt chips... Great combo!!! It was $5.45 total. My friends got the green tea and the coconut flavor. Both tasted just as good. I must admit I like it better than a few other snow shaved ice cream spots in Cali because it is more creamy and less icy. My entire bowl did not melt before I finished. That is always a plus! It doesn't melt as fast as other shaved snow spots i've had. Did I mention the flavors are prominent and strong? It's not a powder drizzled on. The snow shave is the actual flavor itself!! Hip hip hooray for that!I will return, again and again!

46.description: Definitely worth a try!Around  20 flavors of shaved snow, interesting and customary froyo flavors (rose water, vanilla burbon, tart, Ect), macaroons and macaroon I've cream sandwiches!Regular shaved snow was just under $6 and its a large portion, I would try to share a regular next time. It was much creamier than I expected, I would try a more typical ice cream flavor next time like tiramisu or cheesecake. We had piña colada and cantaloupe, both were interesting and good. The staff were all very friendly and willing to help.

1.description: I got the boba milk tea here. It was probably the grossest boba milk tea I have ever had. The boba was over cooked and lumped together and wasn't chewy at all. The milk tea was some weird consistency that didn't really blend or stay together.I tasted it, walked out, and threw it away. I was a shame because I was really craving boba and this place was so disappointing.

55.description: I'm not sure how to rate this because I've never had shaved snow before, so I have nothing to compare it to! Personally I didn't like the shaved snow as much as regular ice cream, but that isn't Snow Dragon's fault. I'm glad they brought this trend to Chicago as there are already a lot of shaved snow places in NY and CA. They also have a section for frozen yogurt. Give it a try just for the experience!

9.description: The shaved snow ice was so delicious and light. It's a popular Taiwanese ice desert.  Being a Taiwanese native,  it is always awesome to find places in Chicago that serves Taiwanese cuisine and desert.  I would recommend trying the green tea or taro flavor.  The place is very clean and service is very friendly.  It's not the cheapest as it's about $5 for a regular size snow ice with two toppings.  Parking in the area is quite difficult but I would definitely go back.

26.description: Not authentic taiwan bubble tea at all. Bubble is too small and I can even count numbers of bubbles. As a bubble tea lover, this is not a place you go for bubble tea. I recommend Vivi bubble in the loop area. I don't get why this place has this high rating...

25.description: My boyfriend brought me here about a month or two ago after visiting the museum one day because I was craving ice cream. So we tried the shaved ice. We recently visited again to try the macaron ice cream sandwich. I enjoyed the shaved ice. We got the taro with condensed milk, fruits, mochi, & jellies on top. The consistency was good & it melted right away. Pretty refreshing & it seemed lighter than eating normal ice cream. I really liked the macaron ice cream sandwich. We tried the halo-halo (filipino shaved ice dessert) one. It was made to order so the macaron was a good consistency, soft & lightly crisp. The ice cream wasn't too hard or icy so it went really well together. I recently went to California & tried a few macaron ice cream sandwiches out there such as milk & etc. Even though they were good, they were pre made & frozen, which made them harder to eat. Don't get me wrong, they were still good, but Snow Dragon's were easier to eat. It's good to know there's a place I can go to when I'm craving a macaron ice cream sandwich!

12.description: Snow Dragon Shavery, you tease. I was lured into the shop after glancing through all the salacious plate pics of colorfully fluffed sweetness. While there's also fro-yo akin to what you'd find at Yogurtland, I dove straight into their shaved ice selections. Mango Mango MangoMango shaved ice, mango fruit pieces, topped off with mango sauce, plus some mochi.As you couldn't tell, I love mango and this place gets an A for effort. It's easy to bash this fairly new-to-Chicago concept from a globetrotter's perspective. Will I re-live my taiwanese shaved ice experience? Not quite. Besides that little shop in Vegas, I don't think any place has come close. The soft icy texture wasn't bad, but the flavor tasted a little too sweet as if it was concentrate-based, rather than from real fruit. The folks behind the counter were really nice and friendly. Besides a tweak, it's a solid place to venture in, try something new, and cool off with a nice frozen treat.

59.description: If you've had the real thing, you will be extremely disappointed. I got the green tea snow with red bean, mango, and condensed milk. The red bean is not what Chinese people eat. Everything was way too sweet. The consistency of the snow was good, and I liked that they tried to get the flavors. It's awesome that we have this here in Chicago since Cloud 9 closed, but it's just not as good as it could be.

21.description: Very friendly staff who are passionate about their shop! Fun assortment of random frozen treats (shaved ice, macaron sandwiches). Surprisingly, Snow Dragon Shavery also had some Filipino flavors (macapuno, ube). Worth trying!

17.description: It's definitely a new concept here, but I've experienced much better on the west coast in SoCal/Vegas. My companion thinks it's just "ok" since he said the best one he's ever had was in Texas, just like another reviewer.I'll take it as a bad sign when it's hot outside and the entire place was sterile clean and empty. We ordered a large and let me tell you, it was the 3 times smaller than the one I'm used to and pricy for the portion. We felt like we were getting ripped off for $7. Fresh fruit toppings were limited - I only saw mango that day. The rest were all the standard froyo toppings. The amount of toppings scooped was rather stingy...1 small teaspoon to the side. Shouldn't it be liberally applied to the top like a sundae?What really pissed us off: It was nice of the man to bring it to the table for us. Judging from the way he brought it there (He's never been a server), it was tedious with those tiny, shallow, flimsy paper plates. I was already expecting a disaster...and disaster it was. It made it to the table, tipped over and a chunk tumbled off onto the table. He attempted to scoop it back onto the plate and threw away a big chunk we paid for. Ok...that was SUPER unhygenic! I thought he would've made us a new one or added some back to enormous chunk that fell off. Then he comes with a spray cleaner and cloth with the dessert on the table. Oh hell no...if he sprayed that thing it would've gone directly into the dessert.So we quickly finished our shaved snow and left. The consistency was more icy than creamy. Definitely this is a newbie business and customer service is lacking. Please get some better plates and stop being so cheap. I'm pretty sure I won't be returning and the $ would've been better spent on a 99 cent Italian ice the same day.

10.description: Having tried many macaroon ice cream sandwiches from California and Florida, I was very pleased to have come across this particular establishment upon a recent visit. Upon entering, it was empty with no one to greet initially. But I get it. It's winter time in Chicago and who the hell wants to snack on something as cold as the breeze outside. Well...I did. Was subtly surprised they had several Filipino influences on the macaroon ice cream sandwiches: ube, halo halo, and buco pandan. Upon my indecisiveness, the owner suggested halo halo. I whole heartedly obliged. The presentation of the deliciousness that is the halo halo macaroon ice cream sandwich exceeded all prior notions and expectations. In other words, it was pretty damn good.

5.description: Because I'm from Cali, I was craving for shaved snow. My hubby found this place and took me here and plus he wanted to try their halo halo macaroon ice cream sandwich. I would say that this is a "not bad" dessert place in CHICAGO but the places in Cali are still better lol!I got the red bean shaved snow with some toppings (I forgot what I chose). It is not bad. The regular size is enough for two ppl, but I wish they can add more toppings. My hubby tried the halo halo macaroon ice cream sandwich. The ice cream was not that hard as we expected it to be. The macaroon is soft and lightly crisp, which is good. I could be wrong, but I think this is the only place that serves macaroon ice cream sandwiches in Chicago.The prices are decent. But I wish they can be generous with toppings for shaved snow. (That's why I am giving 4 out of 5)

3.description: Yay!!! After eating down the street from this place I finally decided to check it out! It was late, heading it's way to 10pm, but I was super ready for a sweet treat. I love, love, love, macaroons & just seeing pictures from this place really made me want to try it even more! I got the cookies & cream macaroons sandwich & the ice cream was actually really yummy, not too sweet.... But just enough. Just the way I like it. The macaroon part of the sandwich was a bit hard, but understanding for an ice cream sandwich. Their regular macaroons were okay. Nothing special, but still a nice treat. It's a really cute place on the inside, & I can see it being a nice place to meet up with a friend & just hangout. I will probably be back again to try out their bubble tea & the like.The customer service there was really nice as well. :) Thanks!

35.description: Just when I thought I could only find snow ice and ice cream macaroon sandwiches in Cali, I randomly found this shavery.I can not describe how excited I was to try it. When I got there I was so overwhelmed with happiness and didn't know what to order. I asked the staff what was recommended and stuck with that. I ordered 1 ube macaroon sandwich, a halo halo macaroon sandwich, and a taro shaved ice with a few toppings.Each bite was savored and although full, I was sad to take the last bite. I would give the customer service an A+ for the attentiveness and helpfulness.will definitely come back soon!

19.description: Loved the many different flavors for their froyo. The shave ice is actually flavored snow blocks which gets shaved down. Not bad, but wanted ice with syrup to flavor it.The portion was a bit stingy, but overall for the quality this place is pretty good.

28.description: I have to admit I was skeptical about this place at first, but then came here for Frozen Yogurt and it was very good.  Then the next time I came here I tried the SHAVED SNOW and it was ridiculously good!  I highly recommend both the yogurt and if you're ready for something different and delicious try the Shaved Snow! Yum!

45.description: We wanted to see and taste the latest dessert trend of Shaved Snow. The place was modern and clean. The staff was polite but spoke in a low voice that we could barely hear him. He provided us with recommendations that were very helpful. They have plenty of toppings to choose from. We went with mango (milk) shaved snow topped with mochi, strawberry popping boba and half condensed milk and half mango syrup. It was pretty good. The mango syrup was a bit too sweet though. Only downside was that there wasn't a good toppings to shaved snow ratio. We'll go back to try other flavors and the froyo.

33.description: Makes some of the best French macarons you can find in Chicago (try the hazelnut flavor) and they make some with ice cream too. The flavored shaved ice are all delicious, as well as their frozen yogurt. Their bubble tea is decent but they make their tapioca pretty well. One of the best places you can stop by for dessert so it gets pretty packed.

43.description: Great helpful service here and I was very excited to try ...looked soooo good!  But sadly, flavors are bland...except the coffee which is TOOO much like drinking a cup of coffee poured over ice, too strong.  The key lime and pina colada didn't taste like much at all, like eating snow w/a very light flavor, could hardly taste the lime or pina.  Did I eat it all? Yes.  Was I satisfied with getting my sweet tooth fix?  No.

2.description: One of my favorite parts of Hawaii is the shaved ice. OK well everything about Hawaii is my favorite part, but the shaved ice everywhere on the islands was such a welcomed and perfect cool treat. So I was excited to see the concept here in Chicago, but was disappointed and confused by Snow Dragon. I ordered the Red Bean with mango pearls, strawberries, and condensed milk. It was good, but unfortunately was no one near as tasty as the kind I had on the Islands. The store itself is really weird. The owners should have done a better job with conceptualizing the physical space of the store. There are awkward decorations everywhere, yet there are no signs or menu of what you're ordering. You walk in for the first time and are like, "what the hell is going on here." I've had shaved ice before so at least I knew what I was eating, so I can imagine individuals who haven't had shaved ice are probably even more confused upon ordering. It's just not a very customer friendly experience with the physical design of the store. (White, bright, fluorescent lights don't help). The dessert itself was fine, but nothing special and certainly nothing to go out of your way for. On top of all of this, Snow Dragon has frozen yogurt for those clients that are just turned off/confused by the shaved ice, which I feel defeats the purpose. There are already tons of frozen yogurt places.

18.description: Came here spontaneously because was craving bubble tea, and I fell in love with the place! Such a cute yogurt/tea/macaroon place!I wasn't a fan of their yogurt flavors, but they have some interesting ones like rosewater. I also love how they have macaroons & the macaroons are double flavored! They're kinda pricey, like 1 for $2.25 or something, but macaroons are generally pricey. I got the Taro bubble tea, and I enjoyed it. It wasn't the best, but I have high standards when it comes to Taro bubble tea because I'm a Taro enthusiast. I wish my Taro tea was sweeter basically. My friend got the Matcha Green tea bubble tea, and it was good, but too watered down. My other friend got the Mango bubble tea, and it tbh wasn't very good. The employee was so nice though! He redid the mango drink, but it was still not too good, so he let her get frozen yogurt or give her a refund. She got the mango frozen yogurt and was happy! My other friend got frozen yogurt, and he was highly pleased.My big TIP is: GET THE SHAVED SNOW! It was my first time having shaved snow, and omg, SO good. I got the green tea shaved snow with condensed milk topping, and red bean & cheesecake on the side. So delicious seriously. I will be coming back again for that shaved snow. I'm going to try the taro shaved snow next! Bubble tea: $3.95Shaved Snow: $4.99

41.description: Addiction Alert!!!!This place is amazing. I live in the area, and I finally stopped in a few weeks ago. Since then, I find myself visiting several times a week. The interior is bold and beautiful, and the staff is wonderful. It's a family owned business, and everyone is always friendly, patient, and helpful. They do a wonderful job recommending flavor combinations for shaved snow. Highly recommend it. My favorite was vanilla snow with lychee and strawberry boba with a rose drizzle.They have a wonderful assortment of options. I love that they offer organic frozen yogurt, and almond flour based (gluten-free) macaroons. This city is saturated with frozen yogurt places, but this one is the best by far! You can't beat the quality or service.

52.description: The people who run the shop are patient and informative with customers who aren't as familiar with shaved snow. I typically get the taro or milk tea flavors, which are my favorites. However, I feel like they are inconsistent with their serving sizes. My biggest issue is with the smell in the store itself. It seems as though they're having a sewage or plumbing issue- it's gotten progressively worse the last few times we've been in. They try to burn candles to mask it, but it only makes it worse. Glad they put tables outside or I wouldn't have been able to eat while sitting in the stench.

50.description: I honestly thought the next time I'd find shaved ice--let alone fluffy, creamy, perfect shaved ice--would be some faraway trip to Hawaii.  Not so!!  On our very own Clark street?!  The product is fresh, delicious, unique.  The owner of the shop was friendly and on the ball.  Excited to return!!

4.description: Not a day goes by where I don't think about Snow Dragon Shavery's delicious amazing wonderful honey toast aka brick toast.  It can take a while to make, but every minute is worth it.  Sweet, buttery honey toast with your choice of ice cream (2 scoops) and drizzle topped with whipped cream, a French macaron, and fruit.  You can choose your different toppings; I had mine with green tea and mango ice cream with some nutella drizzle...it was perfect.Besides their honey toast, they have a lot of goodies and a variety of Asian treats and flavors that you don't see everyday, such as ube, halo-halo-lychee, etc...which I love!I'm glad that they are located in Lincoln Park, where it is nearly impossible to find parking, so that I don't go here everyday.

6.description: I stopped in last summer and I wasn't very impressed. I ordered green tea flavor, but I tasted like frozen water. I wouldn't stop here again. I also had drizzled condensed milk, but it didn't do anything for it. For the amount I paid it was definitely lacking. I had a few bites and tossed it out. The only good part was the mochi bites.

22.description: The guy at the counter was really friendly. We ordered lychee boba. Within 2-3mins. he handled our order plus straw. Really good boba

15.description: I came here last night with my sister and cousins to check out the hype at this place. I had to - I mean it's the only shaved ice place in the Chicagoland area. We ordered the large one which includes two flavors, three toppings, and a drizzle for a little under $10. I was very fascinated by the shaved ice and the consistency of it. It was like a hybrid between the texture of ice cream and cotton candy. Very light and fluffy. We chose watermelon and mango with red bean, mango jelly, and mochi drizzled with condensed milk. It was delicious! We devoured it super quick. I also tasted their frozen yogurt. They had awesome flavors! My favorites were the tart, pomegranate, and the rose water! Yes I said ROSE WATER! Very fresh and interesting. They only charge 47 cents/ounce as well. That's about 10 cents cheaper than most places. One thing I appreciated here was the service. The brothers who own this place are genuinely nice and want you to enjoy their dessert. They were making conversation with us and were hospitable. I took one star off because the portion sizes were a bit small and I expected a larger amount of toppings. The composition wasn't the best either. But that's just me being picky lol. Overall, a place you must try!

57.description: I don't have a frame of reference when it comes to shaved ice, but from our recent trip here after dinner and drinks in the area, I can't say I'd be dying to return.We shared a milk flavored snow ice between two people, and had it topped with red bean, condensed milk, and chunks of mochi.  When we received our order, I was underwhelmed by the quantity of toppings on there, and perhaps also the presentation.  However "authentic" or not authentic it was, maybe it just wasn't for me - the flavors were decent but didn't excite.  Frankly I'd consider it very marginally different, if pretty much the same as other froyo places.

20.description: Ordered both the froyo and shavery from Snow Dragon Shavery, and both desserts were great. The froyo flavors were exceptionally weird but delicious :)

36.description: This place is amazing all around. There is a really good variety of frozen yogurt flavors. They have the classics (vanilla, chocolate, original) but they also have more fun flavors (rose water and dragon fruit for example!). Also, they have lots of toppings, my favorite is the brownie bites. However, the most remarkable feature is the service. The owners are extremely nice and welcoming. The seating arrangement is also very chill and relaxed. There's some super comfy chairs in the back too. Overall, I LOVE this place.

14.description: I had high expectations of this place to help me re-live the amazing snow ice places I've eaten at Texas and California but something about the texture and consistency of the snow ice at Snow Dragon disappointed me and made me so sad :(:( I had the red bean with mango, blueberry and a drizzle of condensed milk but did not enjoy it at all. It wasn't refreshing and creamy like I have had before and it didn't feel like it would be thirst quenching on a hot summer day. The toppings are the standard frozen yogurt toppings. In other locations I've had more interesting toppings such as egg pudding, taro pudding, and panna cotta. Makes a world of a difference and so much more delicious. Wish they had it here as well.Staff here is super friendly and they have lots of other options such as frozen yogurt and tea. I liked that the place was super clean and had lots of seating.

58.description: After seeing everything this store had to offer, I kind of regretted that I was not in there shopping for myself. Oh, Bachelorette parties and the woes of having to pick out erotic garments for my best friend, so SHE can have fun prancing around in lacy erotic get-ups, wielding sex toys and sex coupons. In other words, I spent entirely way too much money in this store, in the effort to live vicariously through my gift purchases. To be honest though, I was disappointed in their slim selection of lingerie. Most of which seem cheap, with crooked buttons and ugly little red roses. But whatever they lack in lingerie, they make up for in sex toys. Want a sex chair? Oh yeah, they have it, built and on display on their sales floor. Their other, more mild and less freakishly outlandish sex toys are neatly on display in the middle of the store.This was the first store of this nature, that I ever left with the intention of eventually coming back. Which surprised me a little. The interior was decorated tastefully, and the display of the merchandise was not tacky or disorderly. I would like to see more of a lingerie selection without the tacky glue-on buttons and tiny red roses. Once that happens, I will change my rating and give them five stars.

56.description: Clean + Reasonably priced + Helpful staff = Thumbs up!

29.description: One of my favorite toy stores in the city. Clean, the staff is knowledgeable and so friendly, and they have a great selection.They have a parking lot.. that's also a plus. But my favorite thing about this sex shop..The free workshops. I have been to a lot of them. There are a good amount to chose from and happen on certain nights. All of the workshops i have been to at the pleasure chest have been informative and really great. Plus you get a discount on a purchase for attending.This is always my first stop when needing something new.The only reason i rated it 4 stars instead of 5 is because i wish they had a bigger selection for lingerie. It isn't this stores focus.. but i just wish there was a small section for it. They do have a good amount of stockings and tights though!

42.description: I've been a long time fan of Pleasure Chest.  It's not a sleazy sex toy shop.  It's clean, the staff are knowledgeable, the products are well made and worth their money.  They do workshops on all sorts of topics and I never feel like I am going to be ridiculed or shamed when I attend them.  In short, this is a dream shop.  They aren't sleazy or nasty and I feel empowered when I walk through the door.  This store is for adult pleasures, not crappy bachelorette crap or gag sex stuff.  The toys here range in price from very reasonable to very high end.  If you want quality sex toys, and a helpful, candid, and knowledgeable staff, go here.  You won't be disappointed.  I am moving and I am going to miss this place dreadfully!

23.description: This is an excellent shop, they should have one in every town!  Nobody should have to go to skeezy places lined with nasty porn and dirty old men staring at you.  Adult stores should be safe places where people can explore, learn new things, feel accepted, and not feel grossed out or objectified.  Everything is tastefully displayed, all the toys are out for you to pick up (but obviously you buy a fresh one in a box, stacked below the display).  You won't feel skeeved out in here at all.  Everything is clean and pretty and nicely-arranged.  There is a distinctly grown-up vibe here; they do have a small selection of funny bachelorette novelties but a VERY small selection.  This is a place you go for something nice.The best part about my experience here was how rockin' the staff was.  The woman behind the counter was really knowledgeable, and incredibly adept at using LGBT safe language and not making assumptions about what kind of partner I'd have.  She actually said "this toy is great if you play with a partner who has a p-nis."  I'm sorry but how great is that?  I love that she didn't say "if you have a boyfriend" - which would assume I'm straight (which I am, but still) and I think her use of that phrase was really trans-friendly too.  No assumptions about who I'm attracted to, who my partners are, or anything.  I just found that incredibly respectful.  I imagine this is a place where LGBT folks could really feel comfortable, and where the staff would actually be knowledgeable about LGBT sexuality.You gotta support a store like that.  Fortunately it's within walking distance (well, a long walk) from my house, so I will certainly be a return customer!

47.description: Ok, I had to make the trip after a recommendation from a friend...First off, the logo is perfect!!  What a great design and while tasteful, it's erotic as well.Now I didn't have a shopping list or any idea - I was just "browsing".  I don't frequent these types of shops, but I am also not a prude.  I just wanted to broaden my horizons and "educate" myself in the unspoken glories of love.The shop is tasteful and clean and I got an unknown type of look when I went in...hmmmm.  Maybe I'm just paranoid.I was asked if I needed anything and to their disappointment, I replied in a confident:  "No thank you, I'm just looking".Needless to say, I left the store emptyhanded but with a new found interest into the world of erotic. (The Liberator Wedge?  Cooool!)I still don't get the "Beladonna's Foot Soldiers"....but I did think that they were funny.

8.description: Great place, has a lot of everything. Staff is very helpful and polite

31.description: I love this place becasue besides selling adult toys they have great workshops that are free!!Now, I like the wide selection of adult toys they have but many are over priced but I like coming on the day they have a workshop because they take 15% off your purchase!!Great friendly staff and they know the products that they are selling and if they don't know they do find out!!!

34.description: Great range of products, decent prices, cute and fun! Do yourself a favor and check this place out!!!

16.description: From the most upscale 5th ave shop to the seedy underground side road video arcade, I've seen them all, coast to coast, and let me tell you, The Pleasure Chest has them all beat, hands down.Actually, this is my first time in an adult store and I was pleasantly surprised how comfortable I felt being here. I came in to buy some gifts for a bachelorette party then found myself learning about the latest technology in self pleasure. She actually did my nails and I must say did a good job after some prompting. For instance, she wanted to leave spots of nail polish on my nails when she was going to put the uv gel on top (that's a hell naw). After being redirected to get the color off (7 times... Seriously), with much attitude she did so. My advice would be that if you're in a pinch, don't mind watching your nails like a hawk to get them done well and are in the neighborhood, this is a good place to get what you need. But if you're looking for that on fleek, easy experience, this may leave something to be desired.

M&M Quick Mart is a pretty standard bodega.  It looks like it used to be a 7-11.  It is remarkable in one way:  They have every single flavor of now&later and then some.  So if you miss them, now you know where to go.

1.description: This is your run of the mill mcdonalds with one fun exception. RANDOMLY they accept cash only. buyer beware.

0.description: yes this is "run of the mill".....but they do have wireless (free).Also some cool boxing pics. Go Evander!Anyone know why the pugilistic photos??

3.description: Food was very good. I ordered the combination fried rice and the combination lo mein. Rice was great, lo mein was weird. Very thin ramen looking noodles and although I ordered combination, it was only shrimp. It was still flavorful, but it wasn't my order. 3 stars for messing up my order and NOT accepting plastic. It's 2012 and you're located in the hood...do I really want to be on Madison with cash at night?

1.description: A Westside institution.......Cash is still king herre, so leave your plastic @ home. You can't go wrong with any of the combos(all under $8) huge portions. Plus free egg rolls with purchases over $13 & $19.  When ordering be sure to go by number so your order doesn't get lost in translation, also be clear and prepared to repeat yourself the glass is THICK. Service always friendly but come with attitude & be prepared to get it back. Also don't sleep on the Carb Rangoon SUPA FYE!!! Seen a lot of other places come and go but CSK has consistently been on point. #Goodeats

2.description: A friend of me told me about this place abt 3 yrs ago ... I been going every since I fell in love with the beef and broccoli and the 5x's spicy chicken fried rice yes its great

0.description: Really good Egg Foo Young,Mongolian Chicken, and wings. My fav spot for Chinese when out West.

4.description: This place has the BEST CRAB RANGOON... EVER! The price is very reasonable and the service is... okay.  But the food is great. Not too salty or full of MSG like the other carry out chinese places. I love the dinner plate, fast and cheap. Sometimes you don't always want to go out for dinner and sit down because you just want to take something home and be a bum on the couch... i mean... we all know the chinese food carry out is the way to go when you don't want that pizza. I love the Shrimp and Lobster Sauce, definitely my fav. And the eggrolls are good too... it doesn't have that chalky taste or too much peanut taste to it. I definitely recommend it.

3.description: Tried this spot today, won't be back!! Not Authentic Mexican Food. Had Steak Taco Dinner, Tacos just OK....but didn't like the cheddar cheese on it. Refried beans tasted Scorched, Rice no taste at all. Don't waste your time if you're looking for Good, Authentic Mexican Food-

1.description: A lot has changed since I first went in and the new owner is such a great guy!I would for sure recommend this place not only because the food has impoved but because the owner cares so much about this business that if you feel the food wasn't up to par he will replace it (did for me since my past experience was terrible with old owners). Bottom line -   EAT, ENJOY, SMILE.

2.description: Aweful! Rice looks and tastes like minute rice. "Pastor" tacos were disgusting! I had to spit it out. This is NOT even close to authentic.

5.description: delivery is not good at all.... seemed rushed. fish tacos was subpar... ordered 2 steak tacos.... they were combined.... burrito was great.....

0.description: Very friendly staff and very tasty food. Lots of chorizo in the meal nice size portions. Hot sauce has great kick which is hard to find at other places.

4.description: New Mexican restaurant in town.  Walked in   for lunch and the place looked fresh and clean.  They have few tables to dine in and menu on wall to order at register.( No servers.... so no tips).  Also noticed they deliver.  They have your average mexican menu with a few extras.  I played it safe and ordered  steak enchiladas con salsa verde dinner and a horchata  to drink.  Spent about $12 Food took about 9 minutes, while waiting I chugged my entire cup of  horchata and then ordered a second.   (Best Horchata ever ,Flavor was authentic and rich.)  Food came out and looked good and tasted better.  Salsa had right amount of heat and steak was lean not fatty. Rice was rice and no frijoles for me.  I was impressed and will try their delivery service next time.  Food was 4.5/5 but horchata took them to next level.

0.description: I have been shopping at Fort Pitt for many years for work and have followed them to various locations. This is the fourth location I have experienced, and is my favorite!Why? Because it is on the west side, at the city limits, so that makes it much easier to access for me! Also, the parking is plentiful and free, right on the side of the building. And this location is all one floor, well lit, and easier to navigate than some of the previous locations.Ok. So what Fort Pitt does is buy used hotel furniture from high end hotels in bulk (think Four Seasons and St Regis), then turn around and sell it at extremely reasonable prices. The items are always of high quality, but can show a slight bit of wear and tear. But at these prices, here's my advice: Deal With It. Buy some furniture touch up markers (at various hardware stores) and some Old English Furniture oil and go to town. But not all pieces are damaged; inspect your purchase carefully. If purchasing an upholstered piece, I would have it steam cleaned or even better, re-upholstered. Again, you'll be paying so little for quality furniture, you can afford it!Their stock is constantly changing, so my advice is to stop by often. If you don't see anything you like this time, chances are you will the next! Desks, tables, sofas, lamps, artwork, mini fridges, desk chairs, and ottomans are just a few items they offer. They also carry large sized draperies and brand new mattresses and box springs, again at fantastic prices.I have found the staff is always helpful and informative.Next time I go I'll post some pictures, I promise!Give yourself plenty of time to explore this place, it's kind of like a treasure hunt.

3.description: I like this store a lot! You walk in and the men's section is on the left, the woman's section is on the right.  Clearance shoes are almost straight back.The size range is good.  I love Skechers and have always had a difficult time finding ones that are perfect.  Because this is a Skechers store, not some department store that happens to sell Skechers, I can browse over 100 designs.  Last time I went, I bought 3 pairs of gym shoes and 1 pair of more dressy-casual shoes.  There's usually a BOGO half off sale, too!  Bonus :)

1.description: The staff is extremely helpful and friendly.  They are very sweet and flexible about return policies.  I always come back here when I come home to Chicago.

2.description: We walked in to this Sketchers and I was overwhelmed by how many shoes they had here! Unfortunately, most of these shoes were for the men. Yawn!!!I was looking for something professional, in closed toe form, that I could wear to work. I could not find anything sophisticated enough for my tastes (and really....I'm not that sophisticated at all) I was really looking for some dressy flats but I could not find any here (that did not look sporty). They had some boots but they were also not for my taste.  However, the men's shoes were a lot more attractive and abundant in selections (but not in sizes).No one had asked to help me, but they did help my shopping companion look for shoes. I guess I just looked too uninterested!The prices here are okay. I didnt think it was that much under retail cost, but every penny saved counts!There is plenty of parking next to the store because it is located in shopping center area. Make sure to watch out for pedestrians in this area. They dont seem to know what a cross walk is....

5.description: Its open on Tuesday!

6.description: This is the Sketchers Outlet store and it hast the best deals on Sketchers from a few seasons ago. I have been to this store in Missouri and it was basically the same except much cleaner than this one. This one is actually a little depressing looking but it's not like you go there for the ambiance. You go here for the savings. The Sketchers outlet usually has a deal where if you buy one pair you get the second half off. This Sketchers also has this deal but for some reason they have the rule that you can only use it on shoes that start at $25-30. This is disappointing because there are lots of shoes there that I wanted to get for $20 bucks but I couldn't because I would lose the discount. I was so disappointed about this because I know for a fact the other Sketchers store did not have this restriction. But if you are expecting that then I don't think it was a big deal. I got some cute shoes anyway. The staff was very nice even if they aren't that helpful they are at least polite about it. I will definitely visit here again soon.

0.description: God, how I Love this place!I can always come in here and find some great deals, like when youbuy 1 pair of shoes you get the 2nd pair of equal or lesser value at halfprice.. Score!Now, I usually come in here looking for some athletic type shoes and Ialways pretty much walk out with great shoes at reduced prices , buttoday I came in looking for some comfy shoes but they couldn't be athletic..And, honestly, I wasn't sure I would find what I needed but lo and beholdSkechers came through yet once again..This store is pretty incredible, lotsa shoes for the Man, Woman, Munchkin,Yadda Yadda in your life!And, they have some great shoes on Clearance.. hey.. I mean they areSkechers..Sure, some of the styles may be from last season but if that doesn't affectyour Social Status and you can just know you'll be stylin' in your Skechersno matter what!Seriously, I am 52, have worn Nike, Reebok, Adidas, and other assorteddesigner label shoes throughout my life.. But I have loved Skechers the most!Great variety at a great price..So, if you like Skechers like I do you should go visit this Skechers Warehouse..Okay, it's in a bad hood but, what the hell, take a chance, live dangerously..Like Me!Because these shoes are definitely worth it...l

4.description: One of our dogs decided to use my son's favorite pair of Sketchers as a tug of war toy.  As fate would have it, that particular style is no longer available anywhere online.  Sketchers produces a new line every 6 months, and unfortunately for me, my son outgrows them at the same pace.I have driven past this particular location quite a few times. Based on a review by another Yelper, I hoped that this location might still carry that style as it also a factory outlet store.  We were SOL. We needed to find another style that was black, red, lit up and had z-straps.  Found several, only not in his size.  We finally convinced him to purchase another style for the interim and promised to order the light up skull shoes that he really wanted online.  As for me....major score.  Women's sale shoes were an additional 50% off, boots another 40% off.  I found a great pair of boots that were originally $89 for $12 after discounting.  The majority of clearance items were sized 5-6.  If you have super tiny feet, run, don't walk there!All of their other shoes were buy 1 get 1 half off.

3.description: I love the pizza puff here.   It's HUUUGGGEEE

1.description: Terrys has an amazing grilled  chicken salad wait time is a little long but worth it.

2.description: I love this restaurant I grew up eating Terry's their food is great and they also have wonderful service...i definitely recommend this place!!

5.description: Come here for the gyro burrito. It's one of a kind. I also recommend their pizza puff which is the size of a dinner plate. It's good for 2-3 meals. Yum!Pros: Very affordableFriendly staffCons:No where to eat inside

6.description: Love this place.  It's just a few blocks down from me on Madison and a must stop place for quick grub.The Italian beef is just as good as what you get at any place around the city and the burgers are juicy and tender.Best part is price.  Paid 10 bucks for a beef, a burger, 2 fries and a pop.

7.description: This place is great! I love the homemade pizza puffs and I even love the tacos more then my beloved TBK. Their burgers are sub par but for a $1 can you really complain?

8.description: Worst restaurant ever.....HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.....Food was awful.. I was sick after eaten there...Save your money..time..and stomache...Dont go!

9.description: The food here is great, you'll have to try their super tacos and slurpees ....This is a restarant and should be in that category

0.description: Good tasting food. Fast service food...food taste the same as it always has. It felt like being home again. They have some pizza puffs thats very big..

4.description: The steak tacos here are the bee's knees. El Gran on North Ave has always been my go to place for tacos, but Terry's got them close to beat.

3.description: The dollar menu cheddar burger, fries, and frosty is a great deal for $3! Can't say McD's can beat that.

1.description: This place has the worse customer service in the world!!! How the entire restaurant have an attitude? I swear this burger looked like hell and if I get sick I know exactly who to blame. I do plan on calling corporate in the morning because I actually like Wendys but this staff is beyond terrible!

2.description: Horrible customer service. It's fast food yet waited 15 mins to get my order taken and 17 more for my food to be packaged. After clearly stating and repeating myself that I didn't want blue cheese in my salad. I guess that meant extra cheese for them! No way I'd ever return here.

0.description: Not going back EVER to Wendy's at North Ave. Last time there were roaches in the kitchen and the employees were freaked out. I ran away from there to not back never ever.

4.description: Food is awesome. No complaints there. The only thing that sucks about this location is the customer service and the drive thru. They have the worst ever. You know it's bad if you have to debate between eating or having to deal with a bitch with an attitude!

1.description: I felt safe because of the bullet resistant glass.

2.description: This Chinese restaurant is the bomb! I have them on speed dial. I usually order the general tso chicken, pepper steak, beef and broccoli, the list goes on and on. This is my favorite Chinese restaurant in the hood, make sure you get the lunch or combination special, you get more for your buck.

0.description: Only a few vegetarian options but the few they have are good. I love the hot and sour soup without the pork.

3.description: I tried the Fried Lobster dinner and the 1lb fried shrimp....first off the Lobster was delish!  Tender and Moist ..not overcookedGreat fries (hand cut and not to greasy)the Shrimp were large and perfectly cooked and the breading was good..needs alittle more seasoning but overall very tasty and a great pound count .Good Job!

1.description: I went to the new location on 2236 E. 71st for the Grand Opening today. First time having fried Lobster and let me tell you Surf's Up hits it out the park... Seasoned and cooked to perfection. I enjoyed every bite. The staff was very friendly and helpful in describing the food on the menu! This is is spot to frequent if you are looking for good seafood!!!!!

2.description: This place is awesome. I love the customer service. The gentleman behind the counter surprised me when he told me that he had already put my condiments in my bag. He said it with a smile , which I loved. The food is great. Support this working class family.  They have something good going on here.

5.description: Deelish! The Fried Lobster is Amazing!

6.description: Great food, good people and on Sundays get the peach cobbler:-)

7.description: I had the catfish, the fish tacos, the fried green tomatoes and the fried biscuits.  Everything was well seasoned and tasted great. I will definitely be back.

0.description: I am rarely one to post reviews however, I said that I would start giving credit where credit is due.  sooooo, here goes.I found a card on my car's windshield that was advertising a grand opening for a new seafood restaurant near my job.  I saw fried lobster and wanted to go that day!!  I called the number and received a voice mail saying no one was available.  After driving past there, I noticed there was paper still in the window.  BUMMER!  The next day, one of the tenants from the building and came in raving about a new seafood restaurant on 71st.  When I told her it wasn't open yet, she told me that it was their grand opening day.  Later that evening, I called to order the fried lobster and the voice on the other end said "We just ran out of lobster"  BUMMER, again.Lo and behold, I decided to give them a try yesterday and let me tell you, the 3rd time was the charm. (almost).  I ordered the fried lobster and fried green tomatoes.  Deelish.  My only complaint was that my fries were wayyyyyyyy undercooked.  I called the restaurant back and was quickly and sincerely apologized to by the owner.  I decided to try something different today so  I called my order in.  2 wings and 1/4 pound of shrimp.  When I got to the register, he gave me my total and of course I was shocked.  He thought I asked for a pound of shrimp.Long story short, the owner was sitting at the counter and heard.  She was very accommodating and that's when I told her I was the girl that she had spoken with about the fries.  She explained what happened and what they were doing to rectify the situation.  The fries were really the least of my concern, as my mouth was watering for the SURF.All in all my experience was fantastic.  Great to have a seafood restaurant IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD that is not a chain owned by foreigners (Sharks/Baba's/J&J's) where you have to cover everything in lemon pepper and mild sauce for it to taste good.  Everything (except the fries) was cooked to perfection and seasoned perfectly, the customer service is impeccable (rare in the black community) and is BLACK OWNED to boot.   They have found a repeat customer in me and best believe, I will be spreading the word.

4.description: So I have tried many seafood restaurants in many places. Surfs up is top shelf. Love the fried lobster and the fried green tomatoes. They were just like my momma used to fix. Greens were great. I will be eating there often!
